Jherome is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional bread and beverages. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. 

About Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc. (HSPFI):

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bread and beverages

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David T. is married and lives with his family in Zestaponi District, in the village of Meore Sviri. David is 43 years old. He has two children: a 16-year-old daughter and a 14-year-old son. Both of them go to school. Agricultural activities are the main source of income for the family. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese. The cheese is sold on the local market. The family also has a vineyard, 0.8 ha. The sale of grapes is an additional seasonal source of income. Along with the above-mentioned, the family runs small poultry farm. The chickens are sold every 40-50 days.  

With the requested amount David plans to expand the poultry farm. He will purchase chickens and feed for them. This will result in increased sales and thus increased income for the family. The increase in income will be used for renovation of their house.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Magelene

texts.en:
Magelene is 42 years old and married, with one child.  Magelene works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 100,00 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like sardines, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Magelene has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari-sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.  Magelene aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a widow with four children. She provides for the basic needs of her family by selling kenkey, a popular Ghanaian staple made from fermented maize dough and usually eaten with pepper sauce and fried fish. Comfort sells kenkey at Amoanda near Elmina. 

Comfort is requesting a loan to buy bags of maize to expand her kenkey business. She hopes to use the profits from her business to provide an education for her children. Comfort knows that education is now the key to success.

loans.use: to buy maize and expand her kenkey business

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, pequeño comerciante, se dedica a la venta de bolis, gelatina, leña y frijoles, con once años de experiencia en su negocio propio, iniciando con una pequeña pulpería, y que ahora vende más bolis y granos básicos, siendo de mayor demanda de sus clientes.
Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien es comerciante, ya que tienen la responsabilidad de apoyar  a sus tres hijos estudiantes.
Pedro desea comprar un freezer más ya que el que compro anteriormente le ha estado dando problemas, y desea reparación, mientras tanto, es de gran relevancia ya que sus productos son de refrigeración. Lo cual hoy le es posible por medio del financiamiento que Afodenic le otorgara, siendo su tercer ciclo de crédito en donde ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos al vender más sus productos.
texts.en:
Pedro is a small businessman who sells ice pops, jello, firewood and beans.  He has eleven years experience in this business.  He started out with a small grocery store and now he also sells ice pops and basic grains which are in greatest demand amongst his customers.

Pedro has the support of his wife who is also a salesperson.  Together they are responsible for the support of their three children who are in school.

Pedro would like to buy an additional freezer since the one he bought previously is experiencing problems and needs to be repaired.  This is really important since Pedro's products need refrigerating.  Pedro will achieve this through a loan from Afodenic.  This is his third loan cycle.  Through his loans, he has managed to make more income by selling more products.

loans.use: to invest in a freezer in which he can keep his ice pops and jellos

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita  is now 50 years of age and is married with three adult-aged children. Clarita is a farmer working in the Philippines, and she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. 

Clarita is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase breeding livestock and feeds. She grows hogs and has been doing it for almost a year.

In the future, Clarita hopes to raise more pigs to earn more income for the sake of her family and for their future. She believes that she can be able to attain her business goals through the continuous support and assistance of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock and feeds.

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Annet has a stone quarrying business, which she has run for seven years. She has a second business raising pigs for resale.
To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase quarried stones for resale and pig feed. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to own a poultry farm.
Annet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase quarried stones for resale and pig feed.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
La señora Betty es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Del 2000 del Distrito Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 56 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 4 hijos (todos mayores D. edad).
Son cuatro años que viene trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la venta D. pescado seco, que los compra por el rio para luego venderlos en un almacén D. la ciudad, cuando tiene pedidos los lleva a su casa para vender a sus vecinos.
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 4 sacos D. pescado.
Solo tiene un hijo a su cargo, su esposo es maestro jubilado y la acompaña en el nmegocio.
Manuela Ramos ha sabido direccionar a las socias en sus negocio y por eso están muy agradecidas.
texts.en:
Betty is a member of the "Mujeres del 2000" community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 56 years old, married, and has four grown-up children.

Betty has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years.  Her business is selling dried fish.  She buys the fish by the river and then sells them in a store in the city.  When she has orders, she takes the fish home to sell to her neighbors.

Betty will use this new loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy four sacks of fish.

Betty has only one child in her care.  Her husband is a retired teacher and he accompanies her in the business.

Manuela Ramos have known how to guiD. their borrowers in their businesses and they are very grateful for that.

loans.use: to buy dried fish

loans.name: Momogul

texts.ru: Момогул проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 46 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Муж, работает таксистом. Сама она занимается торговлей. Она рядом с домом открыла минимаркет. В этой области Момогул уже 8 лет. Она берет кредит для приобретения нового холодильника и молочных продуктов.
texts.en: Momogul lives in the city of Vahdat.  She is 46 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Momogul is involved in retail sales.  She opened a mini-market near her house.  Momogul has been in this business for eight years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new refrigerator and dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator and dairy products

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a forty six year old married man with six children.  He owns a house in Kasese,Uganda. He takes care of the family with the help of his wife who is also a farmer. Their dream is to see their children graduate since  they did not get a chance to further their education.

Joseph has been in the farming business for thirty years and this has allowed him to provide for the basic needs of the family. His challenge is seasonal variations. His vision for the future is  to do commercial farming and to set up a modern food store.

Joseph is requesting a loan to buy pesticides and plow land.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and plow land

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, un joven de 24 años de edad, es originario de Malpaisillo municipio de León, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, es el comerciante, dueño de una pequeña pulpería aunque el estudia su segundo año de la carrera de arquitectura. El empezó este negocio hace dos años y medio con ayuda de su hermano el lo motivo a tener su negocio propio y así ayudarse a pagar sus estudios universitarios y mantener a su familia. 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar productos tales como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, maíz, huevo, leche para surtir su pulpería. De esta manera podrá mantener surtida su pulpería de productos que demandan sus clientes, espera mejorar sus ventas.
Una de sus principales metas es convertir su pequeña pulpería en una gran distribuidora de alimento sin dejar atrás su carrera de arquitectura pero siendo su prioridad numero uno el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Juan, a 24 year old young man, is a native of Malpaisillo, in the municipality of León. He has a 3 year old son. He is a trader, owner of a small grocery store even though he's in his second year of studies for a career in architecture. He began this business two and a half years ago with the help of his brother. He motivated him to have his own business and help himself pay for his university studies and support his family.

He needs the loan in order to purchase products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, eggs and milk to stock his store. In this way, he will be able to ensure that his store is stocked with products that his customers demand. He hopes to improve his sales.

One of his main goals is to convert his small store into a big distributor of food without neglecting his architecture career. However, the wellbeing of his son is his number one priority.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, corn, eggs, and milk to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en: Astghik is from the village of Vahramaberd in the Shirak region of Armenia. She is the proud mother of a 29-year-old daughter and a 25-year-old son. Astghik has a high school education. She has been farming with her husband for 20 years. She is working hard to grow her business and save money for the future. Astghik would like a loan to purchase feed for the livestock and fuel for the harvesting machinery. This investment should increase the family income by 10%. She is pleased with the microfinance services available to her and the assistance meeting the family’s financial needs. With limited economic opportunities in Vahramaberd, most of the villagers are engaged in farming. Astghik enjoys the rural lifestyle and living near her close relatives.

loans.use: to purchase feed and fuel

loans.name: Las Prosperas De Carabayllo Group

texts.es: La señora Maria Luz es soltera tiene 40 años y no tiene hijos,pertenece alalcom "Las Prosperas de Carabayllo" su cargo es de Tesorera,tiene aproximadamente vendiendo cinco años, con esto cubre sus gastos personales y tambien apoya a su mami que es una persona anciana. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y tener su propio local en donde vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Luz is single.  She is 40 years old and doesn't have children.  She belongs to the Communal Bank "Las Prosperas de Carabayllo", where she is the Treasurer.

She has been selling beauty products for approximately five years, which covers her personal expenses and also supports her mom who is elderly.

Her goal is to be able to continue working and have her own premises for selling her products.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Herlenbaatar

texts.en: Herlenbaatar is 45 years old and lives with his wife and son in a 'ger', a Mongolian yurt, in Dundgovi province of Mongolia. He started his business in 1990 by making home equipment and tools out of steel. He has many years of work experience and has many regular customers such as shopkeepers. He mentions that working outside during the winter is very difficult. He is planning to expand his business operation by opening his workplace and office. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I am doing my best to live well. I want to have a workplace so that I can increase my income and business." He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to buy equipment and materials to build a workplace.

loans.use: To buy equipment and materials to build a workplace.

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en:
Filipina is 51 years old and married. She is peacefully living within the local community of Dumabato Sur, Maddela. Filipina has been blessed with two children.

Filipina has been involved in her hog-raising business for almost 10 years. She is happy because her piglets are doing well. Everyday, she feeds them regularly for their optimum growth. One thing she is thankful for is the improvement of their living conditions. She aims to improve her hog-raising business to be able to help her husband in generating more income to cover all their household expenses. To be able to achieve her goal, she is requesting financial assistance amounting to P20,000 to purchase feed for her hogs.

She would be thankful if her loan request is granted and she can further provide for the financial needs of her children and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed to raise hogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: In the picture above, Sophia has a pot of water on the fire getting ready for the kenkey. She is married and has one child. Sophia sells kenkey in Ayensudu near Elmina. Her husband is a driver. Sophia helps her husband to educate, feed and clothe her children. Sophia will use this loan to procure more bags of maize to cook. Sophia plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business for further growth.

loans.use: to procure more bags of maize to cook.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is from Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 57 years old. Leonarda is married and has nine school-aged children. To make a living, Leonarda owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leonarda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leonarda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Leonarda is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery goods to sell . She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 52 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is single and has four children between 23 and 28 years old. They are currently in school and live at home. 

For the past years she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in the community. So she can make more profit and have more customers, she is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, coal, and oil for her business. She hopes to change her business to a bar and restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, coal, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Wema Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Wema Group in Western Kenya! Agnes is the facilitator of the Wema group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Agnes takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Agnes had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Agnes was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Agnes and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Agnes will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wema group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Agnes and her group members with the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is twenty-four years old and lives in Dullan, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is single. 

Rosalie has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Rosalie has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Sra. Claudelina, que anteriormente se encontraba dentro de otro grupo pero por cuestiones tuvo que abandonarlo, decidió formar un grupo nuevo, con el cual se ha mantenido hasta. Ella comenta que se inspiro en la idea de producir un bien para ellas y sus familias.
Claudelina se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, en lo cual le va muy bien, puesto que siempre tiene mucha variedad, lo cual le ayuda a atraer a los clientes. Gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia y generar los ingresos necesarios.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene. Agradece a la fundación y kiva por la oportunidad que les da, ya que es una ayuda importante.
texts.en:
This community bank was formed thanks to Señora Claudelina, who in the past was part of another group but had to leave it because of some problems. She decided to form a new group, which she is still a part of. She comments that she was inspired by the idea of producing a benefit for them (her fellow bank members) and their families.

Claudelina sells clothing of all types, and this business has gone very well for her, since she always has a lot of variety, which helps her attract customers. Thanks to her work she has been able to help her family and generate the necessary income.

She is applying for the loan to buy clothing, with which she will be able to stock her business and fill the orders that she has. She is thankful to the Foundation and to Kiva for giving them this opportunity, since it is an important help.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Zeynab

texts.ru:
Zeynab zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda , seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione v posolke Bala Bakhmanli vmeste so sovyey semyoy. Zeynab 44 qoda. 
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit tovari dlya prodaji v svayom magazine. Zeynab 5 let nazad otkrila etot maqazin qde prodayet mnogo raznix tovarov dlya domashnego upodrebleniya( nojnicci, lampi, tarelki i t.d)
texts.en: Zeynab is married and has one child.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives with her family in the Bala Bakhmanli village in the Fuzuli region.  Zeynab is 44 years old.  She currently needs 2000 AZN to purchase merchandise for sale at her store.  Zeynab opened this store, where she sells many different goods for home use (scissors, lamps, plates, etc.), five years ago.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for sale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 34 years old. She is widowed and has no children but supports her younger sister. She runs a private primary school. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns a monthly income of KES 60,000.

She is borrowing her first loan from KADET Ltd of KES 30,000 which she intends to use to purchase more desks for the pupils. She plans to buy land for the school with the anticipated profit.

Her hopes and dreams are to acquire more land for the school and to improve the playground.

loans.use: To repair classrooms and to purchase desks.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is in the business of running a sari-sari (variety) store. At 52 years of age, half of her life has already been given in manipulating her source of income. It is the main source of providing for the needs of her three children. Now she wants to improve her sari-sari store and build up a new business -- specifically, a hog-fattening business. 

In connection to this, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos to buy groceries, such as canned goods and soft drinks, and two piglets. Hopefully, she can successfully build her new business as well as her current business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, such as canned goods and soft drinks, and two piglets.

loans.name: Benkagni Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKAGNI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TAGAN, un des villages de SELINGUE, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxieme  prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec SARATA , 1 ere debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de TAGAN, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is starting a new business based on the skills she learned at the Mifex MERIT Centers. At our training facilities she participated in a course where she learned arts and crafts. Specifically she will be making party and house decorations. She is already selling the products she makes but she her growth is restrained because she cannot afford materials. She is seeking this small loan in order to buy: scissors, glue, a glue gun and other decorative items. Her husband motivated to take the course and supports her in her business venture. She hopes that she can begin to contribute to her family income in order to provide for her 3 children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She is seeking this small loan in order to buy: scissors, glue, a glue gun and other decorative items.

loans.name: Rosalba Irene

texts.en:
Rosalba is married and her husband Jorge works as a taxi driver due to the low employment rate in the country. They have a son of 20 years of age and a daughter aged 9. She started her business selling foods 15 years ago, with the goal of helping her husband and giving her daughter a good education. Their son works to finance his own studies. Rosalba sells her products from her home's garage and she owns a car that so that she can take her products on the road, allowing her to increase the demand of her products. She requests a loan in the amount of $375 for the purchase of ingredients to continue expanding her business, and make it possible for her to give her daughter the education she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Linig, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosalba es casada, su esposo Jorge debido a la falta de empleo en el país trabaja como chofer de un taxi, actualmente tienen un hijo de 20 años y una niña de 9. Ella inició con su negocio de venta de comida desde hace 15 años, con el objetivo de apoyar a su esposo y para ofrecerle una buena educación a su hija, ya que su hijo mayor trabaja para financiarse sus estudios. Rosalba vende sus productos en la cochera de su casa y tiene un carrito ambulante equipado, esto la ha ayudado a incrementar un poco su demanda por lo que solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de $375 dólares para la compra de insumos necesarios en la elaboración de sus productos y continuar creciendo con su negocio y ofrecerle la educación que espera a su niña.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther would like to set up a business of selling second-hand clothes

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.en: Yuriy D. is a friendly young businessman from Zaporoshie, Ukraine. Three years ago he started a small sales business selling light bulbs and small electronics at one of the large outdoor markets in Zaporoshie. Smart advertising and friendly service have helped attract many customers to his two sales locations. Yuriy designed small marketing flyers to distribute in the market that have done an excellent job of bringing in new clients. Yuriy has requested a loan of $800 to help him purchase a supply of new, energy-efficient light bulbs to sell in his kiosks.

loans.use: Purchase new type of light bulb

loans.name: Faaea

texts.en: Faaea has been a member of Mulivai Leauvaa centre for a long time. She is now 65 years old, but still has a feeling of wanting to support her family by doing her own gardening as a business, plus the help from her sons who work a taro plantation. Faaea sells 10-15 pineapples a day to the people of her own village and she goes to the market to sell more twice a month.

loans.use: To purchase gardening supplies

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses C. is a 24 year old trader. He resides in a slum area just outside Mombasa. He started the business six years ago because he was unable to raise funds to pay for senior school expenses. The trade involves moving around the city center on foot selling an assortment of electronic appliances and clothes. He also has a small stall where he operates. The merchandise he sells is cheap and the electronics are of the latest technology hence appealing to the customers who buy from him. His earning are however barely sufficient to cater satisfactorily for his basic needs since he is required to pay for license fees on a daily basis thus reducing his income. Also, during the rainy season, his movement is restricted thus he cannot make good sales. He would like to increase his income base so that he can uplift his lifestyle as well as advance his business towards growth. He is therefore requesting for a loan of US $ 600 to assist him in boosting his business. His budget is US $300 to purchase more electronic goods and US$300 to purchase clothes for sale. Moses is an industrious businessman and is quite experienced in his line of trade hence he is certain to make good gains out of it enabling him to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic goods and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy O. is a 38-year-old widow and a mother of 4, and comes from the Ajamgbadin area of Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and drinks to people in her community. She has been in business since 2001.

She requests a loan of $450 to buy more food and drinks to sell. She said it will help her customers if she can offer more for them.

loans.use: Buy drinks and food to sell

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en: Betty is 27 years old and divorced with four children. She plans to build more pig sties with the extra profits from her current business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya D. is married with a daughter who is now grown-up Her family lives in Zaporozhye. Natalya sells clothing in the local market called Krytyi (Covered market). She offers affordable merchandise at reasonable prices and invests much time in the development of her business. Natalya currently has about $3000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit amounts to $600.

Natalya is requesting a loan of $1200 to help increase her sales and profits as a result. She is hoping to invest generated profits into the further expansion of her venture and open one more vending facility. We believe her responsible approach to business and this current financial assistance will be beneficial for Natalya’s business by keeping it competitive and promoting growth so that it will continue to provide necessary income for her and her family.

loans.use: To increase her profits

loans.name: Edina's Tanganyika B Group

texts.en:
Edina is 29 years old and is married with 2 sons (ages 4 and 8). She sells fabric and sarongs from 11am to 4pm daily and makes a monthly profit of about $45.

In the past, Edina took a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more fabrics to sell. Having paid this back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan to open a shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup whose members have businesses dealing in meat, food, and clothing sales.

loans.use: To open a shop for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 2 color TVs, 1 Nintendo Playstation and 5 chairs.

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en:
Vadim is a businessman from Kherson who sells sports footwear in the central city market. Over the last 10 years, Vadim has successfully increased his business to establish a stable income. With rich market experience in the sphere of trade and an enterprising spirit, Vadim has expanded his business to build $2000 in inventory and to where he makes $300 in net profit each month.

Currently, Vadim is seeking a loan of 2500 Grivnas ($US525) to increase assorted merchandise. With the increased profits from additional sales, Vadim hopes to expand his business even further. Eventually he would love to invest additional profits in new business projects.

We believe Vadim’s disciplined, analytical approach, flexibility of thinking, innovative methods, stress resistance and great business aspirations will guarantee the consistent growth of his venture and success in all his entrepreneurial endeavors.

loans.use: Purchase assorted merchandise for his shoe sales.

loans.name: Shani Ngatula's Tushirikiane Group

texts.en:
Shani, age 54, is a widow and has nine children. She runs a clothing business and a chicken business to provide for her family. She started selling clothing in 1995, while she started the chicken business recently with a previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. From her businesses, she is able to make about $85 a month. She works from 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily.

In the past, Shani took three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania and repaid them successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to buy more clothing, chicks, and chicken feed to increase her businesses.

In the picture, Shani is third from the left.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell, plus chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina is a mother of two young children who attend school. Her priority is to make sure her children have everything they need, and so Rufina helps her husband with the household costs. She works in the fields and her husband work in a mine. The agricultural work is very tiring, as the zone they live in is jungle and the climate is very hot. Rufina needs to walk for many hours in the heat, preparing the land. But she is a hard working woman and keeps her motivation up even in the heat.

In order to generate more income for her family, Rufina wants to open a small nursury, where she can grow coffee and other products. She is requesting a loan to fund this business. She needs to buy new plants, cultivate them and wait for them to mature. The sale of these new products will help improve the quality of life for this family.

Rufina es una mujer con dos hijos que todavía van a la escuela de menores, quienes son su adoración. Cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos, son la prioridad para ella y por esto apoya a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Ella trabaja en el campo, mientras su pareja lo hace en una mina. Como agricultora, Rufina señala que su labor es muy cansada, porque la zona donde vive es selva, y el clima es terriblemente caluroso, ella tiene que caminar durante varias horas limpiando sus tierras y preparando el terreno. Pero no se siente desanimada pese a la sobrecargada labor que realiza, definitivamente es una mujer muy trabajadora. Para generar más ingresos para su familia, Rufina quiere implementar un vivero, donde se dedique a la producción de café y otros productos adicionales, para esto es que solicita un préstamo. Debe comprar nuevas plantas, cuidar de ellas y esperar que produzcan. La venta de estos nuevos productos mejorará la calidad de vida de esta familia.

loans.use: TO SET UP A SMALL PLOT OF LAND WHERE SHE CAN CULTIVATE COFFEE AND OTHER PRODUCTS TO SELL.  THE EXTRA INCOME WILL HELP WITH THE HOUSEHOLD COSTS AND QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos is 32 yeas old and has a two year old son who is his motivation to keep moving forward. He lives with his wife Rosibel, who supports him in everything, and both have a goal that through their hard work and effort, their son will someday study to be a good professional.

Carlos has worked driving passengers for 8 years, and thanks to his good money management, he now owns two moto-cars, which help him strengthen his household finances. His wife, Rosibel, works taking care of their farm and brings their crops to a market stall in their area to sell. Carlos does not have set work hours and he doesn’t have a problem with that as everything is going well.

He is requesting a loan in order to repair one of his moto-cars, buy spare parts and some parts that will make his job tools work. In addition, he would like to work selling groceries and have a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Carlos, de 32 años es padre de un niño 2 añitos que es su motor para seguir adelante. Vive junto a su esposa Rosibel quien lo apoya en todo, ambos tienen una finalidad, y que mediante el trabajo y esfuerzo que desempeñan su hijo estudie par ser algún día un buen profesional.

Carlos se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 8 años, gracias a su buena administración del dinero, ahora es propietario de dos motocarros, lo que le ayuda a fortalecer la economía de su hogar, Rosibel, su esposa, se dedica al cuidado de su chacra y lleva a vender sus productos a un puesto del mercado de su zona. Carlos no tiene horario de trabajo establecido y no tiene problemas con ello ya que todo le está saliendo muy bien.

Solicita este préstamo para reparar uno de sus motocarros, comprar repuestos y algunas piezas que harán que su herramienta de trabajo funcione. Adicionalmente quiere dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes y tener su bodega.

loans.use: Repair one of his moto-cars and open a small general store.

loans.name: Bazira Women's Group

texts.en:
Madina N. is a widow with 10 children of whom 4 are still at school under her care. She is also looking after 2 grand-daughters whose father (her son) developed a mental illness and their mother had to leave them to her care.

Madina has been a farmer all her life, having bean, sweet potato, cassava, and matooke plantations. The produce she gets she has been selling on the local market in her village.

About 5 to 6 years ago, she started up a retail shop to complement her earnings and it has been of great help for her and her family. She is so grateful for the loans given her which she mostly uses to buy high-quality seeds and fertilizers plus employing some labour on the land that that her husband left her, especially when her children are at school.

Madina has an immediate plan of buying eggs from poultry farmers for re-sale but would very much want to keep layers herself if she had the capital, as this would bring in more profit. Madina has a dream of one day being able to transport her produce to Kampala where the prices are a bit more favorable, so as to earn increased income and have savings.

Madina has been chairperson for her lending group of Bazira for 9 years and she says that all her group members are farmers, mostly growing the mairungi plant that is used as tea leaves and is a delicacy for most people in the city centres. Thanks to their fertile soil, their farming is more possible.

loans.use: to help with buying seeds for her farm and sugar, soap, salt, and parrafin for her shop

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña Juana G. es una clienteque tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad que no dependen de ella, su esposo no trabaja pero le ayuda en el desarrollo del negocio, Doña Juana tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la Elaboracion y venta de tortillas, refrescos naturales, frijoles cosidos y gasesa, Esta microempresaria sufrio los embates del Uracan MICHT, donde se dio el deslabe el cerro casita de donde proviene, pero con el deseo de querer salir adelante y obtener una fuente de ingresos dio inicio en este negocio con el cual a la fecha es su unica fuente de ingresos ya que su experiencia estaba en la gricultura y al perderlo todo dio un giro a su vida ahora en la ciudad.
Con el apoyo de los creditos ha salido adelante y en la actualidad trabaja con creditos con el objetivo de poder adquirir materia prima relacionada con su actividad siendo esta la venta de frijoles cosidos tal y como se menciono anteriormente, su deseo es poder mas adelante poner una pulperia por consiguiente ampliar su negocio, teniendo la fe que saldra adelante y espera contar con el apoyo de manos amigas que le ayuden en sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Ms. Juana G. is a 51-year-old client who is married and has 4 grown up children who no longer depend on her. Her husband does not work, but he helps her with the development of the business. Ms. G. has been making and selling tortillas, fresh beverages, baked beans, and soft drinks for 10 years. This small business suffered the battering of Hurricane Mitch, during which time there was a mudslide on the hill where her house is located. Nevertheless, with the desire to press forward and to obtain a source of income, she started this business, which is currently her only source of income. She used to be involved in agriculture, but upon losing everything, her life turned around completely. With the support from the loans, she has been able to get ahead. She is currently requesting this loan with the aim of being able to purchase the ingredients needed to make baked beans. Her wish is to be able to set up a general store and expand her business in the future. She has faith that she will move forward, and she hopes to count on the support of friendly hands that will help her with her plans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Mol

texts.en:
Mrs. Mol Y. was born in 1961 and now lives in Boeng Tranh village in Takeo Province. She is the mother of five children: one is a construction worker and the other four children are enrolled in school. She is a pig breeder, and her husband, Mr. Noup Roeun (on the right in the photo), runs a transport service for passengers and goods with a motorbike.

Even though they have several different businesses, their family does not have much money to support their living conditions. Thus Mrs. Mol Y. has decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets and more pig food to improve her breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy four piglets and more pig food to improve her breeding business.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Do Thi S.  is 50 years old. She is married with three children, two of whom are grown. She has been a member of the TYM Fund since 2007. Her main income is raising pigs and growing rice. Her husband is a physician and his income gives the family a stable income. With an income of about 2.5 millionVND/month her family’s life is improving more and more. Do Thi would like a second loan of 6 millionVND ($375USD) to buy more pigs to raise.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.ru:
Мирзорахимов Абдукахор мужчина в возросте 50 лет имеет четверых детей занимается продажей продуктов питания на рынке города Худжанда.Сам Абдукахор со времён Союза занимается торговлей. Он сам по профессии продавец.
 У него на сегодняшний день небольшой лорёк, на базаре "Рохи абрешим"
Под новый год Абдукахор хочет взяв кредит пополнить новогодний ассортимент подарков и шоколадной продукции.По бизнесу вовремя отсутствия Абдукахора ему помогает его жена.Он благодарен всем инвесторам за поддержку.
texts.en:
Abdukahor M. is a 50 year old man with four children who sells groceries at a market in the city of Khujand. He has been in sales since Soviet times; it is his profession. Today he has a small market stall at the Rokhi Abreshim market. Abdukahor would like to obtain a loan before New Year to fill out his supply of presents and chocolates. When he is out his wife helps with the business. He is grateful to all of the investors for their support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ruth se dedica la venta de cosméticos de diversas marcas y también de productos naturales. No hace mucho ha abierto una oficina fuera de su casa para brindar capacitación sobre emprender negocios y charlas de salud, esto con el objetivo de inscribir más clientes en su negocio de venta de productos naturales, ya que esta se sostiene en una red comercial.

Actualmente, ya lleva diez años vendiendo productos naturales junto con su esposo. Anteriormente se dedicaba a manejar un centro educativo en su casa.

Gracias a su constante empeño y esfuerzo no solo ha crecido en su negocio sino también ha podido terminar de construir su casa. Le gustaría en un futuro brindar talleres de diseño en su casa y poder enseñar todo lo que ella aprendió en sus estudios de diseño de modas.
texts.en:
Ruth sells natural products and cosmetics of different makes. She recently opened an office outside her house in order to offer training to others starting their own businesses and advice about health matters. Her objective is to attract more customers for her natural products business because that's the best way to maintain a commercial network. She's been selling natural products, together with her husband, for ten years. Before that, she made a living operating an education center in her house. Thanks to her dedication and effort, her business has not only grown but she's been able to finish building her house. In the future, she would like to offer design classes so that she can teach everything that she's learned about fashion design.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Dayandur

texts.en:
Dayandur G. is a hard-working man who strives every day to provide for his entire family, which consists of his wife and four children. He manages a grocery store where he has been selling many staples, such as flour, juice, sweets, and other preserved foods for more than 20 years.

Dayandur has attracted a strong base of customers who are impressed by his efforts to travel to neighboring cities to purchase especially valuable items. In order to purchase additional foodstuffs and increase his inventory, Dayandur is requesting a loan of $1200 USD.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Mussarat Riasat Ali Group

texts.en:
Mussarat baji, 28, is married and has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 5 years. Mussarat baji is the wife of R. A. who is a carpenter and makes wooden furniture to order. Mussarat baji is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children attend the local school. Mussarat baji is a very hardworking lady. She prepares embroidered dresses and charges $3 per dress. She uses her income to pay her children's school fees. She is applying for a loan to buy material (wood and furniture polish) so her husband can complete the orders of his customers. 

She is the group leader of the following women:
Mukhtaran baji, who wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 
Zahida parveen and Suraiya baji, who each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shops. 
Sakina baji, who wants a loan to buy wood to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for making furniture

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La Sra. Rufina V. es una cliente antigua anteriormente ha estado trabajando con Créditos de bancos de emprendimiento, ahora solo trabaja con el crédito individual rural que generalmente saca para sus cultivos.
El lugar donde siembra es la comunidad de San Pedro entrando 10km. De puerto rico, es el lugar donde siembra y donde ahora quiere producir yuca y perejil.
Ella vive en Puerto rico con su esposo el Sr. Ciprian Andia y sus dos hijos. Todos los dias se desplazan a sus sembradios recorriendo aproximadamente, entre ida y vuelta 20 Km. distncia que lo realizan caminando.
texts.en:
Rufina V. is a long time client of Creditos de Bancos de Emprendimiento (Kiva Field Partner). She now acquires only the rural individual credit that she generally uses for her plantations.

The place where she cultivates is the community of San Pedro, about 10 Km from Puerto Rico. This is where she can plant and harvest yuca and parsley.

She lives in Puerto Rico with her husband, Mr. Ciprian Andia, and their two children. Every day they go to their plantations, travelling about 20 Km to get there and back, covering this distance on foot.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the production of parsley and yuca.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing the necessary materials for his work

loans.name: Marlene Beatriz

texts.es: Marlene Beatriz C. de 30 años de edad reside en Soyapango junto a su pequeña hija de tres años de edad y su compañero de vida. Ella posee una pupusería en la cual junto a su esposo trabajan arduamente para poder obtener una vida mejor para ellos y su hija. Marlene solicita un préstamo a través del cual obtenga el capital necesario para invertir en su negocio y comprar maíz y frijoles lo cual se utilizara para elaborar las pupusas, ella comercializa sus pupusas frente a su casa y logra vender una buena cantidad la cual les permite cubrir algunos gastos del hogar, es por ello que ella desea mejorar las ventas de su negocio, para lograr obtener más ganancias que le permitan tener una vida mejor junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Marlene Beatriz C. is 30 years old and lives in Soyapango with her husband and 3 year old daughter. She has a food stand that she and her husband work very hard at in order to obtain a better life for them and their daughter. Marlene would like a loan in order to obtain the necessary capital to invest in her business and purchase corn and beans for "pupusas". She sells the pupusas in front of her house and sells a lot of them in order to cover the household bills. She would like to increase her sales, which would allow her and her family to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans and corn

loans.name: Gulnaz Abdul Razaq Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz baji is a very hardworking and a very devoted lady. She has lived in a city named Multan in Pakistan for the past 10 years. She prepares embroidered dresses for her husband’s boutique so he is able to display them and earn income. Her husband is very happy with her support. She is applying for a loan to buy materials (colored thread, sketches and cloth) to increase the profit of her husband’s boutique.

She is the group leader of two other women from her area. Najma baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy materials (colored thread, sketches and cloth) to make embroidered dresses for her boutique.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna D. is from the village of Southern Looc. Lorna, 56, is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a food stall where she sells herbs and spices. Lorna has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 44,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She used this previous loan to purchase additional inventory. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products. This loan will be her 26th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai A. is married and has seven dependents. He repairs electrical appliances and sells spare parts at Abotoase near Hohoe, which he has done for quite a long time. His wife is a trader. Abdulai uses his income to pay school fees for his children.

Abdulai will use the loan to buy more spare parts for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, he plans to reinvest to expand his business, to increase his capital base, and to increase his profit margin to enable him meet his financial obligations.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa T., 53, has made a living an entrepreneur for the last six years. Her husband Dante, 56, works as a paper stripper for a prominent publishing house in Manila and they have three children, all but one of whom have finished their schooling.

Luisa manages a fairly large variety store which started as a small stall but now features many different kinds of products, including a small snack cart. She also makes peanut butter, which she sells to her neighbors and nearby stores.

She used a recent loan to build up her store's inventories and expand it to include school supplies and "mami", a local hot-pot noodle soup.

Ma. Luisa is the coordinator for Fellowship-5, one of CCT's pioneer community groups, which she joined in 2004.  CCT is a Filipino family-oriented, Bible-centered development organization that provides and creates business opportunities for small-scale Filipino entrepreneurs through loans and social interventions.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell from her variety store

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth C. lives in the town of Lantay,Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old, married, has six school-aged children and makes a living running a sari-sari (or variety) store. Jeneth just started this business, but is confident that she will be successful selling various items to the people of her community.

Earlier this year, Jeneth joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy items to sell and expand the range of goods available in her store. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to educate her children and improve her family's living standards. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan E. is from the town of Aloran. She is 30 years old. Joan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joan raises and sells pigs. Joan is just starting this business.

In 2009, Joan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joan has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Joan is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Joan's 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Jovilyn

texts.en:
Jovilyn I. is from the town of Dumalinao. She is 24 years old. Jovilyn is single and has 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Jovilyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovilyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1200.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jovilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovilyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jovilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old. She is a resident of Rizal, Santiago City, Isabela. She is engaged in a fruit juice making business called Sweet-O, and it is already registered in the Department of Trade and Industry (DTI). She learned the manufacturing business from training that she attended previously. The business is going well, however, she still needs additional capital to meet the demand of her customers. For this reason, Gloria is asking for the support of Kiva lenders to provide her with a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital.

She hopes that her loan request will be granted. Gloria is married to Edgardo and they have three children. The eldest is June - 30 years old; Joy - 28 years old, and Jennifer - 25 years old; all of them are college graduates.

loans.use: working capital for her fruit juice business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal “Cuturapi” del centro poblado D. Cuturapi del Distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia del Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno; tiene 63 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada tiene 6 hijos, vive en Cuturapi sector Ventanilla y estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 8 años en otro Banco Comunal luego se vino a este, inicio su préstamo con la suma D. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio D. compra venta D. ropa.

En la actualidad requiere D. un nuevo préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ropa para su negocio en las ferias D. la zona, por toro lado se dedica tambien a la compra venta D. ganado mayor.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad.

loans.use: Para la compra de ropa.

loans.name: Maisa

texts.es:
Maisa tiene 23 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes siempre la ayudaron para salir adelante y lo que más desea es darle una buena vida a su pequeño hijo.
Los percances que Maisa ha sufrido, no han hecho que sus esfuerzos de mejorar su calidad de vida disminuyan, ni siquiera la quiebra reciente de su restaurante, ha hecho que deje de trabajar muy duro. Es por eso que decidió comprar, con los pocos ahorros que tenía, un carrito salchipapero (movil para la preparación y venta de salchipapas: salchichas y papas fritas), el cual le está dando muy buenos resultados, ya que le brinda los ingresos que necesita para vivir.

Lo que más le gusta de su nuevo trabajo es que tiene las mañanas libres para poder cuidar a su querido hijo, lleva 6 meses realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer hasta altas horas de la noche en la calle vendiendo. Con el paso del tiempo, espera poder comprar más aditamentos para su carrito salchipapero para poder vender otros platillos adicionales.

Este es el cuarto préstamo de Maisa con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos espera poder pagar a tiempo sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy alegre y siempre está pendiente de los acuerdos a los que se llegan en las reuniones de su grupo. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más ingredientes para realizar sus salchipapas.
texts.en:
Maisa, age 23, is a very hardworking and happy young woman. She lives in her parents’ house and they always helped her to get ahead. What she desires most is to give a good life to her little son.

The setbacks that Maisa has suffered haven’t diminished her efforts to improve her quality of life. Not even the recent failure of her restaurant has made her give up working very hard. That’s why she decided to use her small savings to buy a cart which allows the mobile preparation of “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes). This is giving her very good results since it provides her the income she needs to live. What she likes most about her new work is that she has the morning free in order to be able to care for her dear son. She has been in this business for 6 months and feels that the most difficult part is having to stay in the streets selling until very late at night. With the passage of time she hopes to be able to purchase more equipment for her cart in order to be able to sell other, additional dishes.

This is Maisa’s fourth loan with MFP, and, just as she did with her prior loans, she hopes to be able to make her payments on time. She is very happy in her communal bank and is always concerned about reaching the agreements which they arrive at in meetings of the group. With the one thousand soles she is applying for she will buy more ingredients for making her salchipapas.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for the preparation of her dishes

loans.name: Darlyn Yessenia

texts.en:
Darlyn is 26 years old and has two children, ages 8 and 3. Darlyn Yessenia has a small store, called a pulperia. She started her business six years ago when she began selling ice and beverages, then little by little she expanded her inventory to include staple foods and basic household items. Darlyn has established a good customer base, to whom she offers small credit lines. 

This loan will go towards the purchase of a new refrigerator so Darlyn can expand her inventory to include popsicles, soft drinks and meat. She will also buy more grains to replenish her stock. Her goal is to put in a floor in her  house, currently it is made of dirt. Darlyn is a very good client of Fundacion Leon 2000.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for storing perishable inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her café business

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La socia ZOILA  pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA” y es la presidenta.    

La socia tiene 49 años de edad, es divorciada. La socia vive en la distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia tiene un stand en el Mercado Vino Canchón de San Jerónimo  donde vende comida (Desayuno, almuerzo y Cena) y también se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos para preparar mas platos de comida y alimento para los animales que cría y después venderlos a un buen precio. De esta manera así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y para tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Zoila belongs to the Virgen Purificada-Angostura Communal Bank, and she is the president. She is 49 and divorced. She lives in the San Jerónimo district in the Angostura community, which is south of the city of Cusco. She has a stand in the Vino Canchón Market of San Jerónimo, where she sells food (breakfast, lunch, and dinner). She also raises guinea pigs and chickens. She has been working in the business for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She is an enterprising and hard-working mother who wants to get her family ahead. She needs the loan to buy supplies to make her dishes and to buy food for the animals she raises and later sells for a good price. This way she will be able to increase the capital in her business in order to have greater income. This will give her family a better quality of life. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make her dishes and to buy food for the animals she raises

loans.name: Luz Haydee

texts.es:
La señora LUZ HAYDEE R. D. L. tiene 60 años, vive en el distrito D. LAREDO, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LAREDO. La socia presenta estudios superiores técnicos D. corte y confección, es casada y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores e independientes. La socia se dedica a la confección D. ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar hilos, telas, cierres, etc. para confeccionar los uniformes D. las profesoras que tenía pendiente por atender.
Este crédito D. 1,500.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar telas, hilos, cierres, blondas, agujas, etc. para realizar los pedidos que tiene pendiente. Ella sueña con tener un taller D. costura amplio en donD. pueda realizar mas confecciones para trabajadores D. diferentes instituciones como: colegios, bancos, municipios, etc.
texts.en:
Luz Haydee R. D. L. is 60. She lives in the Laredo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Laredo Communal Bank. She has a post high school education in cutting out and making clothes. She is married and has five grown and independent children. She makes clothes for women, men, and children. With her first loan for 300 PEN she was able to buy thread, fabric, and zippers, etc. to make the order she had for uniforms for teachers. She will use this loan for 1,500 PEN to buy fabric, thread, zippers, lace, and pins, etc. to make the orders that she has. She dreams of having a large sewing shop where she can make more clothes for the workers in different institutions like schools, banks, and municipalities, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, zippers, and thread, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to two children. Both of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial community. 

Grace sells plantains (cooking bananas) and porridge. She buys the plantains from nearby farming communities and supplies them to food vendors and retailers in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell to suppliers. She has been in business for five years and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy plantains to sell

loans.name: Noverita

texts.en: N. Noverita, 40, is a successful businesswoman. She is married with two children. She has owned a retail shop for two years so far. She is using the loan to purchase retail items, such as rice, sugar, flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, eggs, soap, bread and so forth, for sale. She is aiming at expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, such as rice, sugar, flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, eggs, soap, bread and so forth, for sale.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en:
Imane is a 27-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has been working as a tailor for the past twelve years. She specializes in tailoring, sewing all type of textiles and wools.

Imane started this business when she was very young and now, after having twelve years of experience, she has became well known by her clients in the whole region.

Today, Imane is requesting $1,000 to buy an embroidery machine and tailoring supplies to offer a variety of products to her clients.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and tailoring supplies

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is 31 years old and married with three children. She has been running a shop for four years in the Kibera slums, where she sells a variety of goods. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned business discipline and record-keeping skills. She plans to add more stock with the loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings that she is requesting. She hopes to open a shop for selling clothes in the future. Mercy is very committed.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Nicolasa Antonia

texts.es: Nicolasa Antonia G. U. de 54 años de edad, reside en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su hija de 24 años de edad, la cual trabaja arduamente para poder ayudarle a su madre con todos los gastos del hogar, razón por la cual trabaja en un banco.  Nicolasa posee una venta de productos plásticos como canastas, masetas en diferentes tamaños, recipientes para colocar comida, recipientes grandes para colocar agua los cuales en El Salvador son llamados “guacales”, así mismo comercializa hoyas y cacerolas. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de Cojutepeque, lugar en el cual cuenta con muchos clientes. es por esto que Nicolasa desea poder aumentar sus productos, sobre todo para la Semana Santa, en la cual las personas se encuentran de vacaciones y realizan diferentes viajes tanto al interior como al exterior del país, lo que provoca un incremento en las ventas de Nicolasa debido a que se venden mucho los depósitos plásticos para colocar la comida, es por esta razón que ella desea estar equipada con todo lo necesario para obtener mejores ventas en este mes de abril. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, la cual se apoya junto a su hija para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nicolasa Antonia G. U., 54, lives in San Martín, San Salvador department with her 24-year-old daughter, who works hard as a bank employee to help her mother out with household expenses. Nicolasa sells plastic items like: baskets, different size flower pots, food recipients, large plastic container for water that in El Salvador are called "guacales." She also sells pots and pans. Her business is located in Cojutepeque's municipal market, a place that attracts many customers. For this reason, Nicolasa wants to increase her stock, especially for Holy Week, in which people are on vacation and travel both to the interior of the country and abroad, which brings about an increase in sales because people need a lot of plastic food containers. She wants to be well prepared and equipped with everything she might need so that her sales will be the best possible during April. She is a cheerful, hard-working woman who attempts to get ahead in life with her daughter's help.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic items.

loans.name: Kisindizi A Naluga Sylivia Group

texts.en:
Sylivia N. is a hardworking businesswoman of 25. She is married with three children, two of whom are going to school. She is a farmer and she has been carrying out farming activities for over six years. 

She is using the loan to purchase seeds, such as maize and beans, and to cultivate sweet potatoes, bananas, Irish potatoes and so forth. She is a promising and hardworking lady whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds such as maize and beans and to cultivate sweet potatoes, bananas, Irish potatoes, and so forth

loans.name: Michelle Amomonpon Group

texts.en:
Michelle A., 26, is from the village of Western Poblacion. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of a group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Michelle is married and has two small children. To make a living, she runs a store selling dried goods. Michelle is just starting this business.

In 2005, Michelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Michelle is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Michelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more underwear to sell

loans.name: Gerardo Darmiro

texts.es:
Gerardo de 46 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 9 años que estudian en escuelas fiscales. Por la falta de oportunidades y la desesperación de mantener a su familia, decidió invertir todos sus ahorros en arroz, azúcar y granos. 

Gerardo construyo en la parte delantera de su casa un pequeño puesto para ubicar los víveres que había comprando para vender. Poco a poco fue incrementado su capital para comprar mas víveres. Ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 20h00pm, vende el quintal de arroz a $ 36.00, la caja de aceites a $ 16.50, el paquete de pañales a $ 14.00. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, detergente, bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Gerardo is 46 years old and lives in the semiurban area of Fortin de Guayaquil; he has two children who are 9 and 10 and are in primary school. Since he had few other opportunities and was desperate to support his family, Gerardo invested his savings in rice, sugar and grains. Gerardo build a small stand in the front of his house to sell the food that he had purchased. Little by little he increased his capital to buy more food. Now he works from 6 am to 8 pm; he sell a quintal (46 kg) of rice for $36, a box of oil for $16.50 and a pack of diapers for $14. He will use the loan to buy rice, detergent, and drinks for his store. In the future, he would like to finish building his home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, detergent, drinks

loans.name: Felix Bayardo

texts.es: Félix Bayardo tiene la actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más 10 de años que tiene este negocio, pero al pasar el tiempo el decide ser comerciante minorista para que le den un puesto en el mercado cuando le dieron el puesto Poco a poco ha incrementado los víveres en su negocio, con granos y otros productos. Pues siempre le ha preocupado su hijo que no le falte nada. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, verduras, jugos, gaseosas, detergentes, jabones y productos variados. Sueña con mantener su negocio activo.
texts.en:
Félix Bayardo has a small grocery store. He has had this business for more than 10 years, but as time passed he decided to become a retail merchant so he obtained a stall in the market. After they gave him the stall he started gradually increasing the products in his business with grains and other items. He has always been concerned that his son would lack for nothing. The loan he requests is to buy staple grains, snacks, fruit drinks, vegetables, juices, soft drinks, detergents, soaps and a variety of other products. He dreams of maintaining an active business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy groceries

loans.name: Lenida

texts.en: 44-year-old Lenida P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has four adult children. Lenida owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She currently owns three hectares (7.5 acres) of rice field and has been engaged in her business for over three years now. Lenida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lenida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her ninth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Teofisto

texts.en:
Teofisto B., from the village of Tumbao, Banisilan, Cotabato, is 48 years old and single. To make a living, Teofisto owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in his business for over five years, he earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Teofisto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, he is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be Teofisto''s fourth loan from HSPFI, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his store. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elise

texts.en:
Elise is 30 years old and is married with three children who are 1, 2 and 4 years old. Elise is well-known in the business of selling meat and this is his third successful year in this business. The hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.
