Elise is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company and this loan will hopefully allow him to expand his business through purchasing a large quantity of meat for sale. With this quantity, he will earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to start creating some other sources of income and continue to provide enough care for his family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses.

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es: Roxana Elizabeth A. D. V. D. 31 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. San Martín, lugar en el cual vive junto a sus dos hijos D. 15 y 13 años D. edad, los cuales  se dedican a estudiar gracias al enorme esfuerzo D. su madre, ya que ella es madre soltera quien siempre ha tenido que esforzarse por salir adelante y D. esta forma brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos. Roxana comercializa huevos en su casa, y así mismo los comercializa por mayor tanto en San Martín como también el pueblo D. Suchitoto, el cual esta ubicado en el departamento D. Cuscatlán, ahí ella se encarga D. abastecer a clientes los cuales cuentan con tiendas grandes y pequeñas. Roxana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar huevos por mayor, y D. esta forma obtenerlos más baratos y así mismo hacer crecer su negocio ofreciendo más producto. Ella es una persona muy responsable quien su prioridad mayor es la D. darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos y que estos no carezcan D. lo más básico y necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Roxana Elizabeth A. D. V., 31 years old, lives in the municipality of San Martín. She lives with her two children, 15 and 13 years old, who attend school, thanks to the enormous strength of their mother, as she is a single mother who has always had to struggle to do well and in this way to proviD. all the necessities to her children. Roxana sells eggs in her home, and in this way she markets wholesale in both San Martín and in the village of Suchitoto, which is located in the district of Cuscatlán. There she is responsible for supplying customers who have both large and small shops. Roxana is asking for a loan by means of which she would be able to purchase eggs wholesale, and in this way obtain them more cheaply and also grow her business, offering more product. She is a very responsible person whose biggest priority is to give her children everything they need, that they don't lack the basic necessities for life.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale eggs for marketing.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Mrs Yat P. (shown in the photo with her loom) and her husband, Mr Chanthorn But, were married in 1987 and have two daughters. Both of their daughters are married. One of their daughters lives outside the family home. Her daughter and her son-in-law are silk weavers. The family lives on an Island on Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Yat P. has been a silk weaver since 1980. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase silk material to continue her weaving.

loans.use: To buy silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Rafel

texts.es: Rafael, de 28 años, es un hombre muy sincero y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nancy de 26 años y sus 2 queridos hijas Romina de 6 y Tais de 5 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy joven Rafael aprendió a trabajar con la tierra, ya que la agricultura es la actividad que siempre a estado presente en su vida, actualmente el tiene sus propias tierras donde cultiva papa, olluco y arveja, productos que después de la cosecha lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rafael, age 28, is a very sincere and happy man. He lives in his own home with his wife Nancy, age 28, and his 2 beloved daughters Romina, age 6, and Tais, age 5. He wants to offer them a better quality of life. From a very young age, Rafael learned to work with the land, since agriculture is the occupation that has always been part of his life. He now has his own land where he cultivates potatoes, ullucos and peas. After the harvest, he brings them to sell in the wholesale market of Tarma city. His favourite part of his job is cultivating his lands, since this is the activity that feeds his family. He has been doing this work for 8 years, and he finds his greatest difficulty to be keeping his crops safe from the plague of insects. With time, he wants to buy new lands to increase his production. This is his fifth loan with MFP. He has always been very punctual with his payments and he hopes to be so now as well. In his community bank he is a very supportive of the rest of the members. With the 1000 soles that he is requesting, he will purchase more manure and fertilizers for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers

loans.name: Martha  Jesus

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; este banco está situado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Martha;  La socia tiene 63 años D. edad;  ella es viuda y tiene 3 hijos,  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. productos farmacéuticos desD. el año 1990 y a la venta D. cosméticos por catálogos para ayudar un poco a incrementar sus ganancias económicas, La socia trabaja principalmente como preventista para las diferentes boticas D. la zona, ella venD. los productos D. distintos laboratorios  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería para distribuir los productos farmacéuticos. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Machu Picchu" community bank; it is located in Huanchac district in Cusco province, department of Cusco.

Her name is Martha; she is 63 years old, a widow, and has 3 children. Since 1990, Martha has bought and sold pharmaceutical products. She also augments her income through catalog sales of cosmetics. 

Martha's works mainly as a sales coordinator for different pharmacies in the area and sells products from various pharmaceutical companies. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to distribute pharmaceuticals.

Martha appreciates and values the loan granted through Asociación Arariwa and is committed to repaying her loan within the established period of time.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for distribution of pharmaceutical products.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.en: Serapio, aged 40 years, is a married man with eight children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He started by selling crop yields from which he got capital to start up a retail shop. He dreams of educating his children and keeping his family in good health. He also wants to become a wholesaler so he'll have a big size business. He wants a loan to buy more bags of rice to resell.

loans.use: To purchase rice to resell

loans.name: Juana Alicia

texts.es: La señora Juana Alicia tiene 35 años, es madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Juana se dedica a la venta de cerdos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 2 años, debido a que ella notó que este tipo de negocio tiene muy buena demanda. A base de allí tomo la decisión de empezar una forma de ganarse la vida de la manera más humilde. En los últimos días la señora ha tenido unos pequeños problemas en cuanto a su matrimonio ya que su esposo la abandono y ella sola con mucho sacrificio ha salido adelante, sin embargo con un su familia que la apoya ha sabido manejar la situación. El crédito será invertido en la compra de  cerdos. Su meta es crecer de una manera abundante y si es posible empezar a tener vendedores que viajen a los departamentos a dejar su producto.
texts.en:
Juana Alicia, 35, is a single mother with a young child. Juana sells pigs. She started her business 2 years ago because she noticed that there was a high demand for this kind of offering.  That's when she decided to earn her living in a simpler way. She has had some problems recently in her marriage, because her husband abandoned her and she has had to get by with many sacrifices. However, her family supports her and she has been able to manage the situation. 

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs. Her goal is for her business to grow a lot and if it's possible to have sales representatives to distribute her goods in other counties.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is thirty-two years old. She is married and has five children who are between five and sixteen years old. All of her children go to school. Her husband is a farmer. Vestine sells food. She has spent sixteen years in this business. 

With this loan, Vestine will buy more food to sell. The profit from this business will allow her to increase the volume of food that she sells. She says her business is common and has a good reputation for customer service. In the future, she would like to double her business stock, as well as her profit.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Ramona Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Ramona del Carmen L. H., tiene la edad de 54 años habita en el Barrio Benjamín Zeledón, es casada y su esposo labora como albañil, ellos tienen 2 hijos mayores de edad que sobreviven de manera independiente, pero apoyan económicamente  a sus padres, la señora labora como conserje desde hace mas de 12 años, ellos son una familia muy humilde que habitan en una humilde vivienda que las paredes y techo se encuentran en condiciones precarias, y que amenazan la salud y seguridad de los que ahí moran, es para su préstamo que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción que le permitan llevar a cabo estas remodelaciones para mejorar las condiciones en las que ella y su esposo habitan.
texts.en:
Ramona del Carmen L. H., age 54, lives in the Benjamín Zeledón neighborhood.  She is married, and her husband works as a bricklayer. They have two grown children who live independently.  However, the children help their parents financially.

She has worked as a janitor for over 12 years.  They are a very humble family, and they live in a humble home.  The walls and the roof are in precarious conditions.  This poses a health and a security threat to the people who live there.  That is why she is requesting a loan to buy building materials.  These materials will allow her to finish remodeling in order to improve the living conditions for herself and for her husband.

loans.use: Remodeling her home

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie P. is from the village of New Tambo. She is 52 years old. Virgie is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Virgie owns and operates a general store, selling different kinds of goods to local community members. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately PHP1,500 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Virgie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 3,500 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Virgie is requesting a new loan of PHP 4,000, which will also be used to purchase additional goods for her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Virgie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her business

loans.name: Agustina Reina

texts.es:
Agustina de 56 años, es una mujer trabajadora que hace años atrás con poco capital compro papelería para venderla a sus vecinos y conocidos pero por la buena administración que le dio a los ingresos obtenidos pudo ubicar una papelería.  

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ha trabajado durante año vendiendo papelería, cuadernos, y algunos víveres de primera necesidad ya que ella se ha acoplado a las necesidades que quieren las personas.  En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Tiene preciosos económicos como por ejemplo una pluma a $ 0.25, un enlatado a $ 1.35, etc. 

Quiere seguir progresando para asegurar su vejez por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar enlatados, papelería, plumas etc. Uno de sus objetivos con el negocio es ampliarlo y seguir asegurando el capital para su negocio.
texts.en: Agustina, age 56, is a hard-working woman who started a stationery store a few years ago with a small amount of capital, to sell to her neighbours and acquaintances. Thanks to her good management of her income, she was able to open her stationery store. She lives in an urban zone called Orquideas and has worked for years selling stationery, notebooks and various basic staples, as she provides various necessities that people want. She currently works from 7:30 am until 10:00 pm every day. She has very good prices; for example, a pen for $0.25 or a canned good for $1.35, etc. She wants to continue progressing in order to secure her retirement, and so she wants a loan to purchase canned goods, stationery, pens, etc. One of her goals with her business is to expand it, and to continue securing capital for her business.

loans.use: stationery, notebooks, canned items

loans.name: Jovelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jovelyn D. G. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old. Jovelyn is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jovelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of fruits and vegetables in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina C. is a married woman who lives in Poblacion, Poblacion, Compostela, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fish vending and general store businesses. Her husband Carmelito C., who is 60 years old, works as a welder and carpenter to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are 18 to 32 years old. 

Ludivina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ludivina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to purchase fish so that she can continue to save up for future repairs for the house and for her children's school fees. 

Ludivina C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 42 años de edad y tiene tres hijos, Ella nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba provincia de la Convención del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente Juana vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. 

Su principal actividad de Juana es venta de comestibles, ella tiene su propia tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería y así poder abastecer su pequeña tienda. 

Juana pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana is 42 years old and has three children. She was born in the city of Quillabamba in the Province of La Convención, Department of Cusco. Juana currently lives in the city of Oropesa in Cusco Province, Peru.

Her main business activity is selling groceries. She manages her own grocery store out of her home. Juana is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more merchandise so that her tiny store will be well-stocked.

Juana belongs to the Communal Bank “Ricchariy Puririsun” which is part of Asociación Araiwa. She is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to restock her grocery store

loans.name: Morena

texts.en:
Morena is a married woman who lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: Barter/buying and selling of rice, fish vending and food vending. Her husband Antonio, who is 52 years old, earns his living as a laborer in a sugarcane field.  They have two children who are 14 and 17 years old. Morena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Morena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000 to use as funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for her children's education and family needs. Morena is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and equipment

loans.name: Boniface Mawiyoo

texts.en:
Boniface is married to Monica and they have three children. His primary business is running a butcher shop and this has been his business for 10 years. He is able to bring in an income of Kshs 10,000 a month.

Boniface was introduced to KADET by existing clients. He is requesting Kshs 60,000 which he shall use to purchase cows for slaughtering and to add stock to his butchery with meat for selling to customers who are in the market where his business is located.

Boniface will use the anticipated profits to invest and pay school fees. Boniface hopes to be financially stable to support his business and his family. Boniface describes himself as hardworking.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur REVIEW BONIFACE  from  Kenya

loans.use: To buy cows for slaughtering

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a mixed farmer, aged  54 and a father of eight adult children. He has been active in mixed farming for over ten years, producing tea which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority  and pineapples which go to the local market.

Peter has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Kiva Partner Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to purchase a better quality breed to ensure better milk production. He says his first loan helped him purchase the first cow and has been of great help. He adds the additional income will help him meet family expenditures.

Peter, like many farmers in the region, says drought is the main undoing in farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 1 child, Bernadita is a very hard  working entrepreneur.  Bernadita is 65 years old. 

Bernadita has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines.  Bernadita requested a 27,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her seaweed culture (goso).
 
Bernadita has been in this business for 19 years.  In the future, Bernadita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her seaweed business

loans.name: Bwangu Development Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Joweria N., a happily married mother of two, has been overseeing her beauty salon business for the past decade in Nakifuma-Mukono, earning shillings 150,000 each week. Having previously operated a charcoal-sales business, she began this business through the persuasion of close friends.

With this loan, Joweria will purchase more cosmetics for use in her beauty salon. As a qualified teacher, she teaches in many schools in and around Nakifuma and places great value on hard work, an ethic she practices diligently in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for use in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Xinia

texts.es:
Xinia es una mujer emprendedora de Las Bonitas de Pérez Zeledón.
En busca de mejores opciones para su familia,  decidió unirse al grupo de productores de café para exportación de la comunidad. Por lo que va a sembrar 3 hectáreas de café, y para eso ocupa un préstamo de  ₡594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro mil colones) para la compra de abono, fertilizante y  pagar mano de obra, todo necesario para garantizar la calidad de su almacigo. 
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito  Comunal Las Bonitas, una de las 110 empresas de credito comunal socias de EDESA
texts.en:
Xinia is an enterprising woman in “Las Bonitas” (The Pretty Ones) communal bank in Pérez Zeledón.

She seeks better opportunities for her family.  She decided to join the group of coffee exporters in her community.  To do so, she will plant 3 hectares of coffee and needs a ₡594 000 (five-hundred ninety-four thousand colones) loan to buy manure, fertilizer and to pay labor costs to guarantee the quality of the plants she will transplant.

She is a member of the Las Bonitas communal bank, one of EDESA’s 110 communal banks.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Florantine

texts.en: Florantine is 28 years old and has two children who are ages four and six years old. Florentine sells food stuffs and she has done this business for one year. She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs and make more profits. With the profits, she plans to buy a garden in which she plans to grow some crops.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs for sale and make more profits.

loans.name: Arcily Pacatan Group

texts.en: Arcily is married and has a child. Arcily is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. Arcily is a farmer and she grows cows and goats to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan to purchase baby livestock. Arcily has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Arcily hopes to save the extra income as a reserve for future emergencies. Arcily is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock.

loans.name: Santos Virginia

texts.es: Doña Santos Virginia, tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, tiene 5 hijos y junto a su familia vive en la Comunidad de San Ignacio. Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en una empresa, pero luego se casó y con ello vino su primer hijo así que para cuidarlo decidió dejar de trabajar y quedarse en su casa, por lo que instaló una venta de abarroteria. Su negocio es algo pequeño pero con las ganancias que obtiene puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio hasta verlo convertido en un mini-super y porque no, en un supermercado. Su sueño es ver crecer a sus hijos y seguirlos apoyando con el estudio. Con el prestamo solicitado comprara productos de la canasta basica para asi ofrecerles a sus clientes mas y variados productos, su horario de atencion es de lunes a domingo desde las 6:00 am hasta tarde por la noche, y su esposo e hijos la ayudan a atenderla.
texts.en:
Santos Virginia is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives with her family in San Ignacio community.  Santos started working for a company when she was very young.  However, she then got married and had her first child.  In order to care for him, she decided to stop working and stay at home.  She decided to set up a grocery store in her home.

The business is quite small but, with the profits she makes, she is able to help her husband with the family expenses.  Her goal is to grow her business until it becomes a mini-supermarket and, why not, even a supermarket.  Her dream is to see her her children grow up and continue supporting them in their studies.

Santos will use the loan that she has requested to buy basic household products so that she can offer her customers a greater variety of products.  She works from Monday to Sunday, from 6.00am until late at night.  Her husband and children help her to serve in the store.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a Khanga-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors, especially women. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to become a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of Khangas to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of Khangas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items to increase the variety of goods sold in his store.

loans.name: Fideya

texts.en:
Fideya from Madaba, Jordan is a 59-year-old divorced woman and a mother of three children.

Fideya makes pastries and desserts at home for sale, and is requesting a loan of 1,000 JD to purchase the supplies needed for make her goods.

Her hope is to open a productive kitchen in her home so that she will increase her sales and improve her family's standard of living. She helps her son in paying for the family's expenses.

loans.use: purchase raw materials for her baking business.

loans.name: Sizimisele Group

texts.en:
Elinah comes from Gweru and is 43 years old. She is widowed with two children aged 10 and 18. The younger child is attending school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Elinah runs a poultry business and sells farm produce. The business has been in operation for 4 years. She says the main challenges she faces are a lack of funds to purchase feedstock and unavailability of feedstock. Elinah has requested a loan of $400 to buy piglets for a piggery project. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family’s daily diet. In the future Elinah plans to have 200 pigs and 2000 chicks for her two projects.

loans.use: to buy piglets for the piggery project.

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Ebenezer” está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta D. ropa, venta D. joyas, servicios D. peluquería, amasandería, ventas D. cosméticos por catalogo, repostería, venta D. ropa para el hogar. Todos ellos pertenecientes a L. comuna D. Independencia, ciudad D. Santiago.
Lorena integrante del Banco comunal, quien en L. foto se encuentra al costado D. derecha a izquierda, vistiendo una chaqueta color dorado y quien además tiene su cabello color rubio. Se dedica al servicio D. peluquería desD. hace 19 años, durante 10 años trabajó D. manera dependiente y posterior al nacimiento D. sus hijas comenzó a trabajar D. manera independiente desD. su casa. Su horario D. trabajo es D. lunes a sábado y esporádicamente trabaja los días domingos, cada vez que sus clientes solicitan sus servicios D. peluquería. Su salón D. peluquería lo ubicó en una habitación D. su casa al interior, en el cual solo atienD. clientes conocidos. Ahí cuenta con toda L. implementación para su local. Su mercadería L. compra en una distribuidora en L. cual venden específicamente productos cosmetológicos y para el cabello. 
Con el crédito comprará un secador D. pelo profesional, al igual que productos cosmetológicos profesionales. 
Sus metas son instalar su peluquería en un local establecido y más amplio para atender un mayor número D. clientes, además D. surtirlo con productos innovadores en el rubro. 
Lorena vive junto a su marido, sus dos hijos D. 12 y 9 años D. edad, además D. su madre. Uno D. sus sueños era obtener su casa propia y afortunadamente durante el mes D. diciembre le hacen entrega D. su vivienda. 
ElL. está muy contenta y agradecida D. los servicios brindados por Fondo Esperanza, comenta que además disfruta mucho D. las reuniones, ya que le han servido para aprender, conocer a los demás socios y tener un lugar D. esparcimiento. 
Independencia es una D. las 34 comunas que componen L. ciudad D. Santiago (capital D. Chile), ubicada en el sector centro-norte. Surgió a fines del siglo XIX como un sector tradicional D. L. ciudad. Su eje principal es L. Av. Independencia, por L. cual pasaba el antiguo Camino del Inca, puerta D. entrada por el norte, a L. ciudad D. Santiago. Dada su amplia población indígena, en Independencia se encuentra el Centro Cultural Indígena D. Chile. Cuenta también con importantes construcciones históricas, entre ellas 6 monumentos históricos D. Chile.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Ebenezeer” and is composed of 18 entrepreneurs who are dedicated to different businesses, among these selling clothing, or jewelry, or a hair salon services, a bakery, selling cosmetics by catalog, or a cake shop, or selling clothing for the home. All the members live in the community of Independencia, in the city of Santiago.

Lorena, a member of the communal bank, is in the photo on the right edge with blond hair, wearing a gold jacket. She has been a beautician for 19 years. For 10 years, she worked as an employee but with the birth of her daughters, she began to work independently from home. Lorena's work schedule is Monday through Saturday, and she sometimes works on Sundays, when her customers request her hair services. Her salon is located in a room in the interior of her house, where Lorena only attends to known customers. Here she has all the equipment for her shop. She buys her merchandise from a distributor who sells specific cosmetology and hair products.

With this loan, Lorena will buy a professional hair dryer plus professional cosmetology products. 

Her goals are to install her beauty salon in an established and more ample space so that she can attend to a larger number of customers. Also Lorena  would like to supply her salon with more innovative products for this area. Lorena lives with her husband and 2 children aged 12 and 9, plus her mother. One of her dreams has been to obtain her own house and, fortunately, during the month of December she obtained her own home. 

Lorena is very content and grateful for the services offered by Fondo Eslperanza. She comments that in addition to enjoying the meetings very much, she has learned a great deal, and has gotten to know the other members, plus enjoyed having a place to relax.

Independencia is one of the 34 neighborhoods that make up the city of Santiago (Chile's capital). It is located in the city's center-north and grew at the beginning of the 19th century as a traditional sector of the city. Its principal street is Avenida Independencia, which follows the old Inca highway, the northern entry to the city of Santiago. Given its ample indigenous population, the Centro Cultural Indigena D. Chile (Chilean Indigenous Cultural Center) is located here. It also has important historical monuments, among them 6 of Chile's historical monuments.

loans.use: buy a professional hair dryer, plus cosmetology products for  the hair for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Regina  Group

texts.en:
Regina is 45 years old and lives in Senor, Sinaaacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Regina has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Regina has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Regina has been a member of PMPC for six years.  In the future, Regina would like to send her children to school and finish a college degree.

Regina is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 35 years old, married and has four children who range from 2 to 10 years old. He is patient and ambitious, and has earned a living for the last six years by running a hardware business where he sells spades, padlocks, machetes and hammers. His business is located in a shopping center and his biggest challenge is inflation. He is applying for a Kiva loan for 80,000 Kes to buy more machetes, spades and hammers to sell to his customers. His goal is to grow his business and acquire his own premises within five years. He hopes to give his children a good education, including through the university level.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: New Dawn Group

texts.en:
Ephraim is 48 years old.  He is married and lives in Zvishavane. He has four children, ages 13, 18, 23 and 26.  One is attending school.  Emphraim has been operating a flea market for the last 16 years. His main challenges are inadequate working capital and stiff competition. 

He has requested a loan of US$400 to buy clothes and shoes for sale. With additional income, Ephraim will be in a position to extend his house.  In the future, he plans to have a shop in Zvishavane.

loans.use: To buy shoes, jeans and T-shirts for sale

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 67-year-old married man.  He has owned a sawmill since 1982, and his business is growing because of his good reputation and the quality of work he provides.  He is a hardworking man who puts his effort into improving his work as much as he can. 
	
Ali has borrowed from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for five consecutive cycles.  All of his previous loans helped a lot in improving his business, and had a positive impact on both his social and financial situations. He is now applying for a new loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy new, updated machines and tools necessary to make special designs requested by his customers.  Ali hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can to fulfill all of his customers’ needs and desires.

loans.use: To buy new, updated machines and tools.

loans.name: Maria Lady

texts.en:
Maria Lady is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Maria Lady has a bakeshop that sells breads, cakes, cookies and pastries. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients used in making breads and pastries.

Maria Lady has been a member of HSPFI since 1997. In the future, Maria Lady hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients used in making breads and pastries

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: Nila is 38 years old and lives in Sipaloc,Sibutad. She is married with three children.  To earn a living, Nila has a business selling grocery items. She earns about PHP 4000 each month doing this type of work. Nila has requested a loan to purchase additional stock to sell. Nila has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: To purchase 10 boxes of assorted groceries

loans.name: Luciana's Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Virgen de Fátima” es un grupo que surgió hace 10 años atrás en la ciudad de Ybycui. Empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya, pero empezó a trabajar con la fundación desde este año gracias a la promoción hecha a una de las miembros, quien luego de una constante comunicación y visita de la asesora se logró formar un nuevo grupo integrado por 14 mujeres. Las señoras son muy  unidas, responsables y solidarias, mencionaron que se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres.
Una de esas mujeres es la señora Claudia, quien se dedica a la venta de chipas (alimento tradicional paraguayo, preparado a base de almidón), con lo cual puede mantener a su familia. Comenta que esta es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que diariamente recorre mucho para vender sus productos, pero nos dice que todo esfuerzo vale la pena para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de chipas, con lo que podrá seguir con su trabajo y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group of women called Virgen de Fátima came about ten years ago in the city of Ybycui. Work began with the Fundación Paraguaya, and this year, thanks to a promotion offered by one of the members, and through steady communication and visiting with a counselor, a new group was formed by 14 women. The ladies are very united, trustworthy and caring, and they mentioned that they like working together as a team, with strength and care, working together in the group program.

One of these women is Claudia, who works selling chipas (a traditional Paraguayan food dish, prepared from a base of starch), with which she can support her family. She comments that she makes sacrifices to do this work, she travels about daily in order to sell her products, but she tells us that each effort has value in regards to helping her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy chipas, so that she will be able to continue with her work and to help her family.

loans.use: to buy chipas to sell later

loans.name: Ma.gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari store, or convenience store, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Ma. Gina requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: This is 36 year-old Marie.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 18, 16, and 14. In 2005, Marie established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in the running of the home. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 750,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Marie has already received and successfully repaid loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more slippers for her store. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Marie plans to further expand her business and to start traveling to Guinea for her slippers, and to also give her children quality education.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more slippers for her store

loans.name: Janviere

texts.en: Janviere is 33 years old. She is a mother of four children, and all of them go to school. She has been running a business of selling peanuts for the period of three years. With the loan, she will buy more peanuts to sell. She will use the profits to pay school fees and provide for the family. She would like to own a vehicle that would ease her business.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Nyanluak

texts.en:
Nyanluak is 38 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school. She has a business selling food at a stall in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Nyanluak is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell

loans.name: Carmen Graciela

texts.es: Carmen es  una persona  responsable y   emprendedora,  la  cual  se  preocupa por  el  patrimonio de  sus  hijos,  gracias a  su esfuerzo  y perseverancia  logro  adquirir  su vivienda pero nos  comenta   que  desea  acondicionarlo es  por  ello  que  se acerco a la  institución,  ella  desea  impermeabilizar  el techo  de  su  hogar  ya  que  se  gotea  ve  en el crédito la  posibilidad de  ofrecer  a  su familia una  mejor  comodidad  por  lo  que  se encuentra  muy  contenta de habernos  encontrado.
texts.en: Carmen is a responsible and enterprising woman who is concerned about leaving something behind for her children. Thanks to her hard work and perseverance she was able to acquire her home, but she tells us that she wants to make improvements, which is why she is turning to Kiva partner Credituyo. She wants to water-proof her roof since it leaks. She sees in the loan the possibility to make her family more comfortable, so she is very content with having found this.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by four women from the island village of Carabane, located at the mouth of the Casamance River in southern Senegal. Represented by Binta S., the group describes their enterprise as follows:

“We live in a place that used to receive a lot of tourists and travelers who came from nearby islands in order to board the ship that links Dakar [the capital of Senegal] with Ziguinchor [the capital of the southern region of Casamance]. However, since the sinking of the Joola [note: the Joola was the original ship that used to make a stop at Carabane on its way between Dakar and Ziguinchor, however after a tragic accident which resulted in the sinking of the Joola, the stops at Carabane were discontinued] we established our business at the port, where we market local products that we purchase in the villages.

Our objective is to sell the greatest possible quantity of the seafood and forest products of the local villages, in order to earn enough money to fulfill our needs, and to improve our sources of income in order to pay for our children’s schooling. Our business will consist of purchasing and reselling a large quantity of seafood and forest products, as well as small-scale retail trade of various merchandise. It is for this purpose that we are requesting a loan of 600,000 francs in order to launch this enterprise on a large scale.”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet : Nous habitons une zone enclavée qui reçoit beaucoup de touristes et de passagers venants des îles voisines pour prendre le bateau qui fait la liaison Dakar Ziguinchor. Mais, depuis le naufrage du bateau le Joola, nous sommes installées au port nous écoulons les produits que nous achetons dans les villages vers les villes du Sénégal.

Objectifs du Prêt : Notre objectif est d’écoulé la plus grande quantité possible de la production halieutique et forestière des éco villages afin de pouvoir subvenir à nos besoins.

Améliorer nos sources de revenus pour pouvoir faire face aux frais de la scolarité de nos enfants. Activités : Achat et vente de produits halieutique et forestier en grande quantité ; et fournir les petits commerces. C’set pour ses besoins que nous sollicitons un prêt de 600 000F pour pouvoir nous relancés dans cette activité qui consiste à aculter en gros. »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchasing seafood and other village products; transportation to market

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Vicky is 28 years old and a mother of 2. She deals in the sale of cereals in front of the family house. She acquires her supplies on credit from the wholesalers thus decreasing the range of her anticipated profit. Her objective of sourcing the KIVA loan is to enable her to purchase the items in sacks and pay upfront. This she believes would give her an advantage in the re-sale of the items. They include maize, beans, groundnuts, and millet.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Everlyne Wekesa

texts.en: Everlyne is married with five children all in primary school.  She has not undertaken any training.  She is an active member of her local community's poverty eradication self-help group.  She started her business in 2000, which involves selling second hand clothes, in order to support her family. Her husband is not employed.  With a loan from PEMCI, she wishes to increase her stock and be able to take her clothes to different markets. Through her business, she has been able to bring services closer to the locals. She has also been able to contribute materially to her community.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Mrs. Sara R. is 50 years old, she is married and lives with Alfredo, her 42-year-old husband. He works downtown selling fishing articles; they both economically support their household. They have 3 children; two boys and a girl, they all three are in school, they live with them and help his parents with the sales. Sara has exclusively sold tobacco for more than ten years, she has a stand at the city market. She opens her business at 5:30 a.m. and she starts working preparing cigarettes with dry tobacco leaves until 6 p.m. Then she returns home house to take care of her family and to share the anecdotes and experiences of the day. The requested loan will be use to buy tobacco leaves since she wants to increase her production. Sara is a part of a committee of the city market called " Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope). It is constituted by 16 enterprising women, they work as a team and the group is quite solid, the committee is in the fifth cycle of the program "Committee of enterprising women", a project of the Paraguayan Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sara R. tiene 50 años, ellas es casada y vive con su marido, Alfredo de 42 años, él trabaja en el centro de la ciudad y se dedica a la venta de articulo de pesca; ambos aportan económicamente con los ingresos de la casa. Tienen 3 hijos; dos varones y una mujer, los 3 hijos estudian, viven con ellos y ayudan a sus padres con las ventas. La señora se dedica exclusivamente a la venta de tabaco hace ya más de diez años, ella tiene un negocio en el mercado de abasto de la ciudad. Todos los días abre su negocio a las 5:30 am y comienza su labor de preparar cigarros con las hojas secas de tabaco hasta las 6 pm que vuelve a su casa para cuidar y compartir con su familia las anécdotas y experiencias del día. El préstamo lo solicita para la compra de más hojas de tabaco pues desea aumentar su producción. Sara forma parte de un comité llamado “Nueva Esperanza” del mercado de abasto de C.D.E. que está constituido por 16 mujeres emprendedoras, ellas trabajan en equipo y el grupo es bastante sólido, el comité se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del programa “comité de mujeres emprendedoras”, un proyecto de la Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: Buy wholesale tobacco leaves

loans.name: Sose

texts.en:
Sose F. is a young woman with a strong heart, searching for a way to help her family. She’s twenty-eight years of age and lives with her four children. Her husband is in New Zealand working; he sends over money to help her business and the kids.

Sose enjoys her work. She goes to her vegetable garden, one of her family lands she’s using for her business. She sells different kinds of vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes, pumpkins, and peas at the market. She gets hundred tala (about US$ 40) a day from her selling. She’s thankful to S.P.B.D for making this business for her possible. Her purpose for this loan is to buy more seeds to plant and buy equipment to make her work much easier.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and planting equipment

loans.name: Geribkhan

texts.en: Geribkhan B. owns and operates a fruit and vegetable stand in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. His stand is actually located right in front of Norwegian Microcredit’s Khachmaz branch. He is 57 years old and is married with two children. He is currently looking for funding in the amount of $600 in order increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es:
Eddy is an enterprising mother looking to make a better future for the well being of her 5 children that are basis of her motivation to work day to day in the cultivation of her citrus and coffee plants. Even with all the effort she puts into her farm, it doesn’t cover her current expenses due to the illness of her 15-year-old daughter who in the middle of her adolescence has to deal with a speech and hearing impediment. This impediment caused her daughter to abandon her studies, and today Eddy feels her daughter’s pain and suffers at not being able to fully help her daughter due to economic constraints that limit her ability to provide her daughter treatment in the country’s capital. Due to this circumstance she wishes to increase production and thus increase her income in order to provide her daughter with adequate medical attention quickly. Let us fund this self sacrificing mother her loan request and provide her a ray of hope.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

Eddy, es una madre emprendedora que busca forjarse un futuro mejor para el bienestar de sus cinco hijos, quienes son su fuente de motivación y esfuerza día a día en el cultivo de sus productos cítricos y de café.A pesar del esfuerzo que ponen en su chacra no solventa los gastos que hoy atraviesa, por la enfermedad e su hija de 15 años, quien en plena etapa de su adolescencia trata de lidiar con su dificultad para escuchar y hablar; esta penosa enfermedad hace poco tiempo le obligó a dejar sus estudios y hoy Eddy sufre frente al problema de su hija y por la impotencia que siente al no poder ayudarla plenamente por factores económicos que la limitan a poder brindar a su hija un tratamiento en la capital.A raíz de este penoso incidente desea incrementar su producción para obtener mayores ingresos y llegar a tratar el problema de su hija con prontitud.Ayudemos colaborando con la suma que solicita y brindémosle un rayito de esperanza a esta abnegada madre.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her mango business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue investing in a variety of seafood

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María didn’t want to marry or live with the father of her daughter, for many reasons that made her unhappy, and she had the courage to confront life without his help. The hard work that she does on her land, cultivating corn and raising livestock, has caused her health to deteriorate notably. She tries to get better and go to the doctor because she knows that her daughter needs her very much. She works hard to increase her crop production and to do this she has to take good care of the land and clean it carefully, with the goal of having a favorable harvest. If you have the ability to contribute to this noble cause, have no doubts about doing so. The requested funds will be used to buy fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María no quiso entrelazar su vida con el padre de su hija por diversos hechos que no le hacían sentir feliz y tuvo la valentía de hacerle frente a la vida sin su ayuda.El duro trabajo que realiza en sus terrenos de cultivo de maíz y la crianza de sus animales han desmejorado su salud notablemente y trata de recuperarse y acudir al hospital, por que es conciente de que su hija necesita de ella íntegramente.Lucha por aumentar la producción de sus terrenos de cultivo y para ello requiere cuidarlos y limpiarlos debidamente con el propósito de que su cosecha pueda ser favorable para su economía. Si usted tiene la posibilidad de sumarse a la contribución de esta noble causa no dude en hacerlo debido a que el dinero solicitado será utilizado para adquirir abonos y fertilizantes.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en: Mrs. Choeun S. is 25 years old, has two children and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She earns about $2 a day selling fried bananas. Her husband, Mr. Kong Dy, is a 30-year-old motor-taxi driver who earns about $5 a day. Mrs. Choeun has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy a plot of farmland so that she can increase her income by growing a variety of vegetables. (Photo: Mr. Kong driving a motorbike with his wife behind him and his son in the front seat)

loans.use: To purchase farmland on which to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Ludomila

texts.es:
Keeping her family united and happy is what motivates Ludomilia to work so hard every day. An enterprising woman, she and her husband take advantage of the local markets in Huancayo to sell all kinds of utensils for the kitchen at reasonable prices. Her goal is to one day have their own shop, and until then, she will continue working hard to make her goal a reality.

Mantener a su familia unida y en completa alegría es lo que sostiene los esfuerzos y el trabajo diario de Ludomilia, una mujer emprendedora que aprovecha las ferias dominicales de Huancayo para que junto a su esposo venda la mayor cantidad posible de artículos para implementar el espacio dedicado en los hogares a la preparación de alimentos, la cocina, es así que ella oferta estos artículos a precios accesibles. Su meta es poder establecerse en un local comercial y mientras tanto seguiráEsforzándose para convertir este anhelo en realidad.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS AND HAVE A GREATER SELECTION  OF COOKING UTENSILS TO SELL.

loans.name: Rakhman

texts.en: Rakhman H. is a 40 year old man who breeds calves in the southern region of Azerbaijan named  Bilasuvar.  Only internally displaced people live in this region. Rakhman has 18 years of experience in his business. He is married and has 3 sons. They all help him look after the  calves. Rakhman applied for a loan of 800 USD to purchase two mid-sizes calves (at 400 USD each) to increase his earnings. He believes that summer is a peak time to make money because it is the wedding season and Azeri people use meat to cook most of their meals.

loans.use: to purchase two mid-sized calves

loans.name: Esperanza Cconislla

texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=34162

Esperanza belongs to the Imperio Village Bank. She is married, is 60 and has 3 children.

She makes typical clothes like petticoats, aprons and sells her products in fairs. She also weaves pullovers and that is for she purchased a weaving loom 3 months ago. Thus she can proviD. more products to her business.

Esperanza travels at fairs where she sells vegetables, fruits and clothes she makes.

She needs a 1000 soles loan to buy wool and clothes.

She wants her children to have their own business like she did. She also would like her grandchildren to study and she dreams about extending her business.

loans.use: She needs a 1000 soles loan to buy wool and clothes.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is married with a three year old child. She has owned and run a small shop since 2005. Every day she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Vicky now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Lenuel

texts.es: Don Lenuel P. H., tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, tiene dos hijos con edades comprendidas entre los 18 y 19 años de edad ambas estudian el primer años de la universidad, su esposa es empleada domestica, la actividad eocnomica del señor es un taller de torno y soldadura en su casa de habtacion, su proposito es mejorar las condicones de infraestructura del neogico ya que es su herramienta principal y con la cual mantiene a su familia, su mayor sueño es que sus hijos coronen una carrera profesional o mas adelante sus hijos se interesen en el negocio que ahora desarrolla y lo equipen con la tecnologia mas moderna ya que actualmente parte de sus equipos son bastante obsoletos,en esta actividad el señor tiene mas de trece años de dedicarse habiendo poco a poco adquirido sus herramientas ya que el trabajo como ayudante de torno. Sus ceditos han sido para capital de trabajo para la compra de Bronce, Aluminio, Hierro Colado o chatarra con la cual él elabora partes de repuestos tambien para vehiculos.
texts.en:
Mr. Lenuel P. H. is 57 years old and married. He has two children, who are 18 and 19 years old. Both children are in their first year of university. Lenuel's wife works as a domestic servant, and he runs a welding business from his home. Lenuel's goal is to improve the infrastructure of his business, because his shop is the main source of income for the family. Lenuel's greatest dream is for his children to complete their professional education. He hopes that they will take interest in the welding business, and that they'll equip it with more modern technology. At the moment, some of Lenuel's tools are obsolete. Lenuel has been working as a welder for more than thirteen years, including time as an assistant, and over the years he has slowly accumulated tools. Lenuel's loans have been used as working capital to buy bronze, aluminum, and strained iron or scrap iron, which he uses to make replacement parts for vehicles.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia N., 57, is married with 9 children. She has 3 years of experience in the pancakes, porkcakes, ice cakes, etc., business. She sells to the village and general public 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (166 USD). SPBD loans are Sofia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be use to improve business and help out with her family. Her husband helps out with the business.

loans.use: To improve the business status and also help to improve her home

loans.name: Kaniz's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz baji, the wife of M. A., lives in Arifwala, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 12 years. She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her eldest daughter is in the 5th standard grade. Her eldest son is in the 4th standard grade. The others are too young for school.

Kaniz baji’s husband drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Kaniz baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and take care of her family. 

Kaniz baji successfully repaid two previous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by four more members. Amna baji wants a loan to buy another bike for her motorbike-rental business. Najma baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Rafea baji wants a loan to buy pesticides to resell. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy more clothes for her clothes-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Baji, which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
At 50 years old, Chirstine T. lives in Yenawa in Littoral county, one of the economic centers of Benin. She married Victorin Houzandji, a master bricklayer and has 5 children in school. She has lived for the past 20 years in Ahouassa, a suburb of Cotonou, where she has sold mawè (flour, the principal ingredient of the staple food of Benin) for 13 years. With her extra income she can contribute to household costs. Now on her 6th loan, she would like to buy more food stocks and will reimburse the cost in 10 months.

Translated from French:

Agée de 50 ans à Yénawa dans le département du Littoral capitale économique du Benin, dame T. Christine est mariée à Houzandji Victorin maître maçon et mère de 5 enfants et tous scolarisés. Elle réside depuis une vingtaine d’années à Ahouassa l’une des banlieues de Cotonou où elle exerce son activité de vente des condiments et de mawè (farine de maïs fermenté) depuis 13 ans. Avec son activité elle arrive à contribuer considérablement aux du foyer. Elle est à son sixième crédit pour lequel elle sollicite un prêt de 150 000fracs CFA pour faire face à ces demandes et le rembourser sur 10 mois.

loans.use: To purchase three 100 kg bags of corn, packaging, and assorted food products.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: N. Gladys is a very ambitious and determined businesswoman. At 38, she is married and the mother of two school-going children. She operates a bar and restaurant on Rubaga Road where she resides. Besides this business, Gladys owns five rental houses which earn her a total of Ush 1,500,000 per month. Gladys will use the loan to purchase more crates of beer, wine, spirits, and soft drinks for her business.

loans.use: Purchase more crates of beer, wine, spirits, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es:
La señora Karla D. actualmente se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras en su propio establecimiento ubicado en el mercado municipal de Chichigalpa. Ella se dedica muy arduamente a esta actividad desde hace 12 años y ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio logrando su objetivo como es obtener la satisfacción del cliente.  

Su meta es convertirse en una excelente comerciante y es por esta razón que hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada por medio de un crédito que le de lugar a la compra de las verduras para continuar comercializándolas muy atentamente en su localidad en el mercado de Chichigalpa.
texts.en:
Currently, Karla D. is dedicated to her business selling vegetables in her own shop located in the municipal market of Chichigalpa. She has been strongly dedicated to this work for 12 years and has been successful with her business by achieving her objective to obtain the satisfaction of her customers. Her goal is to become an excellent trader and, for this reason, she is now seeking support from Ceprodel so that she can benefit from a loan. This will allow her to purchase vegetables so she may continue to sell them very attentively from her store in the Chichigalpa market.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun N. lives in the Angk Prasat village in the Takeo province. She is a 46-year-old widow with seven children, three of whom are employed in garment factory while the others are attending the local school. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she gets a little income to support her family. Mrs. Noeun N. decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell, thus to expand her business and earn more profits.

loans.use: To buy rice to expand her rice to re-sell to earn more profits.

loans.name: Mahmadovud

texts.ru: Розиков Махмадовуд житель города Яван. Возраст 38 лет , не женат . Работает в столовой , которую арендует. Столовая находится на центральном рынке. Спрос на его продукцию неплохой. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит и закупить продукты долгого хранения. Это поможет ему снизить цены на предлагаемую продукцию и обеспечить население качественной и свежей пищей. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mahmadovud R. is a 38-years-old bachelor who lives in Yavan. He works in a cafeteria that he rents at the central market. There is demand for the food he makes and he is applying for a loan that would allow him to stock groceries. He would like to reduce food prices and provide local residents with fresh food of high quality. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: La señora Teodora I. Q. tiene la edad de 32 años, habita en la comunidad el edén, ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante en el mercado para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar ya que tienen a su cargo tres hijos un varón de un año, una niña de cinco que estudia su primaria y un varón de dos años; los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que donde ellos habitan es en casa del papá y sus cultivo están establecidos en el mismo , ella quiere legalizar a su nombre ya que solo son palabras, ella desde hace veinte años ha trabajado con la agricultura y el comercio ya que era las actividades de sus padres y ella las continua doña Teodora también tiene el sueño de tener una pequeña finca para un futuro de sus hijos la trabajen , con el financiamiento ella va a compra fertilizantes e insumos para tener una buena cosecha y vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora I. Q. is thirty-two-years-old and lives in Eden, which is located in the municipality of Ticuantepe. She lives with her husband who is a retail merchant and helps her with the costs of maintaining their home, as they are responsible for their three children: a one-year-old boy, a five-year-old girl enrolled in elementary school and a two-year-old boy. She plans to improve her family's living conditions, as they currently live in her father's home where their crops are located, and she would like to legally acquire the property. For over twenty years she has worked in agriculture and commerce with her parents and continues to do so. Teodora also dreams of having a small farm where her children can work in the future. With this loan she will purchase fertilizers and other raw materials and supplies to yield a good harvest and sell her crops at a good market price.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials and supplies for cultivation

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est une femme mariée âgée de 36 ans, mère de 02 enfants. Elle souhaite renforcer son capital de vente d’encens et de pate d’arachide. C’est avec cette activité qu’elle parvient à participer à la dépense quotidienne familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou S., 36, is a married woman and the mother of 2 children. She hopes to bolster her working capital for selling incense and peanut butter. It is thanks to this business that she manages to contribute to supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: making and selling incense and peanut butter

loans.name: Nazya Group

texts.en:
Nazya is requesting a loan for her husband’s general store. Nazya is the leader of this four member group. Her husband needs to buy materials for his business.

The other members would also like to receive money for their businesses. Bibi Maryam is requesting a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy three new machines for her business. Norya will use the loan for her business of carpet weaving. She wants to buy carpet weaving materials. Weheda is requesting a loan for her brother’s general store. He wants to enlarge his shop.

This group is very happy with the loan process in Afghanistan and thanks all Kiva lenders and AFSG in Afghanistan for providing assistance to poor people.

loans.use: To buy materials for a general store

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Huyền Nguyễn Thị (1221040703) is a 31-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Huyền owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members.  Huyền has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2005, Huyền joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Huyền has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to expand her business.  Huyền is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Huyền plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand the services provided.

loans.name: Biaziz

texts.ru: Биазиз – 42 лет. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Она занимается продажей национальной женской одежды и тканей. Она торгует на рынке Мастчинского района и кроме того она ходит по домам и предлагает платья и ткани женщинам. Биазиз закупает товар из рынка "Сомонбазар" и "Атушбазар" города Худжанда. Она ездит за товаром 2 раза в месяц. Её муж мастер строительных работ. Биазиз уже 2 года кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Биазиз расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию женской обуви. Теперь у Биазиз увеличился ассортимент.
texts.en:
Biaziz is forty-two years old. She is married and the mother of two children. She sells traditional women's clothing and fabrics. She trades in the Mastchoh market and additionally goes door-to-door selling dresses and fabrics to women. Biaziz buys her goods from the markets Somonbazaar and Atushbazaar in the city of Khojand. She goes to buy goods twice a month. Her husband is a master builder. Biaziz has financed her business through us for the last two years. When she began, she had a small quantity of goods. But now Biaziz has expanded her inventory, and with the last loan she bought a lot of women's shoes. Now the variety of Biaziz's goods has increased.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling traditional dresses

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia P. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 44 years old, married, and has five school-age children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from butchering and selling meat in the public market. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lydia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business. This loan is her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake is 35 years old and married with three children. She styles and braids hair for her customers within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She also sells hair cream and hair extensions. Folake hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase styling creams and hair extensions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more styling cream and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita T. is from the village of Katipa. She is 55 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Anita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Anita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 10th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Asunda

texts.en:
Asunda is a member of the Mtivila borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 48 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 9 children.Her children are aged 25,23,20,19,17,18,13,15,10 years.she also cares for other 2 dependents.

Asunda started her own food business selling tomatoes,potatoes 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximation 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Asunda`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Asunda hopes to save more money and expand her business,get more food for family

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,anions,potatoes

loans.name: Ngone

texts.fr: ngone F. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis avril 2009.elle est connue dans la vente de produits divers pour dames tels que sovons lait de toilette sacs a mains etc,et aussi d'habillement pour enfants.elle gere un magasin non loin de la caisse a cote du marche de yoff.elle sollicite un credit de trois cent mille(300 000)frs en vue de renforcer son stock et faire face a l'augmentation de la demande de la clientele de la periode d'avant fetes.l'accroissement de ses profits lui permettent de mieux soutenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Ngone F. has been a member of the Yoff bank since April 2009. She is known for selling various women’s goods, such as soaps, lotions, handbags, etc., and also children’s clothing. She runs a store not far from the bank and next to the Yoff market.
