She’s requesting a loan of 300,000 francs with the aim of bolstering her inventory and coping with the increase in customer demand due to the pre-holiday period. The growth in her profits will enable her to support her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is 38 years old and married. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She is a fashion designer and also sells sarongs and tailoring materials. She has been in this business for an extremely long time. Eunice is requesting a loan to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Yanet Giovana

texts.es:
La señora Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente tiene 01 hijo, vive en la Av. Panamericana y  estudio secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de cereales.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar quinua, trigo, cebada, habas, etc. Los mismos que los comercializan en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda de venta de ropa.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros, las reuniones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Sra. Yanet is a member of the “Gregoria Apaza” Communal Bank, which is located in the central village of Pusuyo in Ilave District, Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 1 child. Yanet lives on Panamericana Avenue and completed her high school education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. Her first loan of 300 soles allowed her to increase her business capital for buying and selling grain.

Yanet is currently requesting a new loan of 2500 soles to buy quinoa, wheat, barley, beans, etc. She will sell these products at the regional fairs. Her greatest wish is to open a clothing store. She enjoys her savings, the Communal Bank meetings, and the seminars.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quinoa, wheat, barley, beans, etc.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es: María Dolores A. Z. reside en el municipio de Zacatecoluca en el departamento de La Paz. María vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas Jazmín de 11 años de edad y Marlene de 7 años de edad. María es una mujer muy ingenioso para hacer sus negocios, distribuye su tiempo con gran optimización para cuidar de sus familia y a su vez generar ingresos, María hace pupusas todas las mañanas después de su gran ajetreo en su negocio, sale a vender de manera ambulante a las calles y colonias cercanas donde ofrece variedad de zapatos y vitaminas, cuando empieza a ocultarse el sol María regresa a su hogar donde la espera las diversas tareas del hogar y su cría de cerdos la cual está en engorde para vender a un buen precio en temporada navideña, el crédito que solicita María es para su negocio ambulante ya que desea adquirir nueva mercadería al por mayor, donde lograr percibir un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
María Dolores A. Z. lives in the Zacatecoluca municipality in the La Paz department. María lives with her husband and her two daughters; Jazmín, 11; and Marlene, 7. María is a very ingenious woman in running her businesses. She uses her time very optimally to be able to take care of her family at the same time that she generates income. Every morning María makes “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables). After this hard work for her business, she leaves to sell. She is a traveling salesperson, and she sells on the streets and in nearby districts. She sells a variety of shoes and vitamins. When it starts to get dark, María returns home where her various household chores await her. She also needs to take care of the pigs that she is fattening to sell for a good price during the Christmas season. The loan that María is asking for is for her business as a traveling salesperson. She wants to get new wholesale merchandise where she can get a greater margin of earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a client of Asociación Arariwa. He is part of a communal bank consisting of nineteen members in Anta. The group is called Virgen Inmaculada Concepción - Anta. Jose is from Anta and lives in Anta. He is 44 years old and lives with his wife.

Jose sells animals at the Sunday market, particularly sheep and chickens. He also works far away during the week. With this loan, he will buy more animals to sell.

Jose appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

**Note: Because Jose works far away during the week, his wife represents him at the group meetings when he cannot come so she is pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more animals to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty sells used clothes at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. The demands for her used clothes are high this season because there are lots of people in her community that cannot afford new clothes. She is 55 years old and married with six children. Her husband is a businessman. Her children are doing well in school and she hopes to give them a quality education. She hopes for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
La Señora Rufina C. T.  tiene 41 años y está casada por más de 20 años, La señora se dedica a la producción de leche y su posterior venta a una empresa que elabora toda clases de productos lácteos, y su esposo además de ayudar con la producción de leche también se dedica a la agricultura y a cultivar la mayoría de los insumos que utiliza para el ganado lechero, como ser chala, alfa alfa y  maíz.

La señora Rufina  vive en la zona de Machac Marca en Cochabamba,  es una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad y por lo tanto para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo por eso fue que el Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona y descubrimos que el estado en el que tienen su ganado no es muy bueno que a la mayoría les falta establos que en esta época de lluvia son muy requeridos por tanto la señora Rufina utilizara este crédito para terminar de construir su establo y que sus vacas no sufran en la época de lluvia. 

La señora Rufina nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es continuar con la producción de leche como siempre lo hizo, ver a sus hijos tener un futuro bueno y que algún día tenga suficiente ganado para generar una cantidad buena de leche y que sus ingresos la ayuden a mejorar la casa donde viven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rufina C. T. is 41 years old and has been married for the last 20 years. She works in milk production and sells her product to a business that produces all types of milk products. Her husband helps with the milk production and works as a farmer, growing food like corn and alfafa that he uses for their dairy cows.

Mrs. Rufina C. T. lives in Machac Marca in Cochabamba. This area is very remote and for this reason, it is difficult for them to reach banks to obtain credit. When Cidre had the initiative to come to this area, Cidre found that the conditions of the families’ cows were bad and that the majority of them lacked stables. In this rainy season, stables are necessary and for this Mrs. Rufina will use this credit to finish constructing a stable so that the cows won’t suffer in the rainy season.

Mrs. Rufina told us that her first dream is to continue with milk production as she always has done and to see her children have a better future. She also dreams that some day she will have a sufficient number of cows to produce lots of milk and these profits could help her improve their family home.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish constructing a stable to put the cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy phone and subscription cards

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married. She lives in Zaporozhye. Victoria sells men’s outerwear in the “Yubileinyi” local marketplace. She offers a nice selection of men’s clothing at affordable prices. Victoria has many years of experience working in this sphere of trade and is very friendly to customers, which has helped her gain loyal clients. 

Victoria has been in this business for 9 years. Presently, she has about 80,000 Grivnyas in inventory. This time, Victoria is requesting a loan of 12,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional stylish inventory to sell in her kiosks. Victoria has never had any problems with loan repayment. She can be characterized as a stable and trustworthy borrower.

loans.use: To purchase additional stylish inventory to sell in her kiosks

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  membres du groupe Benkelema de l’association Jiguisseme sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  avec  en moyenne  44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koko, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quinzième  prêt.  Tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Elles font  comme activités la vente  de condiments alimentaires, d’articles de boutique,  la production et la vente de pâte d’arachide, de gâteaux  etc.    
Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 paquets de condiments, 250kg de graine d’arachide (pour en faire la pâte d’arachide), 1sac de farine, 100kg de sucre, 30litres d’huile, 3 colis d’articles divers (pour la boutique).  Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent au marché de Kadiolo, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera réinvestie dans les activités.
Elles comptent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  devenir des grossistes.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkelema group within the Jiguisseme association are essentially married women 44 years old on average, with an average of four children. Most live in polygamous families in Koko - one of Kadiolo’s neighbourhoods - in the third administrative region of Mali. They cooperate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customer’s needs, and have been granted 15 loans to date. All preceding loans were fully reimbursed. Their activities range from the sale of food condiments and grocery items to making and selling peanut butter, cakes, etc. With their new loan, they want to buy: • five packs of condiments • 250 kilos of peanuts (to make peanut butter) • one bag of flour • 100 kilos of sugar • 30 litres of oil • three boxes of various items (for the shop) They get their supplies from the market in Kadiolo and from nearby villages. They sell either in the Kadiolo market, as itinerant retailers, or from their home. They are paid directly or quite often on credit, from a customer base of both men and women. They hope to reach individual monthly earnings of 30,500 FCFA on average, part of which will be used for savings and family expenses, and the remainder reinvested in the business activities. They would like to have more working capital to better satisfy their customers and become wholesalers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Easther

texts.en:
Easther K. is currently in the business of selling sugar and onions in the market and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of sugar to sell.  Easther is 23 years old and married; her husband is a carpenter. She has 2 children, who attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more bags of sugar to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 24-year-old artisan who makes cooking pots and pans. He has hired two people, who assist him in his business. He also practices farming for extra income. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for financing his business, which has allowed him to expand, and for helping him improve his customer service skills. He hopes to expand his business further so as to support his family better, hence he has requested a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy steel and add to his stock of tools. He dreams of having his own store in order to supply his products wholesale. He describes himself as industrious and hard-working.

loans.use: To buy steel for manufacturing

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es: Rafael Antonio M. L. de 57 años de edad, reside en Ilopango, departamento de San Salvador. Vive en casa propia en compañía de su esposa la cual se dedica a trabajar como empleada doméstica, y lavando y planchando para otras personas. Rafael posee una venta de pañales desechables para bebé, de diferentes marcas y precios. Así mismo vende ropa para niños y adultos, estos productos Rafael los comercializa de manera ambulante en diferentes departamentos del país, sobre todo en el departamento de San Miguel, lugar en el cual obtiene mayores ventas. Él solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder aumentar sus productos y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas, ya que en cuenta con todo el deseo de poder mejorar su estabilidad económica y poder contar con una vida mejor para él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio M. L. is 57 years old and resides in Ilopango, located in the department of San Salvador. He lives in his own home with his wife, who works as a housekeeper and does the laundry and ironing for other people. Rafael has a business selling disposable baby diapers of different brands and prices. He also sells clothing for children and adults. Rafael offers his products as a traveling merchant to different departments within the country, especially in the Department of San Miguel where he generates most of his sales.

The loan he is requesting will be used to increase his inventory of products so that he can generate more sales. He hopes to improve his financial stability and make a better life for himself and his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & disposable baby diapers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en: Salwa is a thirty-nine-year-old woman who lives in Saida, which is in southern Lebanon, with her four children. Salwa owns a shop that sells clothing for babies and children. She also sells accessories for babies like baby bottles, towels, bibs, and toys. She decided to open her shop because she gained experience in sales and always wanted to own a shop for her own. She requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise; especially now that summer is coming, she needs to buy clothing to match the new season. This is the first time Salwa has requested a loan. When she first started her business, she had some difficulty diversifying her merchandise. For the future, she plans to keep on improving her loan.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en: Mrs. Chanda S. was born in 1982. She lives in Ta Ou Khang Cheung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Bros Sem (pictured on the left), is a cow middleman. Since her husband’s business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, she decided to request a loan to buy two cows for resale. Mrs. Chanda S. supports two children: her older child is enrolled in a local public school, and her youngest is two years old.

loans.use: To buy two cows for resale.

loans.name: Julia Jacqueline

texts.es:
Julia de 35 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijas de 13 y 10 años estudian en colegios fiscales. Empezó a ser costurera a los 17 años cuando salio del colegio, pero al no tener oportunidades de trabajo en otras partes, tuvo que trabaja desde su casa con una maquina pequeña haciendo trabajos de remendaduras a sus vecinos. 

Poco a poco fue creciendo sus ingresos en el taller de costurera, hace 10 años atrás ella decidió invertir dinero en telas y confeccionar su propia ropa para almacenes. Por esa buena decisión ahora tiene maquinas de coser industriales y reparte al por menor a sus clientes. Trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h00 todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas y hilos para promocionar a los almacenes ropa confeccionada por ella. En el futuro quiere tener su propia línea de ropa y distribuir al por mayor.
texts.en:
Julia is 35 years old and lives in the urban area of Suburbio de Guayaquil; she has 2 daughters who are 10 and 13 and are in primary school. She started sewing 17 years ago when she finished secondary school, but since she didn't have other job opportunities elsewhere, she started working out of her home mending clothing for her neighbors with a small sewing machine. Little by little she increased her income in her workshop; 10 years ago, she invested in cloth and began making her own clothes for larger warehouses to sell. Due to this good decision, she now has industrial sewing machines and she sells retail to her customers. She works from 8 am to 7 pm every day. She will use the loan to buy fabric and thread to sell more clothing to the larger warehouses. In the future she would like to have her own clothing line and distribute wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric and thread

loans.name: Paola Mayela

texts.es: Paola Mayela tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos, los cuales son menores de edad. Ella tiene un taxi, el cual lo alquila y todos los días sale a trabajar. Este taxi lo compro desde hace  6 años, y desde esa fecha ha salido buen vehículo. Actualmente desea invertirle al vehículo mantenimiento general y comprándole algunos repuestos, con el objetivo de que no tenga ningún problema. Sus problemas, al igual que todo transportista es el precio del combustible, que cada día se hace más caro. El sueño a corto plazo que desea cumplir la señora es comprar otra unidad, para brindar otro ingreso y otro empleo a la familia, ya que el vehículo que tienen es manejado por uno de sus hermanos.
texts.en:
Paola Mayela is 30 years old; she is married and has two underage children. She has a taxi which she hires out and everyday she goes to work. She bought the taxi 6 years ago and since then it has been in a good state. At present, she wants to invest in the car by performing a general maintenance on it and to buy some spare parts so that there won’t be any problems. Her problems are the same as anyone in the transportation sector, mainly in gas prices which are increasing everyday. Her dream in the short term is to buy another vehicle to bring more income and another job for her family since the vehicle that she already owns is driven by one of her brothers.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Zaitoon Begum's Group

texts.en:
Zaitoon Begum has applied for a loan from Asasah for the growth of her business selling clothes. She lives with her family in Multan, a city famous for sweetmeats in Pakistan. She is an enthusiastic lady who enjoys doing her work. She purchases clothes from the nearby markets, because good fabrics are also a specialty of Multan city, and this is a benefit for those who are involved in the clothes selling business. 

Zaitoon Begum sells clothes in her community and to relatives and this generates profit for her family. She has been involved in this work for the past six years. With this loan, she will buy a better quality of clothes which she can sells at good profit.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: Petronila V. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 57 years old, is widowed, and has four adult children. Petronila owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Petronila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam and her family run a restaurant in Jabalia, a city in the Gaza Strip. Khitam is the mother of five sons and two daughters. 

Khitam and her husband, Mohammad, have been fixing a few things and replacing old equipment in the restaurant. They still need to replace the old oven, so Khitam came to Faten and received a $1,500 loan for this purpose.

Khitam, her husband, and children are known for their honesty and good manners. In the future, Khitam and her husband plan to have a bigger restaurant that serves seafood if the returns from the current restaurant increase as expected.

In the photo, Khitam's husband, Mohammad, is working in the restaurant.

loans.use: Purchasing ovens

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 4  enfants et  vivant dans des  familles polygames à SEREKENI un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et  les  trois prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont :, le pois de terre et le riz  tel le cas de SITAN T..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, les petits matériels et prendre des manœuvres  pour entretenir : 1h hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65 000fcfa  en fin de campagne.
Son bénéfice  lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women with an average age of 39 and an average of four children, living in polygamous families in Serekeni, a village in the commune of Loulouni in the subprefecture of Loulouni (Third Administrative Region of Mali). They work with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, to better organize their farming activity during the rains. This is their fourth loan; the three previous loans have been repaid fully. Sitan T. grows blackeyed peas and rice. With her loan she will buy fertilizer and small tools, and hire help to crop one hectare. Her produce will be sold in the village, and in the market in Loulouni to resellers. At the end of the season, she hopes for a profit of 65,000 FCFA, with which she will repay her loan and help her husband pay the day-to-day expenses of their family.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for seed, fertilizer, herbicide, tilling, weeding and hand tools

loans.name: Adeela's Group

texts.en:
Adeela lives in the mid-sized city called Vehari in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives in a 4-room brick house in a village adjacent to the city. She is the mother of two sons, both of whom are illiterate and work for the Municipal Corporation. Her husband is doing a private job for low wages. 

Adeela supports her family financially by selling clothing. She purchases it from Multan and sells it to her local market for a profit. She has been in this business for the last two years and is getting good earnings from it.

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her clothing sales business. With the loan, she will buy clothing in bulk. The bulk purchasing will minimize the cost of her traveling and increases her profits. 

She is in her second loan cycle and has been found to be a responsible loan user of Asasah. In her first year of loaning experience, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for reselling

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita J. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old and is married with one school-aged child. Rosita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa Maria tiene 45 años, su actividad es la venta de pollos y servicio de molino. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, ella es una mujer muy luchadora y trabajadora. Cuando ella inicio fue desde muy joven pues busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos pues tiene que mantener a sus 3 hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de equipo para el molino y compra de pollo. Ella sueña con mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria is 45 years old and she sells chicken and provides milling services. She has had this business for the past 7 years. She has always looked for a way to improve her income. She is a fighter and a hardworking woman. When she first started out she was very young and she was looking for a way to improve her income and a way to support her 3 children. The loan that she requests will be used to purchase a new mill and to purchase chicken. She dreams of always being able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “MUJERES UNIDAS ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de  San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. David;   el tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente; y tiene 4 hijos,  El socio se dedica a la carpintería  desde hace 14 años, el socio solicita el préstamo para comprar roteador, taladro, y otras herramientas; El socio comprará estas herramientas para realizar sus trabajos. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar herramientas.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The member belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Unidas" [United Women]. The communal bank is located in the district of San Sebastián, in the province and department of Cusco. The member is David, 41, who has a live-in partner and four children. The member has been a carpenter since the age of 14. He is seeking the loan for the purchase of a router, drill and other tools, which he will purchase in order to complete his jobs. The member seeks the loan for the purchase of tools. The member appreciates and gives thanks for the loan granted through these means and likewise promises to make his payments within the established time period.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes J.  is currently in the business of selling food items in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize and beans to sell.  Agnes is 38 years old and is married to a policeman. She has three children and two of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy some land.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Cecilia Ignacia

texts.es: Cecilia Ignacia tiene 54 años, su actividad es abarrotería. En su vivienda que es donde está ubicado su negocio, llegan una gran variedad de clientes a buscar los diferentes productos que solicitan. Hace más de 9 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita créditos, ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y que paga sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Inicio porque no tenía los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Este crédito es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, maíz entre otros.
texts.en:
Cecilia Ignacia is 54 years old and runs a grocery store. A wide variety of customers come to her home where her business is located to find the different products they need.

She has been running this business for more than nine years, so it is not the first time she has applied for a loan. She has proven to be a responsible person who pays her dues in a timely manner. She started her business because she had no income to support her family.

This loan will be used to purchase rice, beans, oil, sugar, corn among others.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Juan Xxi Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Amigas por siempre” inicia su ciclo Nº3 en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, es un grupo que ha compartido un año juntas, ya se conocen como amigas y también como garantes.  La banca comunal está compuesta por diez integrantes.  Los negocios que desempeñan son: macramé de mantas, venta de pollo a la broster, verduras, tejido de chompas, venta de mantillas, estilista, macramé, venta de carne de chancho, tejido de lanas, venta de queso y papa.

 La presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Elsa  es una mujer joven de 23 años de edad, al momento se encuentra esperando su primer bebé.  Comenta que está en la banca comunal de “Amigas por siempre” desde su fundación.  La señora Elsa tiene como negocio tejido a máquina en lana de alpaca, de diferentes tipos de prenda, ponchos, chompas y otros.  Su primer préstamo fue por Bs.1000.- y fue invertido en la compra de lana, para este ciclo su solicitud fue de Bs.2000 con el mismo objetivo.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta  compartir con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Amigas por siempre” (Friends Forever) Community Bank is in its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Central Andean Region. This group has been together for a year, and they know each other as friends and loan partners. The group is comprised of ten members who work in various businesses, such as blanket weaving, broasted chicken sales, vegetables, knitting sweaters, selling lace, hairstyling, macramé, selling pork, knitting with wool, and selling cheese and potatoes.

Mrs. Elsa is the president of the community bank. She is a young woman, 23 years old, and is currently awaiting the arrival of her first baby. She shares she has been part of this community bank since it began. Mrs. Elsa works knitting alpaca wool by machine to make different types of clothing, ponchos, sweaters, and more. Her first loan of 1,000 bolivianos was used to buy wool. The current loan for this cycle is for 2,000 bolivianos to be used for the same purpose.

Her favorite part of working with Pro Mujer is that she likes sharing with her loan partners.

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transportation.

She has operated a business selling fried potatoes for over two years. She sells from her home to schoolchildren and neighbors. Caroline faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a café in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase blocks to construct her house. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan and improve her living standard.

loans.use: To  purchase blocks to construct her house.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie S. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. She is 57 years old. Emie is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Emie owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector running a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling bamboo walls (Amakan) to local businesses and community members. Emie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Emie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Emie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie A. is 55 years old and married. She is from the town of Sto. Niño. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Tessie works hard so that her business can grow. 

Tessie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Tessie is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her family’s house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito B. is from the village of POBLACION 4 CLARIN MISAMIS OCCIDENTAL. He is 52 years old. Carlito is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Carlito owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating MOTOR transport services. Carlito has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Carlito joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carlito is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Carlito from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy O. is 43 years old and her husband, Mr. Panh Om is also 43 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married for almost 20 years and have 6 children - two sons and four daughters. Two are employed full-time, two attend school and the other two are still young. 

Chanthy and her husband are rice farmers. Mr. Panh Om also drives a motor taxi when he is done with farming. Chanthy is asking for her first loan of $800 to purchase cows to assist her rice farm. She will use the cows to plow her rice farmland.

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow her rice farm.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina vive  en la ciudad de Oropesa provincia del Cusco, Perú. Ella tiene 44 años de edad y tiene tres hijos de las cuales todos son independientes. Marcelina se dedica a la panadería y elabora panes “Chuta” que son panes tradicionales de la ciudad de Oropesa y Cusco. Marcelina junto con su hermano Victor abrieron hace 15 años la panadería “Virgen Estrella”. En esta oportunidad Marcelina requiere el micro crédito para comprar materiales o insumos como por ejemplo harina y levadura. Marcelina distribuye a revendedores de la ciudad del Cusco y también cuando hay tiempo lleva a la ciudad de Juliaca del departamento de Puno. 

Marcelina pertenece al banco comunal “RICCHARIY PURIRISUN” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Marcelina lives in the city of Oropesa, province of Cusco, Peru. She is 44 years old and has three children, all grown up. Marcelina makes a living with her bakery, making the "Chuta" bread that is traditional in the cities of Oropesa and Cusco. Marcelina, along with her brother Victor, opened their bakery, "Virgen Estrella", about 15 years ago. She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies and ingredients, such as flour and yeast. Marcelina distributes to vendors in Cusco and also, when she has time, in the city of Juliaca, department of Puno. Marcelina belongs to the "Ricchariy Puririsun" community bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity provided through this medium and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and ingredients, such as flour and yeast.

loans.name: Lourdes' Group

texts.en:
Lourdes R. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan arranged by ASKI. While each member of the group would receive an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if, say, one member is delinquent or defaults on his or her portion of the group loan.

Lourdes is a 51-year-old woman from the village of Carabatan Punta, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is married and has 5 adult-age children. To earn a living, Lourdes owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector. Specifically, her primary source of income is derived from planting and harvesting coconut for sale. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over 9 years, and she earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Lourdes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. In turn, she hopes to be better able to engage in business activities and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Lourdes is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP (of the 33,000 PHP, or $775, group loan being sought), which would be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase her working capital. This loan would be the first loan taken out by Lourdes from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to supplement her family's income.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory and increasing working capital

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 54-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a local coffee shop business. She lives in the island of Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her coffee shop business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 11,500. Teresita is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase coffee to sell. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Teresita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more coffee

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 27-year-old married man with a child living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family, since his wife does not work. His desire is to set up an income-generating activity for his wife. He is a banker and has been in service for three years as a loans officer. Patrick intends to use the loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a farmer who lives in the town of Litein in Kenya. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and now has seven children, all of whom are in school. His main crops are maize and tea, which he sells in a local market, and his biggest challenges are drought and poor transportation. He has applied for a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He has successfully repaid his first loan from our organization, which was for 30,000 KES. He believes that this second loan will allow him to expand his farm and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy and insure a cow

loans.name: Asein

texts.en:
Asein U. is 63 and married with three children. He has been engaged in livestock breeding since 2001, which is the only mean of subsistence for his family.  He has a farm with 20 sheep, 4 milk cows, and 6 horses. He plans to increase the number of livestock. For this reason, Asein has applied for a loan of 30.000 KGS to purchase 10 sheep. It will allow him to further broaden his business activities and accumulate money to purchase a flat for his daughter.
  
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a su esposa y un hijo de tres años, él se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de chile, por el momento se está preparando para adquirir un buen número de plantas.
Solicita un préstamo que cubra el gasto de la compra de chiles, también abono y tratamiento para las plagas, esta compra le ayudara para que pueda tener una nueva producción.
Su aspiración es tener todo lo necesario para poder vivir dignamente y satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia.
texts.en:
David lives in El Transito, San Miguel Department, with his wife and three-year-old son.  He’s a farmer, specifically chilies.  He is currently preparing to acquire a good number of plants.

He is asking for a loan to cover the purchase of the chilies and also manure and insecticide.  This purchase will help him have a new production.

His wish is to have everything necessary to live decently and meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy chili plants, manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Analida

texts.es: Analida Maria vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica al tradicional oficio de confeccionar vestidos y como actividad adicional también vende mercancía; ella es viuda y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 29  y 30 años con los que ha logrado salir adelante  y  sueña con verlos prósperos y exitosos. Analida inició su negocio después de haber trabajado en una confección en la que construyó mucha de su experiencia,  por eso cuando inició su propia aventura empresarial, lo hizo fabricando vestidos para damas y también vestidos para novia, con los cuales se dio a conocer en el mercado;  hoy en día su negocio es reconocido por muchos clientes en el sector donde habita y en sus alrededores; por eso  apoyándose en esta base comercial  ha logrado atraer nuevos clientes y  hace tres años diversificó la oferta de sus productos y agregó mercancia variada, la cual está distribuyendo  a crédito y está moviendose en la línea de perfumes, cosméticos y accesorios. Su sueño más adelante es adquirir una fileteadora, para perfeccionar el acabado de sus prendas y lograr acceder a nuevos mercados  donde pueda tener mayor posicionamiento. Este es el  quinto financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con la cual comprará telas, e insumos como botones e hilos para vestir elegante a sus mas sofisticada clientela.
texts.en: Analida Maria lives in the city of Barranquilla and makes a living in the traditional trade of dressmaking, and as an additional activity she sells merchandise.  She is a widow and has 2 sons of 29 and 30 years of age, with which she has been able to get ahead.  She dreams with seeing them being successful and prosperous.  Analida started her business after working in the garment industry where she obtained all her experience.  When she embarked on her business venture she started it with the making of dresses for women and also bridal dresses, with which she became known in the market.  Currently, her business is known by many customers in the area where she lives and surrounding areas.  Supporting herself with this client base, she has been able to attract new customers and in the last three years to diversify her products and add varied merchandise which she distributes on credit.  She is beginning to sell perfumes, cosmetics and accessories.  She wishes to get a serger to be able to perfect the finishing of her garments and be able to reach other markets where she can be positioned better.  This is her fifth loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy fabric, and supplies such as buttons and thread, to be able to elegantly dress her sophisticated customers.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and supplies such as buttons and thread.

loans.name: Raneen

texts.en:
Raneen is a young woman from Tulkarem. She is married and a housewife. Raneen's husband is a construction worker who managed to save money to build his own house. Now that the house is almost ready, Raneen took out a loan from FATEN so that her husband can purchase the materials needed to plaster and paint the walls.

Raneen is pregnant and expecting her first baby soon. Raneen, who appears in the picture, wants to have the house ready to move in to before the baby is born.

loans.use: to plaster the walls of her house

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 21 год. Он холост. Живет вместе с родителями. У него среднее образование. Он открыл продуктовый магазин в селе Куйбешев.  В этой области он работает уже полтора года. Муродали берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара. То есть он хочет купить булочки, консервированные товары, сахар, конфеты, фрукты, мыло и туалетную бумагу.
texts.en: Murodali lives in the city of Kulob. He is 21 years old and single. He lives with his parents. He has a secondary education. He opened a grocery shop in Kuybeshev village. He has been doing this work for a year and a half. Murodali is taking out a loan to increase the variety of goods he sells.  In other words, he wishes to buy buns, canned goods, sugar, sweets, fruit, soap, and toilet paper.

loans.use: to increase the variety of goods he sells

loans.name: Honeylyn

texts.en:
20-year-old Honeylyn has had a backyard pig raising business for three years now. Honeylyn is married and a mother of two children .She invested in a sow to raise multiple piglets in a short time. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She earns a total average monthly income of PHP 4,000 from this business. Honeylyn has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase a sow for piglets. 
Honeylyn has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Honeylyn hopes to raise pigs on a large scale.

loans.use: To purchase an additional sow for piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start her own clothing store

loans.name: Raed

texts.en: Raed is a 31-year-old young man. He is married and has one son. He lives in Sammou' village, Hebron located in Palestine. Raed owns a vehicle workshop, which is rarely found in the area where he lives, Raed has the only dynamo-meter used to check cars and other vehicles. This is the only source of income for the family. His plan is to expand this project and purchase a new dynamo-meter to replace the old one he has and attract more customers in addition to saving time when using the new one.  As Raed doesn't have enough cash to pay for it, he needs to take a loan of $1,500 for this purpose from FATEN. Raed is photographed in FATEN's branch with his father.

loans.use: To purchase a new dynamo-meter

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is single. She lives in Melitopol and sells jewelry in one of the local markets. She offers a wide variety of merchandise for sale in her vending location. Marina’s trade has grown a lot in the past four years. Presently, her monthly profit is about 4,000 Hryvnias.

Marina lives with her parents in a three-room apartment. Her fellow market vendors characterize her as an enterprising, sociable and hardworking person. Marina is seeking a loan of 18,000 Hryvnias to increase the assortment of inventory she offers for retail sale. She is hoping to continue developing her trade in the future and to see it flourish even more.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of inventory.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Monsieur Saliou est un jeune homme marié de 31 ans. Il habite au Sénégal. Il vit au Sénégal depuis le bas âge. Il évolue dans le secteur du transport et conduit un car de transport en commun depuis 7 ans. Il a choisi ce métier car il a toujours rêvé  obtenir son propre véhicule de transport.  Et ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif de l’activité qui lui permet de subvenir a ses besoins personnels. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis septembre 2006. Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 fr prévu pour la réfection  de son car qui a eu un choc récemment. Ce financement lui permettra de ne pas interrompre ses activités et de continuer a rentabiliser son activité.
texts.en: Saliou is a young married man of 31 years.  He lives in Senegal, and has lived there since he was young.  He works in transportation, and has been driving a small public transportation bus for seven years.  He chose this profession because he always dreamed of owning his own transportation vehicle.  For him, the best part is the profitable aspect of the business, which enables him to meet his personal needs.  He has been a member at one of the UIMCEC savings and credit unions since September, 2006.  He is asking for a loan of 300,000 francs to carry out repair work on his bus, which was recently in a collision.  This financing will prevent him from being forced to stop working, and enable him to continue to make his business profitable.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repair work

loans.name: Gabina Margarita

texts.es:
Gabina nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo  y tiene 50 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos.  
 
Actualmente, Gabina vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella se dedica a la venta  planchas, ollas y otras cosa más, ella viaja a diferentes ciudades a vender sus productos como por ejemplo a puerto Maldonado, Andahuayllas, Abancay, Ayacucho y Juliaca. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Gabina requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como ollas.  

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Gabina was born in the city of Paucartambo and is 50 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage, from which she has five children.

Currently, Gabina lives and works in her native city. She sells griddles, pots and pans, and other things. She travels to various cities to sell her products, for example to Puerto Maldonado, Andahuayllas, Abancay, Ayacucho, and Juliaca. She has been involved in this business for several years now, and it is going very well for her. At this time, Gabina needs the loan to buy more merchandise such as pots and pans.

The "Comuzone I" communal bank meets every month in Cusco (Peru). Cusco is known for being a very touristy, commercial area and for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, as well as for having one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as pots and pans.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Juliet has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & rice per kilograms. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & rice to sell.

Juliet is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & rice to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 43 years old, has owned and operated a food vending business for six years.  While promoting healthier living to customers, Nenita sees this business venture as an opportunity to be an entrepreneur, and help her family with their household expense. 

Nenita is married to a farmer and this couple had been blessed with three children.  Two of her children are still studying, while the third one is married. She saw a need to create healthier food choices for people in her community while satisfying their taste buds.  Nenita sells siopao, native cakes and homed-made breads door to door and by order.  Her greatest challenge is overcoming roadblocks, like acquiring credit and operating and financing the food production. She is requesting a loan for P20,000, to purchase sacs of flour, baking soda, yeast, brown sugar and milk for her food production business.

She dreams of improving the appearance and taste of the food she makes, leading to an increase in her income.    This will allow her to buy an oven and other equipment needed, to fulfill a higher volume of customer orders and make a wider variety of foods.  She hopes that she can fulfill her dreams and send her children into higher level of education with her savings from the business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, baking soda, yeast, brown sugar and milk for her food production business

loans.name: Serah Wavinya

texts.en: Serah is still married. She paid her previous loan well and on time. She runs a green grocery store where she sells assorted vegetables. She had been in this business for the last seven year, and earns a monthly profit of 12,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). Her profit has increased slightly so far. This is her second loan, which she plans to use to buy more assorted vegetables for sale. In the future she desires to grow her business and open a small restaurant to start selling cooked foods for her customers.

loans.use: To buy a stock of assorted vegetables for sale

loans.name: Halimata

texts.fr:
Mme Halimata est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 02mois 20jours.01 de ses enfants va à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend du savon kabakourou (provenant de la Côte d’Ivoire), des pagnes uni wax et du haricot depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne à ABIDJAN en Côte d’Ivoire. Elle achète les produits Burkinabé pour aller vendre en Côte d’Ivoire et ramène les produits Ivoiriens qu’elle vend au Burkina Faso. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 20 moutons, 10 sacs de gombo sec, 02 sacs de soumbala et un sac de feuille de baobab.

Mme veut agrandir son commerce avec ses économies et aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales. Elle ambitionne améliorer son activité en exportant ses produits dans les autres pays et payer  la scolarisation de ses enfants .
texts.en:
Mrs. Halimata is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 20, and the youngest is 2 months and 20 days. One child attends school. She has five persons to support.

For ten years, she's been selling "kabakourou" soap (coming from Côte d'Ivoire), pagnes "uni wax" (colorful African cloth), and beans. She gets her supplies in Abidjan (Côte d'Ivoire).

She buys products in Burnika Faso and travels to Côte d'Ivoire to sell them, and then purchases products there, that she brings back and sells in Burkina Faso. Her customers are women. 

She wants to buy 20 sheep, 10 sacks of dried okra, 2 sacks of soumbala (African condiment), and of sack of baobab leaves.

Mrs. Halimata wants to expand her business with her savings, and help her husband with the family expenses. She ambitions to bolster her business by exporting products to other countries, and pay her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheep, 10 sacks of dried okra, 2 sacks of soumbala (African condiment), and of sack of baobab leaves

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 52 years old and blessed with three children. 

He is a diligent farmer who sends his children to school through his farming income. Through perseverance, he is able to provide the educational needs of his children. However, most of the time, they lack allowances. He would not want this to affect their studies, so he also focuses his attention on improving his agricultural activity.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. He hopes this will help him to get better crops in the coming harvesting season. With farming and his determination, Reynaldo is expecting to continue to send his children to school and to college.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Lap

texts.en:
Lap is a 31 year old married man. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. They have 2 children. 

He and his wife earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 4 years. Lap would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock his general store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that through the loan his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock his general store

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva de 36 años, convive hace 12 años con Sergio, su pareja. Ambos tienen 2 hijos de 12 y 10 años. Esta familia vive en el anexo de Ricricán en el distrito de Palcamayo. Primitiva es una mujer que ve en el esfuerzo la esencia misma del progreso. Por esa razón se desempeña en un negocio de verduras en el mercado mayorista, donde cuenta con dos puestos de venta. 
Su trabajo consiste en la compra al por mayor de verduras, de la cuidad de Lima, como son: camotes, tomates, ají colorado, limón, apio de la costa, etc. A la vez, cuenta con sembríos propios de papa, pero solo es para el consumo de su familia, ya que se dedica de lleno a las verduras. “No es necesario que viaje, como tengo varios años en este negocio, solo envío dinero, como 3000 a 4000 soles, y la mercadería me llega cada martes o jueves. Es bien rentable.”, Explica. Son 3 años los que lleva en el trabajo. Los miércoles y viernes viaja a la selva central (La Merced), para expender sus productos. De esa manera, Primitiva construirá su casa en el mismo centro de Palcamayo, donde ya cuenta con un terreno propio. Con su ayuda, Primitiva accederá a su préstamo número 15 de MFP. Se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Afirma que le agrada el trabajo de su banco comunal, por la solidaridad y oportunidad de emprendimiento.
De recibir el dinero del crédito, invertirá todo en la compra de verduras para continuar con el negocio.
texts.en:
Primitiva is 36 years old and has been in a common-law relationship with her partner Sergio for 12 years. They have two children, ages 12 and 10. This family lives in the annex of Ricricán, which is located in the District of Palcamayo. Primitiva is a woman who strives to make progress. For this reason, she has established a business selling vegetables at the wholesale market where she has two vending stalls.

Her work consists of selling vegetables in bulk from the city of Lima such as sweet potatoes, tomatoes, red chili peppers, lemons, coastal celery, and other items. She also grows her own potatoes, but only for family consumption. Primitiva devotes herself to selling vegetables full-time. She explains, “I have no need to travel since I have been in this business for several years. I send the money, between 3000 to 4000 PEN, and the merchandise arrives every Tuesday or Thursday. It is very profitable.” Primitiva has been doing this work for three years. On Wednesdays and Fridays, she travels to La Merced in the central jungle to distribute her products. She plans to build a house in central Palcamayo where she has her own land.

Primitiva will access her 15th loan with MFP. She promises to be punctual with her loan payments. Primitiva indicates that she is in agreement with the work of her Communal Bank that promotes unity and entrepreneurial opportunities. Upon receiving her loan, Primitiva plans to invest all of the money in the purchase of vegetables so that she can continue her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Kuttubek

texts.ru:
Куттубек работает преподавателем химии в школе села Кара-Суу, что на севере Кыргызстана. Ему 33 года, женат и воспитывает трех детей дошкольного возраста.  
 В связи с тем, что его заработная плата не покрывала всех расходов семьи, Куттубек, в поисках дополнительного источника дохода, начал заниматься разведением скота. Начав свой бизнес  со стартовой суммой 25,000 сом , Куттубек приложил все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, приносящего на сегодняшний день прибыль в 3,000 сом ежемесячно от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Куттубек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. 
В будущем, Куттубек планирует расширять поголовье скота,  с целью повышения продаж молока.
texts.en:
Kuttubek is working as a teacher of chemistry at school in the village of Kara-Suu in northern Kyrgyzstan. He is 33 years old, he is married and has three young children.

Due to the fact that his salary did not cover all expenses of the family and by searching for an additional source of income Kuttubek began to breed cattle. Starting his business with a starting amount of 25,000 KGS Kuttubek made ​​every effort to grow his business which to date brings a profit of 3,000 soms per month from the sale of meat and dairy products. For further development of his business Kuttubek has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 80,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of dairy cows.

In the future, Kuttubek plans to expand the number of livestock in order to increase sales of milk.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Azucena Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras se han unido para poder formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Vieron en este programa, una gran oportunidad de crecimiento, no solo en lo económico sino ta,bien en lo personal. Están muy contentas y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Una de esas mujeres es la señora Catalina, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de leche. Dice que empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano, para que así, a la hora del desayuno su producto ya se encuentre en las mesas de sus clientes. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, trabaja sin cansancio para de esa forma ayudar en la casa y a su familia.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de leche en cantidad, para que de esa forma pueda asegurar su producto esencial a los clientes.
texts.en:
A group of 15 hard-working, determined women got together to participate in the women entrepreneur program through the Fundación Paraguaya.  Thye saw in the program an opportunity for growth, not only economic but also personal.  They are very happy and want to go as far as the program will take them.

On of these women is Mrs. Catalina who sells milk.  She begins work very early in the morning so that her product is already on her customers' tables for breakfast.  She defines herself as a hard-working, determined woman who works tirelessly so she can help out at home and with her family.

She is requesting support from the Fundación and Kiva to buy large volumes of milk so she can make sure her customers have this essential product.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Arevabuyr village with her husband and two children. She has been engaged in agriculture for more than 13 years. 

Susanna has applied for a loan to purchase potato seeds. Susanna keeps a greenhouse, which is where she plans to plant the seeds. Susanna hopes she will have a good harvest of potatoes, which she will use to sustain her family as well as sell for additional income.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds

loans.name: Mary Celeste

texts.es:
Mary Celeste tiene 28 años de edad es soltera vive con los padres en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es Integrante  de la VRC TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Mary se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, frejol, arveja. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, líquidos, abonos, urea, insecticidas para las siembras. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia dedicándose a la siembra para que el producto salga bueno y poder venderlo a un buen precio.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrentar son las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es  comprar terreno.

En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Mary Celeste is 28 years old, single and lives with her parents in Ventanas, Provincia de Los Ríos. She is a member of VRC Tierra Nuestra, located in the San Luis de Zapotal precinct which is part of the Ventanas district. This Ventanas local works in agriculture, planting corn and rice as part of the short sowing season. As well as corn, she also sows beans and peas. The sale and purchase of this produce is all done in Ventanas.

Mary Celeste is applying for a loan to purchase seeds, solid and liquid fertiliser, urea and insecticide for the sowing season. With the help of this loan, she will be able to improve her family's lifestyle, dedicating herself to sowing so that her produce grows well, which will enable her to go on to sell it at a good price. 

The challenges that Mary Celeste faces are plagues, diseases and changeable weather. Her dream is to buy a plot of land. In her spare time, Mary Celeste likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, solid and liquid fertiliser, urea and insecticide for the sowing season

loans.name: Marie Noël

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by nine women from the village of Oussouye in the Casamance region of southern Senegal. Represented by their leader Marie Noël D., the women plan to purchase goods produced in their village, including brooms made from palm fronds, oysters, lemon juice, dried fish; and to sell them in distant markets where they fetch much higher prices. Loan funds will cover both the purchase of these goods and their transport to market. The group describes their business as follows:

“This enterprise consists of small-scale trade in seafood and forest products. These products are very numerous in our area, and will be sold in other regions of the country. The purpose of the loan is to help secure self-sufficiency in food, improve nutrition, reduce migration from rural areas, and create employment for young people. Our business activities will be conducted as follows:

• Purchase of the products locally

• Sale of the products in other areas where they are scarce”

Original French:

« Contexte du Projet. : Ce projet est un projet de petit commerce de produits halieutique et forestier. Ces produits sont très nombreux dans notre localité et seront vendus dans les autres régions du pays.

Objectifs du Prêt : : L’objectif du projet est :

- Aider à assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire

- Améliore l’alimentation

- De ré réduire les problèmes de l’exode rural

- Créer de l’emploi pour les jeunes

Activités : Ces activités seront menées comme suite :

- Achats de produis au niveau local

- Vente des produits dans les autres localités ou il manque »

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of village products (palm brooms, oysters, lemon juice, dried fish) and transportation to market

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en: Bashorat K. has 6 children. Her husband works at the big plant that produces aluminum. He is a worker. Four of their children live with them in one house. They help Bashorat in her business. They bring the goods from Dushanbe central wholesale market together. Due to strong wedding traditions Bashorat needs additional resources for her elder son and daughter. In Tajikistan one of the sons stays with his parents after he gets married. They work hard because they have to expand their house for their daughter-in-law. She hopes that her son will get married this year. Her current request for a loan is for buying new season clothes. She considers spring to be a good season for her trade as weather becomes warm and people tend to buy many new things.

loans.use: Purchase spring season clothes

loans.name: Chelsa

texts.en: testing- there was a problem for K-MET when uploading photos.....

loans.use: testing

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María lives with her common-law husband and they have two children, 18 and 19 years old. She started her business 12 years ago in order to help with the family expenses, since her husband’s income wasn’t enough to sustain the family. He works as a plasterer. María also supports her father via her business, as he is elderly and lives with her and her family.

María is requesting a loan of $925.00 to supply herself with merchandise and thereby increase her sales. She offers to pay the loan in 6 months and she is very thankful for your support as she continues to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María vive en unión libre con su pareja y tienen dos hijos de 18 y 19 años de edad. Ella empezó con su negocio hace 12 años atrás para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares ya que los ingresos de su pareja no eran suficientes para el mantenimiento de la familia, él trabaja por su cuenta de yesero. María con su negocio también mantiene a su padre que ya es mayor de edad y que vive en casa con ella y su familia.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para poder surtirse de mercadería y así incrementar sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y te agradece mucho tu apoyo para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her small grocery store

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Ruben, a responsible and hard-working man, lives in Tampico [in the northeastern Mexican state of] Tamaulipas. He's worked in sales from a very young age; twenty-six years ago, he decided to strike out on his own and start his own business. Ruben is married and has three children who are 8-, 10-, and 15-years old; they were the motive behind his drive to build his business selling household products. Thanks to the good service he offers, his sales improved greatly and he was able to buy a truck to transport his products.

Ruben now needs a US$650 loan that he will use to buy merchandise to cover demand from his customers. He wants to be prepared for the coming season. He promises to repay the amount in 6 months. Be part of Ruben's success.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Tampico, Tamaulipas vive Rubén, es muy trabajador y responsable, desde muy joven se dedica a las ventas y hace 26 años decidió independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio. Rubén está casado y tiene tres hijos de 8, 10 y 15 años de edad, ellos lo han motivado a esforzarse por hacer crecer su negocio donde vende diversos productos para el hogar, gracias al buen servicio que ofrece sus ventas mejoraron mucho y pudo adquirir una camioneta en la que hoy transporta sus productos.

En estos momentos Rubén necesita un crédito de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, él sabe que se acercan temporadas buenas y quiere estar preparado, se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Ruben.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a single mother four, with her youngest daughter still at home. She became single when her children were still very young. Despite being alone, Esther has been able to support them and see most of them become independent and move on to their own homes. She began her enterprise selling local foods from her own house, an endeavor that is thriving to this day. Her goal is still to generate income for her youngest child’s education, as well as for her own general household expenses. She is assisted by her daughter during breaks from her studies. Thanks to the success of her business, she has been able to expand the types of products she offers and generate sufficient income to help support her and her family. Esther is looking for additional funds to increase her inventory and the items she offers for sale, and she hopes to get her own kiosk where she can sell her products from. She is asking for a loan to help her meet her customers’ demands, with a commitment to repay the loan in six months. Let’s help support Esther’s hard work and dreams for her daughter, and to achieve her goal of her own kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.
