Esther es madre soltera y vive en compañía de la última de sus hijas, de un total de cuatro; ya que cada uno se independizó y formó su propio hogar, a pesar de que se quedó sola cuando sus hijos eran muy pequeños pudo sacarlos adelante y procurarles bienestar sin ayuda alguna.Inició su etapa laboral vendiendo en su pequeña casita comida regional, actividad que aún hasta el día de hoy viene desarrollando con gran éxito, con el propósito de cubrir los gastos de educación de su pequeña hija además de los que genera su hogar; debido a la acogida amplia acogida que tuvo su negocio ha incrementado su variada oferta con la venta de golosinas, bebidas y plátanos cimentando aún más sus ingresos económicos con la ayuda de su hija que colabora con ella alternando sus estudios en un Instituto Pedagógico de la ciudad con la atención y servicio de su centro de ventas.Ahora se encuentra en la necesidad de seguir acrecentando la cantidad y variedad de sus productos para cubrir los gastos familiares con el objetivo de apoyar a su diligente hija para que se convierta en una profesional muy competente, además cuenta con el proyecto de tener un kiosco para expender sus productos también en este lugar.Solicita un préstamo para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes, con un compromiso de devolución de seis meses. Colaboremos con el esfuerzo de Esther para que siga progresando junto a su hija y logre el sueño de tener un kiosco.

loans.use: Purchase additional products/inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invertir en mercaderia

loans.name: Fitria

texts.en: Fitria, 31, is the mother of 3 children, 10, 4 and 1 years old. In order to provide for her family's needs, she sells cosmetics on credit door-to-door. She can earn US$10.5 a week, while her husband, E., sells tires and earns a small income. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$75 to add to her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng H., 29, is married with one school age child. She and her husband sell a variety of vegetables at a busy market and collectively earn about six dollars in revenue each day.

Mrs. H. has humbly requested a loan to rent another stand at the market to meet customer demand, thus raising her standard of living with the additional income.

loans.use: To rent another market stand to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more tables and chairs for the dining area / Comprar mas mesas y sillas para el comedor

loans.name: Laor

texts.en: Laor H. is 53 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province with her husband. Both of them have been rice farmers since 1985, and they earn a little over $2 a day. They have seven children, four of whom are married. One of their daughters is a garment-factory worker and makes about $50 a month. They also have a son who lives in Thailand, where he makes $30 a day and manages to send some money home. Mrs. Laor wants to use her loan to buy a grinding mill to use for food production, and thereby increase her family's income. She hopes to be able to send all of her children to university, and someday buy a second grinding mill.

loans.use: To buy a grinding mill.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es:
Noemy is a hard-working woman. The love of a mother makes her work very hard in the planting of seeds and the sell of alfalfa, food for the animals, etc. She gets the help of her mother, she helps her on a daily basis. At the start of the day she cultivates the goods and sells them as a wholesale. She hopes to establish another of these businesses and improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Noemy es una mujer muy empeñosa, y el amor de madre la impulsa a trabajar incansablemente en la siembra y venta de alfalfa, pastos para los animales, en compañía de su amada madre emprende este trabajo a diario.Al iniciar el día presurosa los recorta de sus campos de cultivo para venderlos al por mayor, desea establecer este negocio para hincar otro a fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de su amada familia.

loans.use: Increase of her materials to improve her farm

loans.name: Gladiz

texts.es:
Gladiz is a retired teacher. Since her income from her pension is not sufficient in Bolivia, she works in selling cosmetics and perfumes.

Her residence in located in the north part of La Paz.

This is the third time that she is requesting a loan at Impro, these loan proceeds will be used to purchase merchandise (cosmetics and perfumes).

Her work, but above all her desire to succeed allow her to qualify for this loan. She is a born fighter, with the goal of improving the quality of her life with the help that we can provide.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Gladiz es jubilada del magisterio, como sus ingresos por jubilación no son los suficientes en Bolivia, se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos y perfumes.

Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona Norte de la ciudad de La Paz.

Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (cosméticos, perfumes)

Su trabajo, pero sobre todo, las ganas de superación de Amanda permiten acceder a este crédito ya que es una mujer luchadora cuyo objetivo es mejorar su calidad vida con la ayuda que le brindaremos.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en: Mr. Sokhom S. is a farmer in Ta Yuos Village in Kampong Speu Province. Aside from this business activity, he collects palm juice to process into sugar. His wife, Mrs. Morn Phoem, helps him on the field. Mr. Sokhom S. usually hires a laborer with draft animals to plow his rice field, but  he has decided to do the plow work himself.  He has decided to request a loan to purchase cows for plowing. Mr. Sokhom S. is 40, and the father of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while two others are enrolled in school. The remaining two are too young to work or study. Previously, Mr. Sokhom S. obtained a loan to hire a laborer to plow the rice field and he bought fertilizers for his field as well. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase cows to plow his rice field.

loans.name: Dinna

texts.en:
Dinna is 30 years. She is married with a five year old child. She sells clothing. Every day she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Dinna now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing for her business to increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her business to increase sales

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María is 40 years old, she lives with her two sons, Yeison, age 16, and Jafel, age 7. Since she was a small girl she was drawn to cosmetology. She likes to bring out the beauty of the whole person, so she decided to invest the savings she has gathered over the years working in opening her own beauty salon. She has been a beautician for over 15 years, during which time her two beautiful sons were born, and they are the motivation and what drive her to persevere in her work. She wants her sons to be successful and have a better future for their families. Today, she has plans to implement and expand her business, therefore, with the hope of receiving your help with a loan, she will be able to pursue her dream of having a bigger salon, and this way meet her children’s education expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

María tiene 40 años, vive con sus dos hijos, Yeison de 16 y Jafel de 7. Desde niña tuvo gran inclinación hacia el trabajo de la cosmetología, le gusta resaltar la belleza de toda persona, por ello que decidió invertir sus ahorros de largos años de trabajo para abrir su propio salón de belleza.Viene dedicándose a esta labor hace más de 15 años, tiempo en que nacieron sus dos adorables hijos, quienes son el motivo que la impulsa a perseverar con su trabajo. Quiere que sus dos hijos sean personas de éxito y tengan un mejor futuro familiar y económico. Actualmente, tiene planes de ampliar e implementar su negocio, por ello, con la esperanza de recibir respuesta favorable a su pedido de préstamo, seguirá con su anhelo de tener un salón más grande, de esa manera, cubrir satisfactoriamente los gastos de educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Implementation and expansion of her beauty salon

loans.name: Tafilele

texts.en: Tafilele P., 35, is married with 7 children. She has 3 years of experience in the flea market and sewing businesses. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). SPBD loans are Tafilele's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She is supported by her husband who works as a carpenter.

loans.use: To purchse materials, thread, niddles, zippers, and Samoan hand bags

loans.name: Ros

texts.en: Mrs. Ros M. was born in 1953 and now lives in Sen Bon village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She and her husband, Mr. Jeth Hoo, are farmers. They are the parents of two children who are employed in a garment factory. However, they do not earn much money for a living. Therefore, Mrs. Ros M. decided to request a loan to buy a cow to feed, so as to add to her business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to expand her business

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida baji is a 48 year old lady and a wife of S. M.. Her husband has a cardboard selling business. Rashida baji resides in Riwind, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 36 years. She is a mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her first two sons work in a factory. Her younger son is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. Her elder daughter works as a teacher in a local school and completed her education until 10th Standard. Her younger daughter is in 8th Standard.

Rashida baji is a seamstress and has been sewing cloths for the past 15 years. Everyone in the community comes to her to stitch their clothes. She successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more cardboard for her husband.

loans.use: To buy cardboard to resell.

loans.name: Najjanakumbi B-Namudu Group

texts.en:
Leocadia N. is 40 years old. she operates a grocery  shop in Najjanakumbi. She has been into business for a period of 4 years but due to insufficient funds, has been unable to meet the rising demands of customers. loan proceeds are therefore enabling her purchase bags of sugar, rice and flour in lump some.She obtains her stock from the busy Kikuubo market in Kampala town.

On a good day, she can sell goods worth Ush 70,000. Her weekly profit margin lies at an average of Ush  80,000. As a married mother of 6 children between ages 24-7 years, she uses  part of the profits to help her husband in fending for the family. She ensures customer loyalty by providing quality services. N. dreams of running a wholesale retail shop in the heart of the city so that she can get increased income to enable her educate the children to university levels.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of sugar, flour and rice.

loans.name: Claudia Yesenia

texts.es:
Claudia Yesenia V. Álvarez no se ha cambiado a su casa poco a poco fue realizando  arreglos como ponerle protecciones pero la dejo sola por un tiempo y le robaron hasta las ventanas. Ahora ella recurre a nosotros para pedir un préstamo para comprar todo lo que se necesita para proteger su casa y que no le vuelva a suceder. Ella solicita un préstamo de $3,000 pesos
Ella se dedica a ejecutiva de ventas el cual tiene un ingreso muy bien pagado el cual para bien la cantidad otorgada.
texts.en:
Claudia Yesenia V. Álvarez had not moved into her home and little by little was making repairs, such as installing security bars, but she left the house alone for awhile and was robbed and even the windows were stolen. She is turning to us to ask for a loan so she can buy what it needed to protect the house so that this does not happen again. She is asking for a loan for 3,000 pesos. She is a salesperson and has a good income sufficient for the loan granted.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy security bars for her home.

loans.name: Anna E.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 47-yea-old Anna M. from Mbeya. She is widowed with 3 children between the ages of 13 and 24. Anna has been running a local restaurant known as “mamalishe” since 1989. 

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough made from maize flour), plantain (a savory cooked banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

She works at her business for 9 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Anna currently earns about $120 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 USD to purchase foods like rice beans, potatoes,cooking oil and other items for her business. In the future, she plans to increase number and varieties of services in her restaurant . Anna thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase food and other items for her business

loans.name: Hanifan Abdul Majeed Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is a 40 year old married woman and a citizen of Riwind, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband's name is A. M. and he works in a factory. Hanifan baji is the mother of five kids: four sons and one daughter. Her elder son is a rickshaw driver and he drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The next eldest works in a factory. The others go to school located near their house. Hanfian baji successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is applying again for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for her son so that he will be able to run his own business and not have to pay rent as he currently does.  

She is a group leader of women of her town. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis K. is 30, married and has given birth to two children. Both of her sons are in the basic schools. She says she works to make some income to support her husband financially in taking care of the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her husband is a teacher at one of the local schools.

Phyllis trades in jute sacks and all other kinds of sacks. She buys them from Kumasi and Takoradi and sells to market women and traders in the market square. According to her, the market women pack their goods such as cereals, vegetables, etc., in the sacks for easy and convenient transit. She has been in business for 10 years.

Phyllis wants a loan to procure more sacks. She is hoping to expand her business and make more profit to support the family.

loans.use: To buy sacks

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is a dealer and seller of underwear and children’s wear, as well as shirts, blouses, pampers and sanitary pads. She has a passion for what she does because she says it brings her more satisfaction when she sells. Due to the nature of her work she hawks through her surrounding communities to sell her goods.

Ama A. is 32 years old and is married with three children who are in school. She has been selling through hawking for seven years now. She is not interested in renting a store because she says her goods would not sell fast when she is in a store. She is hard working, strong and has a strong passion for what she does.

Her major concern is having enough cash. Therefore Ama is requesting your help to buy more products to increase her inventory. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Otease’ which means ‘He lives’. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy underwear and children's wear, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is a simple person who resides in Barangay South Caronsi Patagueleg Peńablanca, Cagayan with his family. He is married to Corazon, a housewife, and they have two children: Chester Jhon - 1 year old and Cheska Isabel - 1 month. According to Jose, his family is striving to have a better way of living.

Jose wants to borrow a loan amounting to 7,000 Philippine Pesos for his snack vending business. He sells different snacks such as rice cakes and native delicacies in their village. He will use some of the loan for his business and some for the needs of his family. He hopes to maintain and develop his enterprise into a bigger one someday. He also aims to have a permanent vending stall someday, somehow create an opportunity for a better livelihood, and to save something for his family to have a more comfortable house.

loans.use: Business capital and personal use

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is twenty-six years old and married with one daughter who is currently in school. She has owned and operated a dressmaking shop for the past seven years. She sews all forms of women’s wear with various styles that suit the taste of her customers, like kaba and slit (a traditional women’s wear), funeral clothes, etc.

Linda wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Sewing is her major source of income and she hopes to raise good income to provide her daughter with a quality education.

Linda is a member of the community group called “Nyame Be kyere Trust Group". In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access their loans and to repay them.

loans.use: To purchase sewing accessories.

loans.name: Pann

texts.en: The two persons shown in the picture are Mrs. Pann K. and her husband. Pann K. is 34 years old, married, and the mother of five children. All five of them are teenagers and are attending the local secondary school. Pann K. currently sells fresh fish caught by her husband as well as some bought from her wholesale supplier. She earns approximately $5 each day to put toward her family's daily expenses. Pann K. has requested a loan of $700 for her husband to purchase additional fish tools for the approaching fishing season.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish tools

loans.name: Mohmmad Ali

texts.en:
This is Mohmmad Ali the son of K. S. who lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40 years old and he is married and has five children.

Mohmmad Ali owns a shop in which he sells different kinds of clothes. He has experience in this business of more than nine years. He would like to import nicer kinds of cloths from Pakistan which are more saleable in the market. Thus, he has requested a loan of 50,000 Afghani to enlarge his business.

Mohmmad Ali hopes to be the most successful businessman in the future. He would like to thank AFS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mamurjon

texts.en:
H. Mamurjon is 39 years old. He is married with 3 children of school age. Mamurjon has been in the business of selling cows for over 12 years. He buys them from villagers and from the nearby province to raise for reselling to abattoirs and farmers. His wife has been a fruit seller for two years.

Mamurjon is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni to purchase additional cows to raise for resale. This loan will allow him to better provide for his family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Essohouna

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce dans la vente de produits d’alimentation générale, elle exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu’elle appelle « Ets PETIT A PETIT », elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2008 mais elle dispose déjà d’une grande clientèle. Pour bien répondre à leur demande, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour augmenter son stock par l’achat de 4 cartons de lait « NESTLE »,  3 cartons de boîtes de lait « PEACK » en poudre, 4 bidons de 25 litres d’huile « NIOTO » et divers. 
elle est mariée et subvient aux charges de sa famille grâce au revenu de sa famille.
texts.en:
The business of this woman consists in selling food staples in her own shop, called "Ets PETIT A PETIT". She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She started this business in 2008, but she already has a large clientele. To adequately meet demand, she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, to increase her stock and buy 4 boxes of NESTLE milk, 3 boxes of PEACK powdered milk, 4 25-liter cans of NIOTO oil, and various other products. She's married and her income enables her to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 boxes of milk, 3 boxes of powdered milk, and 4 25-liter cans of oil

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Чобиров Хасан Хочиевич родился 1973 году. Он женат и имеет  4 детей. У него собственный аптечный пункт. Они работают с женой. У него в продаже все наиболее используемые медикаменты, лечебные травы, косметические средства, зубные пасты, принадлежности по уходу за ребенком и т.д. Товар Хасан закупает на фирме в г. Душанбе.
С помощью программы КИВА хочет получить займ на сумму 8500 сомони для покупки медикаментов.
texts.en:
Hasan Hochievich J. was born in 1973. He is married with 4 children. Hasan owns a pharmacy stall where he works together with his wife. They sell basic medications, medical herbs, cosmetics, toothpaste, childcare products, etc. Hasan travels to Dushanbe to purchase goods. Now Hasan is applying for a Kiva loan of 8500 somoni for the purchase of medications.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of medications

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is twenty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: one daughter and three sons, who are currently in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Faustina lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana.

Faustina is a trader, running a palm oil production business. She procures the palm fruits from nearby communities and supplies to retailers in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Twelve Apostles Group

texts.en:
Felicia is 33 years old and is married with three kids who are all in school. She lives with her family in a small village in the Western Region of Ghana.

Felicia owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. She is a very skillful and talented hairdresser and has been in business for seven years now. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service. Therefore, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons (hair extensions), pomade, shampoo, activators, etc., to serve her customers.

Felicia is the leader of a trust bank group called “Twelve Apostles”. She is the one seated in the group photograph. Most of the members of these groups are petty traders, food vendors and farmers, etc.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products for her salon

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 03 hijos, vive en el Barrio Laykacota, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 1 año, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de zapatillas.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar zapatillas de todas las tallas para comercializarlos su puesto del mercado de Yunguyo.

Su mayor deseo es comprase otra casa.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y la puntualidad

loans.use: Para la compra de zapatillas.

loans.name: Medy

texts.en: Mrs. Medy S. is from the village of Guinabot in Sapang Dalaga. She is 31 years old, married, and blessed with 2 young children. She joined PMPC last May 8, 2009 to participate in their programs and services. She owns and operates a motorcycle repair shop. She and her husband have been in this business for more than 5 years. She borrowing her second loan of 5,000.00 to use as additional capital of her motorcycle repair shop.

loans.use: Additional capital for her motor repair shop

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
Santa es una mujer muy trabajadora de 42 años, vive con su esposo (Luis), de 52  años, y con su pequeña de Maricielo de 1 año y 7 meses.

Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa (lencería), tiempo que le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para realizar esta actividad de la mejor manera y así lograr buenos ingresos. Pero eso no es todo, también incursionó en la venta de comida, actividad que está empezando a crecer y gracias a su buena sazón tiene cada vez más clientes. 
A Santa le ayuda su cuñada para llevar las porciones de comida hasta los negocios o viviendas que le solicitan, es así que aprovecha de la mejor manera su tiempo, ya que la otra parte debe emplearla en la atención de su hija, la cual está en una edad en la que necesita mucho de las atenciones de su madre. 
Santa se siente tranquila, ya que tiene un trabajo que le da libertad y además le genera buenos ingresos para la mejora de la calidad de vida de su familia, también tiene la esperanza de tener un negocio más estable, como un librería.

Este es su octavo préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de lencería y además invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para cocinar sus ricos platillos.
texts.en:
Santa is a very hard working 42-year-old woman. She lives with her husband, Luis, 52, and her 19-month-old daughter, Maricielo. For the last 4 years, she has sold clothing (lingere), and in that time she has gained the necessary experience to acheive the best results with this business and earn a good salary. But this is not all; she also tried her hand at selling food, a venture that is starting to grow, and, given her good acumen, she keeps gaining customers. Santa is helped by her sister-in-law in taking the orders of food to the business or homes that ask for them. This way, she makes the best use of her time, since the rest of her time must be spent caring for her daughter, who is of the age that needs a lot of attention from her mother. Santa feels at ease with her job that gives her freedom in addition to generating a good income to improve the quality of life for her family. She also has the hope of owning a more stable business, such as a bookstore. This is Santa's eighth loan with MFP, and she has always been very punctual in making payments. The money that she is now asking for will be used to buy better quality lingere and will be invested in buying more ingredients in order to cook her delicious dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock of merchandise and ingredients for food

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna D. is so disappointed about her two elder children’s (22 and 18 years old) achievements in life. They were not able reach college and now they are having the kind of life they were born to have.  Being a mother, she wouldn’t want her children to remain poor for the rest of their lives. However, she can’t blame her children because, as parents, she and her husband should have supported the financial needs of their children, especially in school.  But because both of them have a very small income, it is impossible to support their children.

Despite what happened and the guilt felt, Lorna has been able to gather strength to move on and learn from her past experience. She told herself that it is not yet too late to help her children change their lives.

Now, she is requesting a much larger loan amount through ASHI and Kiva to sustain her tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for hire business managed by her husband and eldest 22 year-old son, and also to grow her hog (pig) fattening business. The proceeds she will earn will enable her two youngest children to continue their studies until college. One is now 13 years old and the other one is 2 two years old.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for a hog fattening business.

loans.name: Lila Margarita

texts.es:
la sra. Lila Margarita A. tiene 29 años de edad, se dedica al comercio, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, es madre soltera, su negocio le genera ingresos para el sustento de su hogar, Lila necesita el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio, ya que las exigencias de sus clientes son grandes y necesita tener su negocio con bastente producto.
con las ganancias que tenga piensa ir remodelando poco a poco su negocio para darles una mejor atencion a sus clientes y hacerlo mas grande para poder tener mas mercaderia en el.
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos. Lila es una persona muy amable y simpatica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lila Margarita A. is 29 years old, a single mother, and makes her living running a store. She has a small grocery located in her home. Her business generates her household income. Lila needs the loan in order to be able increase her business's supplies, since the needs of her customers are great and her business needs to have plenty of products. With her earnings, she is considering remodeling her store, little by little, in order to better serve her customers as well as making the store bigger in order to have more merchandise in it. This is her only source of income. Lila is a very friendly and nice person.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, rice, coffee, beans, bread, sodas, canned goods, cheeses, butter, juices, soups, balls, confections

loans.name: Esmeralda De Jesús

texts.es: Esmeralda de Jesús G. C. de 28 años de edad, reside en Santiago Nonualco en el departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en un taller de automóviles, así también vive junto a sus tres hijos de 10, 8, y 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual posee una tienda de producto varias en su hogar, negocio el cual lo puso con el fin de brindarle ayuda a su esposo, sobre todo en estos momentos tan difíciles económicamente. Esmeralda solícita un préstamo, ya que desea surtir su negocio comprando otros productos como zapatos, más bebidas enlatadas, entre otras cosas más la cuales son de primera necesidad para las personas. Esmeralda anhela poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que desea poder darles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, lo cual es imposible brindárselo únicamente con el trabajo de su esposo.
texts.en:
Esmeralda de Jesús G. C., age 28, resides in Santiago Nonualco in the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who works in an automobile repair shop, and also with their three children, ages 10, 8, and 4. She is a very hardworking woman who has a shop in her home selling assorted goods. She began the business with the aim of offering help to her husband, especially in these times of so many economic difficulties. Esmeralda is applying for a loan because she wishes to stock her business by purchasing other products like shoes, more drinks, and canned goods, among other things that are greatly needed by her customers. Esmeralda is eager to improve her sales because she wants to be able to give her children everything they need, something which is impossible to offer them with only the earnings of her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

location.town: Santiago Nonualco, departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 45 years old. She is married and the mother of six kids. Currently three are in school. Cecilia is very resourceful in providing food and paying the bills for her family. She is a food vendor and sells kenkey and pepper sauce with fried fish. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers, since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Soutoura sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles monogames à Koko, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatorzième  prêt. Les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles font la vente  d’habits  pour enfants, du beurre de Karité etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3douzaines d’habits  pour enfants et 400kg de noix de Karité pour en faire du beurre de Karité. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent au marché de Kadiolo ville, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers  et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Soutoura group is composed of married women. On average, these women are 35 years of age and have 3 children. They live in monogamous households in the Koko district of city of Kadiolo (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women have decided to work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to satisfy the needs of their clientele. This is their 14th group loan. The previous loans were fully repaid. They sell children's clothing, Shea butter, etc. With this new loan, the plan on buying three dozen sets of children clothing and 400 kg of Shea nuts, which will be used to make Shea butter. They get their supplies at the Kadiolo city market and neighboring villages. They sell their products at the Kadiolo city market, by walking through the neighborhood and around home. The sales are done in cash and often on credit to male and female customers. Each woman expects an average monthly revenue of 20 500 CFA franc; one part will be saved to pay for certain family expenses and the remainder will be put back into the business.

Translated from French by Joanne Archambault, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products such as children's clothing and Shea nuts

loans.name: Sarab Ali Group

texts.en:
This is the Sarab Ali group; Qader Ali is the leader of this 4-member group. He is 38 years old, married and the father of 6 children. Qader Ali has a weaving business, and he has been involved in this business for more than five years. He has lots of experience in weaving. With this loan he wants to buy some necessary tools.

The second member of the Sarab Ali group is Razia who wants to take out a loan for her husband. He has a metal-working shop. With this loan he wants to buy more iron to make doors and chairs. The third member is Faizullah who wants to take a loan for his fresh fruit cart; with this loan he wants to complete his stock. The last member of the Sarab Ali group is Zia Gull who makes and sews quilts. With this loan she wants to buy more white cloth and some other necessary things. They all thank Kiva lenders and AFS in Afghanistan.

loans.use: buy necessary implements for weaving

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 29 years old and married, with two young children aged nine months and three years old. He runs a mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, where he has been farming for over five years. His primary income comes from the sale of maize and beans, while he also sells limited amounts of cereals on the side. In recent years, Wycliffe has also earned supplementary income by providing transport services on his motorbike. He says that the main challenge he currently faces in all his businesses is the great fluctuations in prices for his goods.

Wycliffe is requesting this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 20,000 to start his own poultry project. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him provide for his family's basic needs, now and in the future. In the coming years, Wycliffe wants to open a small milling farm, and he hopes that enough stability prevails in the region with market prices and the economy in general so he can accomplish his goals.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: La Esmeralda Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esmeralda II está integrada por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la  joven Verónica G. M. quien comenzó con la venta de productos Avon, ya que como  su madre ha comercializado este producto conocía  el sistema de venta. Luego con los préstamos empezó a comercializar ropa y prendas de oro y plata en los cual piensa invertir el crédito en la adquisición de mercadería en ambos productos. 

La señora Lidia Aurora M. Sánchez es vendedora de la Lotería Nacional ella comprara con el crédito los billetes de lotería para seguir ofertándolos en las calles de Managua. Mientras Raquel M. realiza y vende raspados (postre que consiste en hielo granizado con miel), reposterías y comidas rápidas. M. invertirá el préstamo en ingredientes para realizar dichos productos.
texts.en:
The Esmeralda II group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Verónica G. M. who started out selling Avon products. She learned this trade from her mother who also sells Avon products and knows the system. Later, with the help of loans, she started to sell clothes, gold and silver jewelry. She plans on using her loan to invest in inventory for both of her businesses. Sra. Lidia Aurora M. Sánchez sells lottery tickets. She plans on using her loan to buy more lottery tickets to sell on the streets of Managua. Raquel M. makes and sells snow cones, bakery items, and fast food. M. will use this loan to purchase ingredients for the food items he makes.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Veronica Elizabeth  from  Nicaragua

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Balamna

texts.en: Balamna H. is 39 years old. Her husband is in the navy and they have two children. Mrs. H. works from home selling beans and corn. She has been running this business since 1998 and has recently requested her second loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase 10 sacks of corn and 12 sacks of beans. With this loan, Mrs. H. will be able to contribute towards her family’s expenses while simultaneously fostering growth in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more kerosene

loans.name: Sub

texts.en: Mr. Sub S. is 51 years old and a villager in Trapeang Leuk village, Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Ngaet S., are farmers who own a two-hectare field where they cultivate rice for a living. In this farming business, they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support the field. Therefore, Mr. Sub S. has decided to ask for a loan to purchase rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for a farming laborer. The couple has a child who is a farmer and fisherman.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay a farming laborer

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo,de 37 años, está casado con Lila (38), con quien tiene dos inquietos hijos, y juntos  viven en su casa  que es propia.Los fines de semana se dedica a la agricultura, mientras que de lunes a viernes es chofer  de camiones de carga  pesada  en una empresa minera. La buena producción de sus cultivos de habas, maíz, papas y alverjas en sus terrenos propios, se deben gracias a las atenciones constantes de su esposa, que desde hace 20 años no ha dejado de sembrar estos  productos sin dejar de lado sus quehaceres domésticos. Lo que más le gusta a Hugo  es cosechar las habas bien maduras las cuales sancocha con sal y degusta como un verdadero manjar. Su oficio de agricultor le resulta rentable porque le alcanza para  solventar los gastos de manutención de su familia , por eso dentro de sus planes para más adelante  desea  comprar más tierras agrícolas donde pueda  sembrar en busca de mayor productividad . Con las ganancias de su futura producción desea  instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles en su casa.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y ante los integrantes de su banco comunal, quienes lo aceptaron dentro del grupo, se comprometió a ser puntual en los pagos para no defraudar la confianza que depositan en él.Hugo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  semilla de alverja para aprovechar esta campaña de siembra y con el monto restante comprará materiales para terminar de construir una parte de su casa.
texts.en:
37-year old Hugo is married to 38-year old Lila. They have two lively children, and they all live together in a house which they own. At the weekends Hugo works in his fields, while from Monday to Friday he drives a heavy-duty truck for a mining company. Thanks to his wife’s hard work, his fields produce a good crop of beans, corn, potatoes and peas. For the last twenty years she has tended these crops and at the same time has never neglected her household duties. Hugo’s greatest pleasure is picking the ripe beans which he then parboils with salt and enjoys them as if they were a true delicacy. His work as a farmer is profitable and he can cover the household costs with the money he earns. In the future he would like to buy more land and increase production. With the profit he would run a grocery store out of his home. This is Hugo’s first loan with Kiva partner MFP. The members of his community bank have accepted him into their group. He promises to pay back the loan punctually so he doesn’t let them down. Hugo has plans to use the money to buy peas to plant in the appropriate season; he will use any remaining money to buy materials to complete the construction of part of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy peas

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida a nivel regional por sus festividades turístico – religiosas y también por sus artesanías en madera, cerámica y junco, se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de veinte años a trabajar en labores agrícolas, especialmente las ligadas a la ganadería: cuenta con trece vacas de las cuales seis producen leche diariamente, su establo se encuentra a media hora de camino de su vivienda,  todos los dias se dirige muy temprado por la mañana a ordeñar a sus vacas, la leche que estas producen es vendida a un acopiador de la zona. 

Como esta actividad es su única fuente de ingreso económico, Pablo siempre brinda a sus vacas una buena alimentación y cuidado, precisamente, ahora desea adquirir alimento balanceado y pastos naturales para mejorar la producción lechera de su ganado, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternatva un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Pablo es un padre de failia que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza y que siempre se ha valido de ella para salir adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Pablo is 49 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their three children in the Monsefú district. This area is known on a regional level for its tourist and religious festivals. It is also known for its wood, ceramic, and reed handicrafts. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over 20 years he has done agricultural work, especially that having to do with livestock. He has 13 cows, and 6 of them produce milk daily. His stable is a half hour from his house. He goes there very early everyday to milk the cows. He sells the milk to a wholesaler in the area. As this activity is his only source of income, Pablo always feeds his livestock well and takes good care of them. He now wants to get balanced nutritional feed and natural grass to improve the milk production of his cows. That is why he has requested a loan for 1,000 PEN from Edypme Alternativa. Pablo is a family man who really likes the work he does. He has always counted on it to get ahead. He has worked with our institution before, and he has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when it is time to make his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced nutritional feed and natural grass to improve the milk production of his cows

loans.name: Samorn

texts.en:
Samorn S., 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children. They live in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. is a farmer and earns an income of $2 USD per day. Her husband is a tuk-tuk driver and earns an income of $4 USD per day to help cover family expenses.

Samorn is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Samorm appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy cows to help the rice field

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer G. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old, is single, and has three school-aged children. Jennifer owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Jennifer joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a 46 year-old woman who owns a clothing boutique and beauty shop.  She sells men’s, women’s, and baby clothing, along with bags, perfumes, and cosmetic products at her shop.  Before running her shop, Maimuna worked in a beauty salon.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  Her biggest business challenge is financial constraints due to lack of capital.  She is single and has one daughter who is 20 years old.
 
Maimuna plans to use the 20,000 Kenya Shilling loan to buy additional clothes, bags, perfumes, and cosmetic products for resale to her customers.

In the future, she hopes to make her shop into a wholesale distributor of the kinds of products she sells, and she dreams of one day building her own home.

Maimuna describes herself as hardworking, honest, and tolerant.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes, bags, perfumes, and cosmetic products

loans.name: Magua En Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Ivelisse is the coordinator of her group 'Magua en Desarrollo' 2 & 3, 'Magua in Development' (Magua is the name of her community). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner. She says that her most difficult challenge was to start with her business; at first, she didn't have the economic opportunity to do it.  In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at home, relaxing.

Ivelisse is excited to be taking out her 8th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 4 years,  and she started it with her first loan in Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying clothing like pants (specially jeans), shirts, and some shoes. She will use the profit to invest in more clothes and to add more products, also she needs to buy various things for her home.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to have a business and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is dominated by agriculture. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable  electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy clothing (jeans, pants, shirts, and others) for resale

loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en:
Gorreti wants a loan to buy more tapes to sell and passion fruits for making juice for her business. She is a 39-year-old lady who is married with six children and lives in the small township of Kyenjojo, Uganda.

Gorreti dreams of starting a wholesale shop which sells every domestic item and she says she can achieve this feat through hard work and commitment.

loans.use: To buy more tapes to sell and passion fruits for making juice to sell

loans.name: Twekembe Kikooza Group – Mukono

texts.en: N. Joyce, 46 years old, belongs to Twekembe Kikooza group in Mukono. She is a courteous, good-natured, approachable married woman with six kids. To make ends meet, she has been selling charcoal for the last six years in Kikooza-Mukono. She makes profits that add up to 50,000 shillings in a week. She has had to deal with a number of setbacks including the lack of finances to buy more bags of charcoal. She is hoping that with this loan she will have a favorable turn in her financial circumstances and will have money to buy bags of charcoal more often. She says her business will bask in the glow of more success if she buys more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
La Sra. Diana Vive en la ciudad  la Paz, en la zona de alto San Pedro, la casa donde vive es familiar herencia de los suegros, la cliente es casada con el señor Frid. Doña diana se dedica a la venta de comida en el mismo domicilio lleva 1 año con esta actividad además de realizar la venta a crédito de una variedad de productos según pedido. El crédito será destinado para la compra de edredones y artefactos electrónicos mismos que serán distribuidos en el departamento de santa cruz, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta  muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.

En la foto la Sra. Diana Aparece acompañada de su Mama.
texts.en:
Diana lives in the city of la Paz, high up in the area of San Pedro. The house where she lives is the family home of her in-laws, the client is married to Frid. Diana has been selling food at the same address for 1 year, and in addition she sells a variety of products on credit according to order. The loan will be used to buy duvets and electronic devices which will be distributed in the Santa Cruz department. She is a very hard working person and is very grateful to the institution for the support provided. In the photo Diana is accompanied by her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE DUVETS AND ELECTRONIC DEVICES

loans.name: La Buena Nueva 1, 2 &3 Group

texts.es:
Walquiris es una de los miembro del Grupo La Buena nueva 1, 2 y 3, localizado en os Alcarrizos, una creciente comunidad situada a las afueras provincia de Santo Domingo, hacia el norte de la ciudad, es una zona industrial y con una gran poblacion. Sus actividades principales son las ventas de ropa, zapatos, cosmeticos y panaderia, etc. Walquiris es una joven empresaria, que vive junto a su esposo y un hijo. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil es terminar su carrera universitaria y su actividad favorita es estudiar.

Walquiris está muy emocionada de recibir su noveno préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y en cada uno haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 4 años, el cual inició por su iniciativa de generar ingresos y ser util. Está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de una maquina para amasar harina, o procesadora, ella elabora panes y biscochos, y se dedica al comercio de panaderia. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para comprar una nevera. Su sueño es poder convertirse en una educadora, por esa razon desea terminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Walquiris is one of the members of the Grupo La Buena Nueva 1, 2, y 3 (The Good New Group 1, 2, and 3), located in Los Alcarrizos, a growing community on the outskirts of the Santo Domingo province, north of the city. It's an industrial area with a large population. The group's main activities are selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and bread, etc. Walquiris is a young businesswoman who lives with her husband and son. She tells us that her greatest challenge is finishing college and her favorite activitiy is studying.

Walquiris is very excited to receive her ninth loan with Kiva partner Esperanza Internacional, after having satisfactorily paid off her earlier loans, and with each one made a step toward growing her business. She has had her business for about four years, which she started because of her intitiative to make money and be useful. Plans are to use her new loan to purchase a flower mixer or processer. She makes breads and sponge cakes, and she is a baker. She plans to use her earnings to purchase a refrigerator. Her dream is to become an educator, which is why she wants to finish college.

loans.use: Purchase a flour mixer

loans.name: Maretou

texts.fr: Madame Maretou N. est une femme de 57 ans qui habite à Bambilor. C’est seulement depuis un an qu’elle a commencé à gérer  une boutique dans laquelle elle pratique la vente de marchandises diverses. Auparavant elle s’adonnait à la vente de tissus. Mais puisqu’elle prend de l’âge  elle a  opte pour la gestion de la boutique qui demande moins de déplacement. Elle  est membre  de la caisse de Bambilor depuis juillet 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs qui sera prévu pour l’achat de marchandises diverses en vue de renforcer son stock. Selon madame N. ce crédit lui permettra d’accroitre ses revenus, de mieux soutenir sa famille face aux charges de dépense quotidienne, mais aussi d’augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
Ms. Maretou N. is a 57-year-old woman who lives in Bambilor.  Just a year ago, she began operating a shop in which she sells various goods.  In the past, she dedicated all her time to selling cloth.  But since she is not getting any younger, she has opted for managing a shop which demands less travel.  

She has been a member of the Bambilor branch since July 2010.  She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs, which will be used for buying various goods.  The aim is to bolster her stock of merchandise.  

According to Ms. N., this loan will enable her to increase her revenues, to support her family better in face of day-to-day expenses, and also to increase her savings.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Suon Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon S. is a 40-year-old, married woman and she has been selected as the village bank president by its 15 members. They live in Damrei Chlang village, Kandal province. Each members of the group will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Suon S. is a laborer in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Mann Mao, 52, works as a construction worker. With their both occupations, they are not able to earn enough income to support their family. 

In their family, they have an old motorbike for going to work everyday but the motorbike is now getting old so they need to pay extra money on petroleum. In order to reduce her expenses, Mrs. Suon S. would like to ask for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for going to work. This couple has seven children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one works in a bakery, and three are attending the local school, while the others are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 70 años de edad, soltera  y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de animales como son cuyes, gallinas y luego lo distribuye a la selva, la socia es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando.  

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más animales (cuyes, gallinas) y así poder vender más a sus clientes.
 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Sumac Puririsun communal bank.  The bank is located in Cusco District, which belongs to Cusco Province and Department.

The member's name is Dominga.  She is a 70-year-old single woman with six children.  Dominga balances household duties with her business buying animals like guinea pigs and hens to sell to people in rural areas.  She is very enterprising and has a great desire to keep working.

She is asking for the loan to buy more animals (guinea pigs and hens) so she can sell more to her customers.
 
Dominga is grateful to all those who are helping to make her dream come true, and she promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Buy more animals (guinea pigs, hens) to sell to her customers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has a business selling clothes. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Alice faces a major challenge of seasonality. During festive season, there is high demand for clothing, while during the months of January to July, few customers purchase clothes. She hopes to expand and establish a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn C. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old and married, with 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn plants and harvests  a variety of vegetables for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Evelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Jenedina

texts.en:
Jenedina P. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has two children aged seven and nine. To make a living, Jenedina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn to sell. Jenedina also raises pigs for breeding. 

Jenedina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenedina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jenedina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers like manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex N. is from the village of Mother Ignacia Village, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 23 years old. Alex is single. To make a living, Alex owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods and toothpaste in the local community. Alex has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Alex joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alex is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alex from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods

location.town: Mother Ignacia Village, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Or

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman who lives in Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: hog raising, running a general store, and managing a sugarcane plantation. Her husband Francisco, who is 52 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps with his wife’s business activities. They have four children who are between 24 to 32 years old. All of them have family of their own.  

Josephine joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Josephine has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 21,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP and uplifted the family’s standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP to buy feed and fertilizer to continue to save for the future expansion of her hog raising business. Josephine is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund business operations

loans.name: Kerto Sato Group

texts.en:
For housewives in Bali, it has become commonplace to have a pig farm at home to help with the family income rather than counting on the husband's income alone. The problem is, most housewives do not know the correct way of raising pigs. To improve their capability, they joined in a group. In addition to exchanging information, they also get funds. 

Ni Ketut S., 40 years old and a housewife, became chairman of the group Kerto Sato to enhance their capabilities in terms of raising pigs and raising capital for their businesses. Her share of the loan will be used to buy three pigs and the rest to buy feed. In a period of 5 months, pigs are ready for sale. The advantage gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the family economy.

loans.use: buy three pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 39 years old.  She is married and has 3 children between the ages of 10 and 15.  She also cares for 5 dependents, who are her relatives.  

Marie Chantal has a spacious shop selling charcoal, which she has been running for 1 year.   Currently she has 2 employees and her shop is open 7 days a week.

Marie Chantal plans to use her loan to buy more charcoal to sell.  Any profits will be used to buy clothing for the children.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Virgintina

texts.en:
Virgintina is a married woman who lives in  Cebu. She earns her living by selling fish and operating a local eatery. Her husband Gregorio, who is 63 years old, works as a municipal collector to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 30 and 42 years old. 

Virgintina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Virgintina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to purchase fish to sell so that she can continue to save up for her grandchildren's education. Virgintina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Omar

texts.ar: عمر متزوج وله ولدان عمره 30 سنة يعمل معلم عمار بناء وتعهدات له في عمله 20 سنة يعمل بشكل جيد ومبتكر يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يدعم عائلته ماديا واجتماعيا له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة + شراء عجول ومواشي لدعم عمله وزيادة مدخوله حيث انه يواجه صعوبة مادية في تطوير نفسه
texts.en: Omer is married and has two children. He is 30 years old and works as a head contractor in construction. He has 20 years of experience in his field, and he does his work well and in innovative ways. He would like to increase his income in order to support his family in terms of their materiA. needs and their status in society. He has a good history with A.-Majmoua, and he received the full support of his family during his last loan. With a loan from A.-Majmoua, he wishes to buy new construction equipment, as well as calves and other livestock. By doing this, he should be able to increase his income and overcome the materiA. difficulties he faces in improving himself.

loans.use: to buy new construction equipment.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is 26 years old, married to Aloyce and has four children who are all in school. The family lives in Rongo. Beatrice has a retail shop that she has been running for the past four years.

Beatrice was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a client. She is applying for her fourth loan to enable her buy more sugar, tea leaves, detergents, etc. to add to her stock. Beatrice has a good credit history with KADET through the years as she has paid off her loans well.

Beatrice hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves, detergents, sugar etc. to add to her stock

loans.name: Winena

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of nine children, Winena works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from frozen foods.  Winena is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell for her business.

Winena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín de 54 años es soltero, vive en su casa propia solo que cuenta con los servicios de agua yluz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande y a unos 40 minutos de distancia del departamento de Piura.  Este lugar se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Martín se dedica a la venta de periódicos desde hace 10 años, recorriendo todo el distrito a pie ofreciendo su producto,cuenta también con su propia clientela donde solo se dedica a dejar su prodcuto.  Esto le permite tener ingresos diarios ,en algunas casas que deja el periódico todos los días cobra semanal, sus ingresos los utiliza exclusivamente para cubrir sus necesidades diarias.

A solicitado Martín un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar una  bicicleta que le ayudará para que el reparto diario de su producto sea más fácil y en menor tiempo.  Martín con esfuerzo y mucho trabajo trata de salir adelante y que su negocio cresca cada vez más para pagar el crédito brindado y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martín is 54 years old and single. He lives alone in his own house which receives services such as running water and electricity. Martín resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is approximately 40 minutes away from the Department of Piura. This place is known for agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Martín has been selling newspapers for 10 years. He travels through the district on foot so that he can sell his product. Martín has his own customer base and works alone when he distributes his merchandise. He is able to generate a daily income, but in a few instances he delivers newspapers every day and then collects payment on a weekly basis. His income is used exclusively to cover his daily needs.

Martín is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN to purchase a bicycle to help him with his daily distribution of newspapers. This will make his work easier and enable him to finish in less time. With effort, Martín works hard to succeed and grow his business so that he can repay his loan and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a bicycle for distributing newspapers.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Luz es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Forjadoras, del Distrito de Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 34 años de edad y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo se desempeña como chofer (transportista).

Pertenece desde hace poco tiempo a la familia de Manuela Ramos, pero lo está aprovechando, gracias a los préstamos recibidos ha podido comprar los implemento necesarios para poder trabajar sus manualidades.  Ella recibe la ayuda de sus 2 pequeñas hijas.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 1 kilo de mullos, 3 rollitos de nylon, ½ ciento de seguros, 3 encendedores, 3 revistas de manualidades.

Luz está bastante contenta porque también está enseñando a sus hijas como se obtiene el dinero y espera seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Forjadoras” (Forging Women) which is in the District of Yarinacocha, Department of Ucayali. She is 34 years old and has three children. Her husband works as a driver in the transportation sector.

Luz recently joined the Manuela Ramos family in order to take advantage of the benefits. Thanks to the loans she has received, she was able to buy the necessary supplies for her handicraft business. Her two young daughters help her with the work.

Her new loan of 1500 PEN will be used to buy one kilo of beads, three rolls of nylon, fifty fasteners, three lighters, and three craft magazines.

Luz is pleased because she is able to teach her daughters how to earn an income. She hopes to continue working with Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her craft business.

loans.name: Annebeth

texts.en:
Annebeth is 39 years old and married. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of different goods, especially daily basic commodities. Annebeth has had this business for 20 years.

Annebeth is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional products such as soft drinks, sugar, milk, canned goods and noodles to sell. Each month, Annebeth earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.

In the future, Annebeth hopes to maintain her business so that she can send her children to a higher level of education. She prays that she will receive the loan amount she requested to sustain the needs of her family and to improve her retail store.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as soft drinks, sugar, milk, canned goods and noodles to sell

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo spent his entire life being a farmer. Now, he is 57 years old and married. His wife is also a farmer. He has doing this business for 30 years now.

Aside from rice, he also raises swine to supplement their family income. He earns about 26,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) per harvest.

Ricardo needs a loan to support his livelihood. The loan will help him buy seeds, fertilizers and pig feed.

In the future, Ricardo hopes to have an improved living situation.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
