Rosalyn is married and a mother of two school-age dependents. She is 41 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Rosalyn has a food vending business at home. She prepares and sells food products at the schools and some public places. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She earns PHP 3,000 each month in this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase food ingredients for food preparation.

Rosalyn has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to expand her business and gain more profit.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients.

loans.name: Potolu Group

texts.en:
Aminata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs.  Aminata, 35, was born in Kenema. She is married to a trader and they have two children. One of her children is in secondary school and one is in college. Aminata sells cassava leaves and has been a businesswoman for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Aminata and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Aminata will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy a large quantity of cassava leaves to sell. She also plans to buy gallons of palm oil to add a different product to her business.

loans.use: to buy cassava leaves and gallons of palm oil to add to her business

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr:
Komlan est un homme âgé de 30 ans. Il est marié å une coiffeuse. Il a 01 enfant. 
Komlan travaille comme revendeur de produits alimentaires 2008. Il vend à toutes personnes à AVEPOZO Il achète les produits au Grand Marché de Lomé. Il travaille seul.
Komlan a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter 04 cartons de lait peak, 10 cartons de tomate 02 sacs de  détergent génie.
texts.en: Komlan is a 30-year-old man. He is married to a hairdresser and has one child. He has been working as a retailer of grocery items since 2008 and sells to anyone in AVEPOZO. He purchases his goods at the Grand Market of Lomé. He works by himself. Komlan has requested his first loan cycle at WAGES in order to buy 4 boxes of Peak milk, 10 boxes of tomatoes, and 2 bags of Genie detergent.

loans.use: to buy grocery items

loans.name: Rosline

texts.en:
Rosline is 43 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Arua region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. All of her children are currently in school. Rosline has a business selling clothes, which she has had for eight years.         

To help expand her business, Rosline has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rosline hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Rosline hopes to expand her business. Rosline is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Wilder Antonio

texts.es:
Don Wilder es comerciante, hoy en dia tiene su propio negocio, una pulperia y juegos de nintendo, en donde es el medio para mantener a su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, tiene cinco años ya, trabajando de esta forma, solo comenzo con la pulperia y ahora con las ganancias y financiamiento en Afodenic, se ha desarrollado mas.
Es a traves del prestamo que comienza ah introducir mas productos, aumentan la ventas, asi como los juegos de nintendo, cubriendo mas los gastos de la familia y cumpliendo con los compromisos de pago. Estando contento  por que ha logrado el equilibrio.
Con este nuevo prestamo sera para introducir mas granos basicos, golosinas, carne, pollo, gaseosas, productos lacteos, caja de jabon, axe, cloro, entre otros productos que son demandado.
texts.en:
Wilder is a merchant. Today his has his own business, a small corner store and Nintendo games, which are his main way of supporting his family. He has a wife and two children. He has been in this business for 5 years, starting first with just the corner store. Now with the earnings and loans from Afodenic he has been able to add more. 

Because of the loans he has begun to introduce more products and increase sales, like with the Nintendo games. This will cover more of his family's costs and allow him to make his payments. He is happy because he has reached this balance. 

The new loan will be used to buy more grains, snacks, meat, chicken, sodas, dairy products, soap, detergent, bleach and other products that are in high demand.

loans.use: to buy grains, snacks, meat, chicken, sodas and other things to increase sales.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo nació en la provincia del Cusco y tiene 33 años de edad, él tiene una relación de libre unión de la cual tiene dos hijos.  

Actualmente, Hugo vive en la misma provincia donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, él es ingeniero geólogo y trabaja en la Región Inca en el área de ordenamiento territorial. En esta oportunidad Hugo requiere el préstamo para uso personal, él desea comprarse un artefacto eléctrico ósea una refrigeradora.

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Hugo was born in Cusco Province. He is 33 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children.

Hugo currently lives in the same province where he was born and this is also where he conducts his business activities. He is a geological engineer and works in the Inca Region in the area of land demarcation. Hugo is taking this opportunity to request a loan for personal use. He wants to buy a refrigerator.

The Communal Bank “Comuzone I” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco, Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Esterlita Group

texts.en:
Esterlita is married with three children. Esterlita is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Esterlita is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 18 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizer for her corn. 

Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her house.

Esterlita is the leader of a three-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her corn

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr:
Ayaba est une femme de 31ans. Elle est épouse d’un tapissier. Elle a  03 enfants. 
Ayaba travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation générale  dans le quartier de Doumassesse. Elle achète ses marchandises à Lomé. 
Ayaba a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des cartons de sucres en paquets, des boites de laits concentré et en poudre, des sardines en boites et des tomates fraîches.
Dans les prochaines années, Ayaba voudrait améliorer la gestion de son commerce pour doubler ses bénéfices. Avec ce profit, elle prévoit de s’acheter un terrain pour construire.
texts.en:
Ayaba is a 31-year-old woman who is married to an upholsterer. She has three children. 

Ayaba became a reseller in 2007. She sells general food products in the district of Doumassesse. She buys her stock in Lomé.

Ayaba is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy boxes of sugar packets, cans of condensed, some powdered milk, canned sardines, and fresh tomatoes.

In the coming years, Ayaba would like improve her business management skills to double her profits, which she will use to buy some land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale

loans.name: New Life Group

texts.en:
Sibongile has been in the transport business for two years. She provides hiring and commuting services in Shurugwi. She also imports shoes and clothes for sale. Her challenges are tough competition, lack of funds to buy spares, and stiff border controls. 

Sibongile is 36 years old and lives in Shurugwi. She is married and has two children, ages 18 and 11. One is attending school.
 
Sibongile is requesting $400 US to buy spare parts and tires. With more income, Sibongile will be in a position to complete her house [currently] under construction. In the future, she plans to have a fleet of 10 mini buses and a shop in Shurugwi.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her mini buses.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine, who has operated her cereal shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last five years, also practices dairy farming in the area. She is 49 years old, married and has two school-going children.

Introduced to KADET LTD by other clients, this will be Catherine's first loan with which she will buy more cereal stock to sell in her shop. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and earn more income as well as improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more cereal stock.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated (not married) with 4 children.

To earn a living, Estrella has a food shop (or carenderia) that sells Filipino food dishes like pancit bihon, afritada, and caldereta. She has had this business for 5 years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy additional raw ingredients for making her delicacies.

Estrella is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Estrella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients for her food items

loans.name: Diep

texts.en:
Diep is a 55-year-old married woman. Her husband works as a driver. They have two sons. Diep lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Diep earns an income by renting out rooms in her house. She would like a loan to upgrade the rooms to better accommodate her tenants. Diep hopes that this will help her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to upgrade the rooms she rents out.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de invierno, como son chamarras, sudaderas y pantalones nuevos. Para vender a crédito, en la fábrica en donde trabaja ya que sus compañeras le están solicitando este tipo de mercancía, ya que ellas mismas son quienes el compran los productos que vende por catalogo, como son zapatos, artículos de cocina. 
Doña Juliana es separado y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad, a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor. Es por eso que desea invertir en su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias.  Ya que con su sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en la maquiladora solo cubre los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Señora Juliana is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing like jackets, sweatshirts, and new pants.  She is going to sell on credit in the factory where she works since her co-workers are requesting this type of merchandise from her.  They are the ones who buy the products that she sells by catalog like shoes and kitchen items.

Doña Juliana is separated and cares for her two children, to whom she wants to give the best.  This is why she hopes to invest in her business to increase her profits.  The wages she receives from her job at the assembly plant only cover some of her home's expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to start her clothing sales.

loans.name: Donisa

texts.en:
Donisa is 29 years old and lives Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City.  She is married with one child. 

Donisa has a used clothing business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase bundles of used clothing to sell.

Donisa has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Oilda, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 14 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 1° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La señora Oilda se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de comidas. Comenta que le va muy bien, ya que tiene muchos clientes que compran de ella sus comidas. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un gran local de comidas donde poder vender.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, hortalizas, condimentos y demás insumos para los alimentos que prepara. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que les da.
texts.en:
Mujeres Emprendedoras is the name of the excellent group of women made up in the city of Villa Elisa thanks to Oilda, the current general director, who contacted the advisor at one of her weekly meetings to find out about the type of work the Mujeres Emprendedoras committee has.  Once advised about the program, Oilda managed to bring together 14 women who now are working in their first cycle very happily and in a unified and supportive way within the program.

Oilda characterizes herself as a very hard-working and enterprising woman who works selling all types of food.  She says that it is going very well for her because she has lots of customers who buy her food from her.  One of her dreams is to be able to have a big place for food where she can sell.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients for the food she prepares.  She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Bashayer

texts.en: Bashayer, 42 years old, is a housewife. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Bashayer started a small home business three years ago making sweets, especially chocolate sweets, to sell. Because she loves what she does, she was able to make her small business a success and expand it to make new types of chocolate desserts. By word of mouth, she gained a good number of customers. Now, Bashayer wants to continue on the same track growing step by step. She has applied for a loan to buy special equipment and tools to make the process of making those desserts easier and faster.

loans.use: To buy a special machine to make chocolate

loans.name: Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le  même village. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Somakpo (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 42 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Somakpo est mariée à un certain Zacharie. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Somakpo vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Somakpo vend des plastiques, des condiments et des biscuits depuis cinq ans environ ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Somakpo s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Somakpo ensemble avec les membres du groupe NONVIGNON sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des plastiques, des condiments et des biscuits.

loans.name: Berne

texts.en:
Born in 1975 at Tsévié, Mr Berne J. is issued from poor family. Very early, he has abandoned the courses at form 4 to be launched in the small trade as his parents don’t has enough means to take car of his school fees. From activities to activities, he was finally found in the selling of general food produces. He is married and is a father of two (02) children. He good morality and dynamism have made him a respected person in the area. He controls very well his trade and has well repaid his two credits got without incident. Currently, he requests a credit of $850 which will serve to buy rice, oil, and other general food produces in view to strengthen his activity. This will allow him to growth her incomes and improve his family living conditions.

Né en 1975 à Tsévié, Monsieur J. Berne est issu d’une famille pauvre. Très tôt, il a abandonné les études en classe de 4ème pour se lancer dans le petit commerce car ses parents n’ont pas assez de moyens pour lui assurer sa scolarité. D’activités en activités, il s’est finalement retrouvé dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Il est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Sa bonne moralité et son dynamisme ont fait de lui une personne respectée dans le quartier. Il a une maîtrise parfaite de son commerce et a bien remboursé ses deux crédits obtenus sans incident. Il sollicite aujourd’hui, un crédit de $ 850 qui servira à acheter du riz, d’huile et autres produits d’alimentation générale en vue de renforcer son activité. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et de facto améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy general food produces

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Kraban Support Foundation has trained Dora and others in the TEACH Lending program. She has also been trained in record-keeping. Dora needs a loan of $900 to expand her business by buying tools to establish a tie-and-dye section so as to sell at a cheaper cost.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Diem

texts.en: Miss Diem has two children between 13 and 5. She is supporting her children who are going to school by herself. Miss Diem has only 1000 square meters of growing rice land and she also raises a female pig. Besides, she buys waste materials from door to door and then sells it to the local recycling company. However, she does not have enough capital to buy much waste material so that she can earn more. Now, Miss Diem wants to borrow a loan of $50 for her selling waste material and raising pig business

loans.use: selling waste material and raising pig

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo is single. His mother is elderly. He started his business as a way to look after himself and his mother. He began by selling shoes, and he realized how much he liked the business. Little by little the business grew until he had an extensive clientele. Later he decided to take a course in handicrafts where he learned flower arrangement and decoration for special events. With these new skills, Leonardo began to sell handicrafts that he makes himself, and these have helped his business grow.

He is asking for a loan of $750 to buy supplies used in his arts and crafts and expects to repay the loan in six months. He appreciates your belief in him and your support in improving and expanding his business.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Leonardo es soltero, su madre es una persona mayor, el inicio su negocio por que tenia que ver por el sustento de él y de su mamá, inició vendiendo zapatos y se dio cuenta del gusto que tiene hacia este oficio y poco a poco fue teniendo más clientes, así hizo una extensa cartera de clientes. Después decidió a tomar un curso de manualidades y aprendió a elaborar arreglos florales y decoración de eventos especiales, sabiendo el negocio de las ventas y con su nuevo conocimiento, Leonardo empezó a ofrecer productos decorativos que él mismo elabora con lo que ha hecho crecer con su negocio.

Él esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 750 para comprar insumos que necesita en la elaboración de las manualidades y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, él les agradece mucho tu confianza y apoyo para mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy arts and crafts supplies

loans.name: Poto

texts.en: Poto is a 29 year old mother of two children from Maagiagi. She set up a flea market business selling a variety of goods, such as shoes, hair gel, t-shirts, etc. With her first loan of $300 she has been able to open her flea market six days a week, and earn a profit of $60 less all expenses weekly.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Mr. Felix R. León is 46 years old, and is married to Brasiliana López, 45. Unfortunately, his wife has moved to Spain for better work opportunities. She sends money back to Felix from there. They have three children: the oldest is 22 and lives with Brasiliana in Spain. The other two children are a 15-year-old girl and a 13-year-old boy, both of whom live in Paraguay.

Felix and his two children live in their own house and run a small grocery. He has had this business for the past 17 years. Felix also has a taxi, however, right now he does not use his taxi because he does not want to leave his children alone in the house all day. With the loan he has requested Felix plans to buy a new cooler so that he can have cold drinks for his customers during the upcoming summer months.

loans.use: To buy a new cooler

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
Purchase more merchandise for her children. 

Comprar mas mercaderia para sus clientes

loans.name: Hosamoh

texts.en: Hosamoh has been engaged in the candy trade for over 10 years. She has her own shop, which is located in Sahovat bazaar in Dushanbe,Tajikistan. She has raised one child by herself. Her business is the only income of her family, and she wishes that in future she could create better conditions for her child. As a businesswomen she is very accurate and is a responsible person. She also is very polite with clients, and many of them become her constant clients. During her work activities, she has learned more information about client needs, and she tries quickly to meet their needs. From KIVA she wants to recieve a loan for future expansion. She wants to purchase several new kinds of candies to sell.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Erum

texts.en: Erum is 41 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a small food stuffs store, where she sells a variety of fried snacks and other goods. She earns a total of $20 a day, and her husband works as a public transportation driver. Together, they only earn a small income. Erum is applying for a loan of $125 to increase the inventory of her store, to provide for her children’s education and future. She plans to repay the loan in a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her stall

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is an active, hard-working woman who teaches at a preschool in the mornings and in the afternoons can be found making the rounds throughout her city’s streets selling beauty products. This second job has allowed her to improve the income of her beloved family.

Maribel has decided to set up her business permanently in her house. To do this she will need a glass showcase to display the beauty products. Your important contribution will help fulfill this goal.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maribel es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, por las mañanas se desempeña como maestra en un centro inicial de su ciudad y por las tardes recorre sus calles ofertando sus productos de belleza, la ayuda económica que obtiene de esta labor han servido para elevar el nivel de vida de su amada familia, con el propósito de ofertar sus productos en su domicilio de manera permanente ha decidido adquirir una vitrina para exponerlos, vuestra importante colaboración permitirá la realización de este deseo.

loans.use: To buy a glass showcase for her cosmetic products

loans.name: Sayaad Dawood

texts.en: Sayaad Dawood lives in District 5 of Kabul Afghanistan, where he is married and the father of five children. With a degree in agriculture, he works very hard in the field, his family’s only source of income. He is requesting a loan in order to expand his business by increasing his inventory. This, in turn, will allow him to better support his family.

loans.use: To expand his agricultural stock

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Weaving has always been the principle occupation of Rebeca’s parents, and Rebeca herself is not a stranger to this beautiful work. With great patience, diligence and enthusiasm she goes about producing each one of her beautiful garments, which are then sent in large numbers to the city of Lima, Peru to be sold. Thanks to beautiful designs and finishing touches, Rebeca’s pretty garments are very sought after in the market, and for that reason Rebeca is thinking of purchasing another weaving machine and contracting employees in order to increase the volume of her production. With your help and your good will this hard-working mother will be able to put her plans into action and improve the quality of life for her two young children.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El tejido siempre fue el oficio principal de los padres de Rebeca y ella no es ajena a este bello trabajo que con suma paciencia, diligencia y entusiasmo viene realizando y produciendo cada una de sus hermosas prendas de vestir que luego son enviadas en gran número a la ciudad de Lima para su comercialización. Gracias a los bellos diseños y a los finos acabados sus hermosas prendas de vestir son muy solicitadas en el mercado, es por ello que Rebeca tiene pensado comprar otra máquina te tejer y contratar personal para acrecentar el volumen de su producción.Con tu ayuda y su voluntad esta laboriosa madre concretará sus proyectos de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus 2 menores hijos.

loans.use: To purchase a weaving machine

loans.name: Ganijon

texts.en: Ganijon T. lives in Asht, Tajikistan, and raises livestock alongside his fellow villagers.  Having extensive experience in this field, Ganijon now owns two cows and one bull, and trades both the meat and milk from his animals.  Ganijon also works as a carpenter and contributes to his community's collective farms.  He is now applying for a $825 loan for six months to open a trading outlet in the market so that he can sell his meat and milk more effectively.

loans.use: To open a trade outlet to sell meat.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana A. K., 20, is single with no children. She has many years of experience in the ice cake business. She sells to the general public and villages 5 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Ana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will be able to use it for the business.

loans.use: Purchase plastic cups, flavor concentrate, sugar.

loans.name: Neysi Nadin

texts.es:
Neysi is requesting the loan to invest in the construction of a kitchen in her dwelling.

She has served as the Sales Executive of CURACAO for 5 years. She has 2 children. The oldest, age 8, is in second grade and she also has a baby of 4 months. Her husband works as a bus driver for public transportation.

Neysi is a hard-working, honest, and very responsible young woman with a lot of professional and work aspirations. At present she is studying in her third year of business administration in the Martin Luther University.

Her dream is to become a professional so that she can offer her small children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Neysi está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la construccion de una cocina en su vivienda.

Se desempeña como Ejecutiva de venta en la CURACAO desde hace 5 años, tiene 2 hijos, el mayor de 8 años estudia su 2do grado de educación primaria y una bebita de 4 meses, su esposo trabaja como chofer de bus de transporte colectivo.

Neysi es una joven muy responsable, honesta, trabajadora y con mucho deseos de superación profesional y laboral, actualmente está cursando su tercer año de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad Martin Lutero.

Su sueño es llegar a ser una profesional para ofrecerle a sus pequeños una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To build a kitchen in her house.

loans.name: Ilhama

texts.en: Ilhama lives in Khachmaz town. She was born in 1977. She is a widow with 2 children. She has been in the perfumery sales business for 4 years. Now she needs a loan of  $725 to buy the perfumes necessary for improving her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes for re-sale

loans.name: Leaso

texts.en:
Leaso V., 65, is widowed with eleven children. She has three years of experience in the popcorn business. She sells to schoolchildren and villagers three days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD. This loan would be used to buy ingredients such as corn seeds, drippings, plastic paper and pots.

Leaso expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (~$100 USD). SPBD loans are Leaso's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She has children who are working and helps with some of the family needs.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as corn seeds, dripping, plastic paper and pots

loans.name: Munavar

texts.ru: Джаборова Мунаввар жительница города Турсунзаде. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Возраст 39 лет.Работает на рынке «Саховат» в городе Душанбе. Занимается торговлей уже пять лет. Торгует женской одеждой. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев. Ее муж не работает . Поэтому вся ответственность лежит на ней и ей просто необходимо увеличивать и развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Munavar D. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 39 years old, married and has three children. She works at the Sahovat market in Dushanbe and has been in sales for five years. She sells women’s clothes. Her husband is unemployed; thus the responsibility of supporting the family and growing her business lies with Munavar. She plans to obtain the loan in order to increase goods turnover. She will be able to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.en:
Pascaline A. was born on March 26, 1970 in Allada, and she married an Oryx gas station attendant in Magbonde. She has four children and three currently in school and one too young for schooling. She began to sell phone cards after she gave up selling gas when the gas became too costly. She has lived in Cadjèhoun for 15 years. She is now awaiting her second loan to meet her consumers' growing demands.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

Translated from French:

Née le 26/03/1970 à Allada, elle est mariée à Magbonde (Agent à Oryx). Mère de 04 enfants dont 03 scolarisés et un pas encore en âge d’être scolarisé, elle mène cette activité depuis 01an après avoir laissé la vente de produits pétroliers qui ne coule plus correctement à cause de l’augmentation du prix. Elle réside à Cadjèhoun depuis 15 ans. Avec le premier crédit où elle a vu son activité accroître, elle sollicite un crédit de 100000 pour satisfaire à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase rechargeable cell phone cards and assorted other products.

loans.name: Juon

texts.en:
Mr. Juon S., 52, and his wife, Sin Vanna, 51, reside in Banteay Meanchey Province. The couple have four children, all of whom are single and assist with the family business. They both earn an income making cement jars which they sell from their home, as well as deliver to customers. To facilitate better transportation for their business, Mr. S. is requesting a loan to purchase a cultivating machine. The machine will assist to transport the jars more quickly and efficiently. 

Mr. S.'s wife is pictured because he was not available.

loans.use: To purchase a cultivating machine

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: T. is a rice farmer who lives in Churomseam Village in Pursat Province, Cambodia. Her husband is raising pigs to sell and has a rice mill to provide milling services in the village. The young couple does not yet have any children and works hard to generate revenues for their own family. Normally T.'s neighbors come to her house bringing rice to grind and she charges money or rice for her service. The business is going well but currently her rice mill is broken. Hence, T. needs a loan to purchase a new rice mill.

loans.use: to purchase a new rice mill

loans.name: Upendo I.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Upendo M. from Mbeya. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 10 and 19.

Upendo has been running a business selling clothes, plates, and maize since 1998. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her husband and her daughter. Upendo currently earns about $50 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $375 to increase her capital by purchasing more crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the stock and the range of her business. Upendo  thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To increase the capital by purchasing more crops in bulk

loans.name: Oumou Hawa

texts.fr: Oumou Hawa D., 53 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants  en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Vélingara Foulbé depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter du riz, des légumes, des poulets et des condiments pour renforcer son activité de restauration. Les repas sont vendus à la gare routière et à son domicile (sur une table). Ses revenus lui permettent  de prendre en charge les besoins familiaux en nourriture, santé etc. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Oumou Hawa D., age 53, is married and has four children to support. She has been a member of the village council of Vélingara Foulbé for two year and a half. She wants to buy some rice, vegetables, chickens, and condiments to bolster her food catering business. The meals are sold at the bus station and at her home (on a table). Her income enables her to meet family needs in terms of food, health, etc. She's requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice vegetables, chickens, etc. for catering

loans.name: Autonomos Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Este banco de emprendimiento se encuentra en su quinto ciclo esta conformado de 10 personas las cuales viven en la localidad de la Guardia.
MARISELA C. AÑEZ.- Es la presidenta del banco, vive en la localidad de la Guardia, en el barrio Victoria al frente de la guardería, vive encasa familiar.
Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos es promotora de; (yanbal, ebel, esica). Y además de eso también se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
su objetivo es aumentar su capital de trabajo y seguir estudiando quiere salir profesional para poder trabajar en su área, 
AURELIA C. F..-  Es la tesorera del banco de emprendimiento, de igual manera que las demás compañeras se encuentran en su quinto ciclo. Vive en el Barrio Victoria de la Localidad de la Guardia a 8 cuadras de l colegio nal. Cuenta con casa propia en la cual vive con sus 4 hijos.
La actividad a la cual se dedica es la venta de comida con el que viene trabajando hace aproximadamente 5 años con lo que mantiene a su familia.Quiere colocar una licorería.
MARY AÑEZ C..-  ella tiene el cargo de secretaria de actas en el banco comunal la cual de igual manera que las anteriores se encuentra en su quinto ciclo. 
Se dedica a la actividad de venta de cosméticos es promotora de la línea yanbal, ebel, esica. Lo cual realiza su actividad ambulando.
Vive en el Barrio Victoria de la plazuela en plena esquina alquila un cuarto el en cual vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo.
El esposo se dedica a la actividad de soldadura en la misma dirección de su domicilio actualmente solo es ayudante, pero están acumulando su capital apara colocar su propio taller se soldadura.
texts.en:
This entrepreneurial bank is in its fifth year of operation and composed of ten people who live in La Guardia. MARISELA C. AÑEZ is the president of the bank and lives with family in La Guardia in the neighborhood of Victoria in front of the nursery. She sells cosmetics for a line of products from Yanbal, Ebel and Esica. Aside from that, she also sells pop soda. Her objective is to increase her work capital and continue studying, as she'd like to be a professional and work in her area. AURELIA C. F. is treasurer at the bank, and like her colleagues, has been working there for five years. She lives in the neighborhood of Victoria in La Guardia, eight blocks from the school. She owns a home which she lives in with her four children. She supports her family through her food sale business, which she has been managing for approximately five years. She would like to open a liquor store. MARY AÑEZ C. is secretary at the communal bank and as her colleagues, has also been working there for five years. She sells cosmetics door-to-door for a line of products from Yanbal, Ebel and Esica. She lives in the neighborhood of Victoria and rents a small room in a corner home in which she resides with her husband and three children. Her husband is a welder by trade but currently assists in the house in which their home is located. However, they are saving money to open up their own welding shop.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase their work capital

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet B. is 60 years old. She is a married mother of five children. She says all five children are out of school and working. Janet lives with some of her grandchildren and husband in a family house in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
Janet is a trader. She trades in all kinds of hardware (fittings and fixtures) such as paint, carpenters hammer, nails, roofing sheets, hinges, and padlocks, to mention but a few. 
She procures the goods all the way from Accra. Janet sells in a shop in the market square in her community. She has been in business for 28 years and wants a loan to procure more goods. She is hoping to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure fittings and fixtures

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda S. dreams to uplift the poor living conditions of her family. She is now 55-years old and married to Freddie. Their marriage has been blessed with three children. All of them are high school graduates but they could not finance their studies in college because of financial difficulties.

Farming is their source of income. They plant vegetables and corn twice a year. Leonarda is hoping to borrow 10,000 PHP as additional capital for their farm. She will use the loan to purchase needed agricultural supplies for the improvement of their crops. They also plan to engage in the hog raising business as an additional source of income. They hope that they can increase their yield with the assistance of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies

loans.name: Talata

texts.en:
Talata is 35 years old, married and has five kids. She says four kids are pursuing education in primary and junior high schools. She lives with her family in their own house in Ejura, a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Talata S. sells foodstuffs. She sells plantain, cassava, yam, etc. on a tabletop in the community market. She buys her goods from farmers in the surrounding villages. She also distributes cassava and plantain to local chop bar (restaurant) operators. Talata works hard to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a farmer who cultivates food crops and all kinds of vegetables. 


She has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to buy foodstuff on a large scale so that she can cut down on the cost of frequent trips to procure goods. This will also maximize her profit to enable her support her kids education.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs in bulk

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
“Nowadays, we are struggling from economic crisis, and sometimes we felt hopeless,” said Virginia. But according to her, “be patient and you will survive”.

Virginia was only able to attend primary school when she was a child but she does everything she can to provide her family with a better standard of living. Virginia is determined to become a successful entrepreneur by being patient and hardworking. Virginina is married to Francisco A. Jr. and they live happily at Barangay Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya.

With regard to their source of work, Virginia manages a general store while her husband operates a tricycle transport business. With their daily income from their businesses, the couple is able to support the education of their child. Virginia is asking to borrow PHP 15,000 as additional working capital. She hopes her business can expand for their future welfare.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
“You will never achieve your goal unless you work for it,” says Irene I. of Barangay San Leonardo Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. After finishing her secondary education, she got married to Rey I.. They dreamed of building a happy family and a successful business. But having no stable job is difficult, says Irene but they are trying their very best to slowly achieve all their goals in life.

Irene manages a vending stall in their village, in front of their house. She wants to borrow PHP5,000 as additional working capital for their business. She hopes that with this financial assistance, and through hard work and patience, her dreams will turn to reality.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Najwa has owned a clothing shop for five years. She mainly sells women's and children's clothes. Najwa is outstanding in her work because she has competitive prices. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. When Najwa first started her business, she had financial issues. Najwa decide on this business because of her experience in sales and because she always wanted to have a shop of her own.

Najwa requested a loan of $500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase clothes for her shop for the summer. This is her second loan cycle and she has always paid on time. Her previous loan helped her improve her shop by diversifying her inventory. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Sainiso

texts.en: Sainiso, 39 years old, is a widowed mother with a daughter. She has worked at selling children’s clothing for six years. Sainiso rises very early to prepare her garments in the market. She works with much diligence to see her daughter happy and to ensure that in the future she’ll be a professional and a good and respectful person. Sainiso's objective is to grow her business, which is why she is requesting this loan in order to buy a larger quantity of merchandise. With your help she will achieve her goal in very little time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for kids in order to increase the range of her goods

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agness is a member of the Dodoma in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 43 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 20,18,8 years.she also cares for other 2 dependents.

 Agness started her own business selling charcoal 12 year ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Agness first loan from BRAC_Tanzania.She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Agness hopes to save more money,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Hilda es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Hilda tiene una tienda en donde vende ropa, el local es alquilado y se ubica cerca del mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo que también vende ropa en las ferias de la región.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y casacas.
Los sueños de Hilda son construir su casa y tener otra sucursal mas.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Despertar Community Bank. Hilda is 38, married, and has four children. Hilda has a store where she sells clothes. The place is rented, and it is located near the central market in the city of Ayacucho. She runs her business with the help of her husband. He also sells clothes in the regional fairs. Hilda needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy pants and jackets. Hilda’s dreams are to build her house and to have another branch.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants and jackets

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
K. Gulchehra has been selling groceries and beverages for more than 5 years. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Industrious and enterprising, Gulchehra is focused on expanding her business. Presently, she has a monthly income of about $100-$150. She is currently seeking a loan of $600 USD, which will help her to increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and expand her business. With the increased sales and profits, Gulchehra hopes to expand her grocery business and improve her family’s living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history. It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and expand her business

loans.name: Battumur

texts.en:
O. Battumur manages a raw material trading business in his town. He sells many animal products such as sheepskin. He lives with his wife and two children in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. His family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Both his son and daughter attend a local secondary school.

Battumur started his business in 2007 with capital of 500,000 tugrugs (~ $350 US). Even with only a few years of experience in his trade, he has established a stable operation and a good position in the business community. Today, his working capital exceeds 2,600,000 tugrugs (~ $1820 US). For the future, Battumur hopes to continue to grow his business and says, "My ultimate goal is to save enough money for my children's future." He is requesting a 2,600,000 tugrug (~ $1820 US) loan to purchase more raw materials in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Altyngul's Group

texts.ru:
Алтынгуль – лидер этой группы. Ей сорок три года. К этому возрасту  Алтынгуль вырастила троих детей. Старшему семнадцать, среднему пятнадцать и младшей дочке десять. Все они сейчас ходят в школу. Муж Алтынгуль – врач-реаниматолог. Сама же она занимается розничной торговлей пледов, одеял, и постельных комплектов. До того, как заняться предпринимательской деятельностью, у Алтынгуль уже был опыт в торговле, в качестве продавщицы. Семь лет назад, набравшись опыту и мужества, она всё-таки рискнула вложить все свои накопления в размере шестидесяти тысяч сом (KGS) на закупку товара. За это время её деятельность позволила ей обновить мебель в доме, купить бытовую технику и увеличить поголовье скота. Сейчас Алтынгуль зарабатывает около двенадцати тысяч сом в месяц. Алтынгуль прочно встала на ноги, и намеревается дальше развивать свой бизнес. Сейчас Алтынгуль нуждается в кредите, который бы ей позволил закупить новую партию постельного белья. Она хочет купить постельные комплекты нового ассортимента, так как это увеличило бы товарооборот и привлекло большее количество покупателей. По словам Алтынгуль, всё это она делает ради того, чтобы дать высшее образование дочери. Она мечтает о том, чтобы открыть второе место бизнеса и расширить бизнес. 

У Алтынгуль есть партнёры по группе:

Мээрим двадцать три. Она замужем и у неё один ребёнок.  Ему всего два года и девять месяцев. Муж работает внештатным работником ГАИ. Мээрим же работает в сетевом маркетинге. Она продаёт косметику от фирмы «Мэри Кэй».  Вначале она сама пользовалась косметикой этой фирмы, а впоследствии начала непосредственно сотрудничать с ними. Мээрим обратилась за кредитом с целью закупки нескольких видов теней, помад и духов.

Джумагуль пятьдесят три года. Она вдова и мать двоих детей. Младший сын находится на заработках в России, а старший живёт с ней и помогает в бизнесе. На жизнь, Джумагуль зарабатывает за счёт торговли продуктами питания. Она занимается этим уже десять лет и её месячный доход составляет около шестнадцати тысяч сомов. Джумагуль нужен кредит для того, чтобы закупить новую партию продуктов питания.

Венере сорок лет. Она замужем и у неё одна дочь. Дочке двадцать лет и она живёт отдельно от родителей. Венера уже на пенсии и подрабатывает гувернанткой. Так как отопительный сезон вот-вот начнётся, Венера решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы закупить на зиму угля. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Altyngul is the leader of this group. She is forty-three years old. By this age, Altyngul raised three children. Her oldest is seventeen, middle is fifteen and the youngest daughter is ten. All of them currently attend school. Altyngul’s husband is a critical-care physician. Altyngul is involved in retail sales of blankets, bed covers and bedding sets. Prior to starting her entrepreneurship, Altyngul already had experience in retail as a salesperson. Seven years ago, having gained experience and bravery, she decided to risk all of her savings in the sum of sixty thousand som (KGS) in order to purchase merchandise. Since that time, her business allowed her to update furniture at home, buy household appliances and increase livestock headcount. Now Altyngul earns approximately twelve thousand som per month. Altyngul solidly stands on her feet and intends to continue developing her business further. Currently, Altyngul needs a loan, which would enable her to purchase a new stock of bedding. She wants to buy a new selection of bedding sets because it will help increase goods turnover and attract a larger quantity of customers. According to Altyngul, she is doing all this in order to provide her daughter with higher education. She dreams of opening another business location and grow her business.

Altyngul has partners in this group:

Meerim is twenty-three years old. She is married and has one child, who is only two years and nine months old. Her husband works as a civilian police employee. Meerim works in network marketing. She sells cosmetics from Mary Kay. At first, she used to use Mary Kay cosmetics herself and then started to work with them directly. Meerim requested a loan in order to purchase several types of eye shadow, lipstick and perfume. Djumagul is fifty-three years old. She is a widow and a mother of two children. Her youngest son is working in Russia, and the oldest lives with her and helps with the business. Djumagul makes a living from sales of food products. She has been involved in this for ten years already, and her monthly income consists of approximately sixteen thousand som. Djumagul needs a loan in order to purchase a new stock of food products.

Venera is forty years old. She is married and has one daughter. Her daughter is twenty years old and lives separately from her parents. Venera is already retired and works part-time as a governess. Because the heating season is starting very soon, Venera decided to request a loan in order to purchase coal for the winter. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock of new bedding assortment to expand selection and attract more customers

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 41 years old and married to Cristomae, who is 42 years old and works as a vegetable farmer.  They have two children, Jervish John, a second-year college student, and Imee Flor, who is in her first year of high school.  

Imelda has been a vegetable vendor for 14 years.  Her business has been helped her earn the money needed to send her children to school and to provide them with a school allowance.  

She wants to expand her vegetable farm but she needs additional resources to buy seeds for planting so she can increase their harvest and earn more income.  She is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 for this purpose.  This way their family income will improve and also their way of living.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly E.’s business is not only supporting and sustaining the needs of her family but also her fellow small entrepreneurs in their village in a very remote municipality of Libertad in Antique province. Through a loan and the proceeds from her hog (pig) fattening business, she has been able to buy native mats manufactured in their village and bring them to market for sale. If she is not contented with her daily sales turnover in the market, she goes to other municipalities on their scheduled market day to sell.

Without much training, Sherly has able to develop an entrepreneurial skill and attitude within herself through practical experience, just like other poor women. She is determined to change their standard of living so that her 17-year-old only child can graduate from college. She will never surrender to the challenges poverty will bring her. Through loans she can access from ASHI and KIVA, she will be have an opportunity to grow and expand her hog fattening business until she has a piggery.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase piglets and food for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Charcoal

loans.name: Marlene Elizabeth

texts.es: Marlene Elizabeth G. de 23 años de edad, reside en Izalco en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante de productos varios, los cuales los comercializa de manera ambulante. Así también vive junto a sus dos pequeños hijos de 3 y dos años de edad. Marlene posee una venta de muchos productos como baterías, peines, ganchos para el cabello y otros más. Actualmente ella junto a su esposo están atravesando por un momento muy difícil ya que no cuenta con algunos de los servicios básicos en el hogar como el agua y la luz, debido a que no cuentan con el capital necesario para poder costearlos. Es por esto que Marlene solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda aumentar su inventario con productos como lámparas, calculadoras, radios y más. Todo esto con el fin de poder contar con ellos en esta época navideña de manera que sus ventas puedan ser muy buenas y así aumentar sus ganancias, lo cual lo desea mucho ya que espera poder mejorar su situación familiar.
texts.en:
Marlene Elizabeth G. is 23 years of age and lives in Izalco in the Sonsonate Department. She lives together with her husband, who works as a trader for various products, which he markets door to door. She also lives together with her two small children, 3 and 2 years of age. Marlene sells many products such as batteries, combs, hair clips and other things. She and her husband are actually passing through a difficult moment as they don't have some basic home services such as water and light, owing to the fact that they don't have the necessary capital to buy them. It is for this reason that Marlene is seeking a loan, with which she can expand her inventory with products such as lamps, calculators, radios and more. These will help them during the Christmas period as their sales can be very good and they can augment their earnings, which she greatly desires and hopes to be able to improve her family situation.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lamps, calculators and radios

loans.name: Ahotefo Group

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children. She lives with her husband and the children. Currently all her children are in the junior and the primary school level. She has been a local manufacturer of soap called Azuma Blows for five years now. Her soap is named after a former international boxer who is a Ghanaian with the name of Azuma Nelson. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil to obtain her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities due to lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She also sells local and rich kente cloth. She takes stock of kente from suppliers from Bonwire,  a home of kente. She hopes to raise her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and would be grateful for that support.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Ahotefo’, which literally means Saints. She is the one standing third from the left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders and food vendors respectively. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods and coconut oil etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 21 years old, is single, and he lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda, approximately two hours drive from the capital city of Kigali. His village is called Gakenke.

Samuel is a farmer of fruit. He is now requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business and satisfy his customers needs. He has an experience of five years in this field and starts his business activities from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. every day except on weekends.

After accessing this loan, Samuel will be able to change his business situation, which will allow him to earn more profits. With the extra profits, Samuel expects to get married.
 
By the way, Samuel has the will to succeed in his business, which is proof that he will progress in his activities.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Freria

texts.en:
Freria N. Simiyu is a 50-year-old widow living in Kwirare in Busia District with her five (5) children. Being a sole bread winner for her family, Freria abandoned farming, venturing into fish sales in 1990, which, according to her, generates more income than farming.

Just like any other business person, Freria would like to see her business expand so as to ensure economic stability for her family. This, and the knowledge she got from KMET on economic development, made her think of the possibility of financial assistance in the form of a loan. She would like to acquire a KES 20,000 loan that would be used to increase her stock so that she will earn more revenue.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 41-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children.

Yousef has been working as a car electrician since 1996. He is speciA. in his work because of his clean and clear work. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and also thanks to his experience. However, when he first started his business he passed through some financiA. issues. His clients are his friends and neighbors.

Yousef requested a loan from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to keep on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Lindaura

texts.es:
Lindaura tiene 40 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos, vive en casa de su hermana localizada en el distrito de Mórrope, un distrito cuya población se encuentra en su mayoria en zonas rurales y que está ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus menores hijos hizo que hace un año empezara un negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes, Lindaura los cría en jaulas, las cuales tiene instaladas en la parte posterior de la vivienda en donde vive y los vende a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. 

Anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como obrera agrícola, pero la necesidad de obtener una fuente estable de ingresos ha hecho que poco a poco le brinde mas tiempo a la crianza de sus cuyes, es así que en un año su cría ha aumentado considerablemente y ha tenido que invertir las ganancias de su negocio en la construcción de nuevas javas.

Lindaura desea comprar más alimento para mejorar la calidad de sus animales, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Lindaura es una mujer responsable y muy luchadora. Su mayor anhelo es ver convertidos a sus hijos en unos profesionales de éxito. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Lindaura is 40 years old, separated, and has two children. She lives at her sister’s house, which is located in the District of Mórrope. The inhabitants of this district mostly live in rural areas and can be found in the Province of Lambayeque, which is 30 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Lindaura needed for her children to get ahead, so she started a business a year ago of raising and selling guinea pigs. She keeps them in cages that she stores at the back of her home and sells them to dealers who frequent the area. Prior to this business, she worked as a farm laborer but the need to obtain a stable source of income made her gradually devote more to time to raising guinea pigs. Within a year, her business has grown considerably and she has plans to invest the earnings into building new cages.

Lindaura wants to buy more feed to improve the quality of her animals. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpymne Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN in order to meet this objective. Lindaura is a responsible and determined woman. Her greatest wish is to see her children become successful professionals. She has worked previously with our Institution and has demonstrated responsibility and punctuality when completing her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her guinea pigs

loans.name: Good People Group

texts.en:
Mai F. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Good People. She is 48 years old, married, and has four children aged 4 to 27. Mai did not have the opportunity to go to school.
For the past 25 years, Mai has been running her restaurant at the Red Light community in Paynesville, Liberia. She prepares her food very well and talks to customers in a nice manner, which keeps them returning. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 26,000 LRD group loan to purchase additional food for her restaurant. Her goal is to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mai is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional food for her restaurant

loans.name: Shittu

texts.en: Shittu, residing with her family in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria, is very hardworking and makes sure that she has food on the table everyday through her work selling clothing and school cardigans. In this business for over 15 years, she sells to many schools.  Shittu is 33 years old, married, and has two children, both doing well in school. She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to help her make the business more profitable and provide benefits for her children. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: To purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Srina's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srina C. is 30 years old. She is a widow with two children who are both too young to study or work. Mrs. Srina C. is the leader of group loan. She has been selected by 5-members, located in Rovieng village, in Takeo province. With the loans, they hope to increase income to improve their family living. Mrs. Srina C. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. For this farming, she decided to ask for a loan to hire farming laborers. Aside from farmer, she is a pig breeder and can earn a small income to support her family's cost of living.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to hire farming laborers.

loans.name: Las Progresistas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Progresistas  está ubicado en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca  capital de la provincia del Azuay, está situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana; es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador y se caracteriza por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999. En esta ocasion nos acompaña la niña de una de nuestras socias del banco.

La señora  Trancito Domínguez   tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos  que  se encuentran de 15, 13, 5 años, su primer hijo cursa la secundaria,  su segunda hija en la escuela y su último hijo esta en el jardín de infantes de la ciudad,  no recibe ningún apoyo por parte del padre de sus hijos y tampoco cuenta con  casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Trancito se dedica hace 5 años a realizar rehabilitaciones físicas, aprendió realizando tres años de cursos y también ha trabajado con un doctor especialista en traumatología, ahora labora desde su casa de 9 a.m. a 5 p.m. todos los días y también vende productos naturales para sus pacientes,  este es su primer crédito  en la fundación invitada por una amiga que ya pertenecía del bankito y con el comprará vitaminas, suplementos, proteínas, etc.

Su meta es de tener un centro naturista.

La  señora  María Juana  C.  tiene 70 años de edad, enviudó hace 35 años ya que a su difunto esposo le dio pulmonía, concibió cuatro hijos tres de ellos son casados  y viven en diferentes  partes de la ciudad, su otra hija falleció a causa   de una meningitis bacteriana dejando en la orfandad a dos niñas con quienes vive  en una casa arrendada en el sector  Yanuncay.

Doña Maria Juana  es negociante de ganado vacuno, cuyes y pollos   hace  ya 20 años y solo vende los días miércoles, jueves, sábados y domingos,  se     encuentra en su segundo ciclo en su banco comunal, con el   crédito anterior montó su negocio de animales y  ahora con su nuevo préstamo comprará crías de pollos, cuyes y alimento para incrementar su criadero hasta que dios le permita seguir con sus fuerzas.

Su mayor sueño es de tener una casa propia para su tranquilidad y de sus nietas.
texts.en:
The “Las Progresistas” (The Progressive Ones) communal bank is located in greater Cuenca, Azuay province capital, located in the southern part of the Ecuadorean Andes. It is Ecuador’s third most important city and noted for its tranquility and old city charm. Its historic city center was declared Patrimony of Humanity by Unesco in 1999. (On this occasion the daughter of one of our members accompanies us). Trancito Domínguez, 32, is a single mother of three children who are 15, 13 and 5 years old. Her oldest son is in middle school, her second daughter is in elementary school and her last son is in the city’s kindergarten. The children’s father does not provide any support and she also does not own her own home; she rents. She has been a physical therapist for the last five years; she took three year’s worth of course work and has also worked with a doctor who specializes in traumatology. Now, she works from home from 9am until 5pm every day and also sells natural products to her patients. This is her 1st loan with the foundation; she was invited to join by a girl friend who was already a member of the communal bank. She will use the funds to buy vitamins, nutritional supplements, proteins, etc. Her goal is to have a health spa. María Juana C., 70, was widowed 35 years ago; her husband died of pneumonia. She had four children, three of whom are married and live in other parts of the city. Her other daughter died due to bacterial meningitis leaving two orphaned daughters with whom she lives in a rented house in the Yanuncay neighborhood. María Juana has been a cattle, guinea-pig and chicken merchant for the last 20 years; she only sells on Wednesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays. This is her 2nd cycle with her communal bank. She used her previous loan to set up her animal business and will use this new loan to buy chicks, guinea-pigs and feed so that her animal nursery will continue growing as long as God gives her the strength to continue. Her greatest dream is to own her own house for her own and her granddaughters’ peace of mind.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vitamins, proteins, nutritional supplements, chicks, guinea-pigs and feed.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr: Monsieur Babacar B. est un habitant du quartier de Daroukhane. Il est âgé  de 34 ans et est membre de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis mai 2008. Il a déjà rembourse 2 prêts  antérieurs. Il est marie et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 4 et 7 ans. Monsieur B. est un électromécanique qui exerce aussi l’activité  de vente d’appareils portables. Après une formation théorique il a été embauche dans une entreprise de traitement de matière  plastique depuis 2008. Son salaire ne lui permettant pas de régler l’intégralité de ses charges familiales il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu  pour l’achat de portables qu’il va placer au niveau de ses collègues. Ces derniers   vont le payer a la fin du mois. Son financement va l’aider à renforcer son fond et avoir la capacité  de diversifier son commerce.
texts.en:
Mr. Babacar B. is a resident of the Daroukhane district. He is 34 years old and has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since May 2008. He has already repaid two previous loans. He is married and the father of two children, who are 4 and 7 years of age. Mr. B. is an electronics repairman who also has a business selling mobile phones. After some theoretical training, he was hired in 2008 by a company that processes plastics. His salary is not sufficient for covering all family expenses. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs for buying mobile phones. He will deliver these phones to his colleagues, who are going to pay him at the end of the month. His financing will help him to boost his capital and to have the ability to diversify his commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Boosting his capital

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita A., 48, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. She is married to Enrique A., a driver, and they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Amelita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.

To ensure the success of her business, Amelita would like to apply for a PHP 39,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries, toiletries and beverages to replenish and maintain her current inventory.

Amelita dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to replenish and maintain her current inventory

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin has been operating his retail business for the last three years. Previously he was working as a truck driver. The photo was taken at the main entrance of his shop. He sells retail in his community. The major challenge in his business is seasonality. Martin has another source of income from a side job driving commercial vehicles. He is a married man with a one year old child. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, Martin wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and a sack of rice and to expand his business.
